loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Adjovi K. est revendeuse de poissons depuis plus de 7 ans à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 42 ans, Adjovi est marié et mère de 4 enfants. Pour éviter les ruptures de stocks et améliorer son activité, Adjovi souhaite par ce crédit s’approvisionner en poissons afin de faire des livraisons en gros en outre des ventes en détails. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie.
texts.en:
Adjovi K. has been a retailer of fish for the past seven (7) years in Adeta, a village located approximately 150 kilometers for Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of four (4) children.

Adjovi is requesting this loan to prevent a depletion of her supplies and to increase her business. She will purchase supplies of fish to allow her to provide both wholesale deliveries and retail sales. She hopes that this opportunity will improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish for resale

loans.name: Codjo Jonas

texts.fr: G. Codjo Jonas est originaire du village lacustre de Ganvié. Né vers 1981 il eut un bref cursus scolaire jusqu'au cours moyen deuxième année où il fut contraint à l'abandon faute de moyens financiers suite au décès de sa tendre maman. Il allait à la pêche avec son père jusqu'à l'âge de 20 ans. Il fut embauché après comme agent d'entretien dans un motel de la place. C'est cela qu'il exerce actuellement. Il a découvert une opportunité de vente de crevettes aux exportateurs. Ce premier prêt qu'il sollicite  lui permettra de saisir cette opportunité. Il est père de trois enfants.
texts.en:
Codjo Jonas G. comes from the village Lacustre of Ganvié. Born around 1981, he attended school through 5th grade but at that point he had to leave his studies because of insufficient financial means due to the death of his dear mother. Until the age of 20, he worked at fishing with his father. After that, he got hired as cleaning staff at a nearby motel. This is his present job. He is the father of three children.

He has found an opportunity to sell shrimp to exporters. This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to seize this opportunity.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 15 kilos of shrimp

loans.name: Krut

texts.en:
Mr. Krut K., 64, and his wife, Mrs. Rab Aum, 58, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1969 and have seven children; two sons and five daughters. Two of their children are married; one of them lives in the family home. Two other children are garment factory workers. One son raises cows and the youngest one studies in a local school.

Mr. Krut has been a construction contractor for eight years. Beside the construction business, he and his wife have been farming since 1980. They grow rice to sell and for food. Currently, the couple is building their new house and lack the money to build the staircase of the house. Therefore, Krut is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to build a staircase for his house. Part of the money will go for purchasing a water pumping machine for growing rice.

loans.use: To build the staircase of his house and purchase a water pump for growing rice

loans.name: Missèbo Lucien

texts.fr: Originaire du  village lacustre de Ganvié, T. Missèbo Lucien est né le 29/05/1974 d'un pêcheur et d'une revendeuse de poissons. Il n'a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école. Tout petit, il fut initié à la pêche par son père et cela fait 25 ans déjà qu'il mène cette activité. Entre temps, il apprit la broderie qui constitue son activité secondaire. Ces derniers jours, il a eu l'opportunité de vente de crevettes aux armateurs. Il vient donc solliciter son premier prêt pour saisir cette opportunité. Il est marié et mère de deux enfants.
texts.en:
Originally from the lake village of Ganvié, Missèbo Lucien T. was born May 29th, 1974 to a fisherman and a fish retailer. He wasn't fortunate enough to go to school. When he was very young he started fishing with his father and has now been doing so for 25 years. In the meantime, he also learned embroidery, which constitutes his secondary business activity. Lately he has had the opportunity to sell shrimp to shipowners. He is thus seeking his first loan to take advantage of this opportunity. He is married and the father of two children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 15 kg of shrimp

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun O., 37, and her husband, Mr. Lorn Nao, 40, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh They were married in 1991 and have four daughters: the eldest daughter is married, two daughters are silk weavers, and the youngest one attends the local school.

Mrs. Savun O. has been a silk weaver for 17 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Currently Savun is teaching her third daughter (pictured with her) to become a silk weaver as well. Savun’s husband has been fishing and driving a horse cart for 21 years. He catches fish in the Mekong River for selling, and he uses the horse cart for carrying goods and people around the village. Now his horse is very old, and he needs to buy a new horse to replace the old one.

Therefore,  Savun is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy a horse for her husband and a new loom for her third daughter.

loans.use: To buy a horse for her husband and a new loom for her daughter.

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Mr. Lean N., 25, and his wife, Mrs. Chanhorn Soun, 25, live on an Island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2003 and have one son.

Mr. Lean has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill he learned from his sister, while Mrs. Chanhorn has been a silk weaver for eight years. The couple sells their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Lean is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: Dame G. Léa est née à Cotonou et est originaire de Zè dans le départemnt de l'Atlantique. Veuve de Batchéoumba Jean-Pierre (un colonnel) il y a neuf ans, elle a huit enfants.  Dame G. Léa  est revendeuse de divers articles de grande consommation: savons, eaux de toilettes, liqueurs, pâtes alimentaires, boîtes de conserves, etc. Au départ, elle vendait  les chaussures et pagnes au grand marché  Dantokpa de Cotonou. Suite au décès de son mari, elle cessa toute activité. Il y a trois ans, elle reprit son petit commerce en faisant cette fois-ci un changement d'activité. Le troisième crédit qu'elle sollicite maintenant  vise à consolider son étalage pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Léa G. was born in Cotonou and comes from Zè (Atlantique Department). She lost her husband, Colonel Jean-Pierre Batchéoumba, nine years ago and has eight children. Mrs. Léa G. resells various staples : soap, perfumes, liquor, pasta, canned food, etc. In the beginning, she used to sell shoes and pagnes (colorful African cloth) in the grand market Dantokpa in Cotonou. Following her husband's death, she stopped her business. Three years ago, she started her new business. The third loan she's seeking now aims at bolstering her inventory to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, 2 boxes of canned food, one box of pasta and 6 pieces of "Hitarget" pagne (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mr. Houn S., 22, and his wife, Mrs. Ret Pal, 22, live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for four months.

Mr. Houn has been a silk weaver for four years, a skill he learned from his sister, while Mrs. Ret has been a silk weaver for four years as well. She learned her skill from a villager. The couple sells their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Houn is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sambat's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Sambath (shown in picture on the left with her group members) was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including hers. The entire group are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Sambath T., 26, and her husband, Mr. Sopha Sun, were married in 2000 and have one daughter. Sambath has been a silk weaver since she was married, a skill she learned form her sister-in-law. Her husband is a construction worker. Sambath is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

2-Mrs. Phan S., 60, (shown in the picture on the right) and her husband, Mr. Soun Sun, 64, were married in 1970 and have two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married, one is a silk weaver, one is a tailor, and the youngest one is in school. Phan has been a silk weaver since she was thirty-five years old, a skill she learned form her mother. Her husband has been a mason since he was married. Now Phan is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Rous

texts.en:
Mrs. Rous C., 60, and her husband, Mr. Sok Ry, 63, live on an Island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1965 and have seven children; six sons and one daughter. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two sons raise cows, farm, and do construction work.

Mrs. Rous has been a silk weaver since 1960, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Sok does farming. He grows many types of vegetables on his farm near the village.

Rous is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Dado

texts.fr: Dado A. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de riz au marché de Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV augmenter la taille de son activité en achetant des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huiles et d’autres condiments nécessaires dans la restauration du riz. Ceci lui permettra de mieux gagner pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dado A., 45, is married and the mother of 5 children. She sells cooked rice at the market of Adeta, a village situated about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She hopes with this first loan through FECECAV to expand the size of her business by buying sacks of rice, jerry cans of oil and condiments necessary for selling cooked rice. This will allow her to earn more so as to better support her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing sacks of rice, jerry cans of oil, and condiments necessary for selling cooked rice

loans.name: Som-Ang

texts.en:
Mrs. Som-ang C., 54, is widow with seven children; three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son is married and lives outside the family home. The second son is a policeman, and the youngest son attends a local school. One daughter sells vegetables and meat, and the other three daughters study in a local school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Som-ang has been a silk weaver since 1968, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband died in early 2008. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase vegetables, meat, and fish for her daughter to sell in front of her house.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, meat, and fish to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov C. (pictured with his grandchildren), 58, and his wife, Mrs. Eng Rous, 54, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1972 and have seven daughters. Three of their daughters are married and live outside the family home. Three other daughters are silk weavers and the youngest one studies in the local school. His wife stays at home and takes care of the children.

Mr. Pov has been selling cows since 1982. He buys them from a farmer in a nearby village to resell in his village. He is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Rehema R.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Rehema T., who is married and has four children between the ages of 21 and 15 as well as two dependents who live with her because their parents are disabled. In 1993, Rehema established her crop-selling business. Working six days a week, and 9-12 hours a day, she earns about $80 every month from this business.

Rehema has already received and successfully repaid loans from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand and establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Hugues

texts.fr: Né  le 04/04/1978, T. Hugues est originaire de la ville historique de Ouidah. Il a fréquenté jusqu'au cours moyen deuxième année avant d'abandonner suite à l'incendie de son établissement. Il alla en apprentissage en 1992. Il se forma en tapisserie et en 1999 il eut son diplôme de fin d'apprentissage et se mit à son propre compte. Il commença par produire des meubles de tout genre, surtout des fauteuils bourrés pour la vente. Sa clientèle est constituée de certaines personnalités et de responsables de services de qui il reçoit régulièrement des commandes pour des livraisons de fauteuils et bureaux. Il livre ses commandes parfois sur fonds propres avant de se faire payer par ses clients. A cours de moyens financiers, il a eu recours à ALIDé pour l'obtention de son premier prêt. Marié, il est père de 2 enfants: Pascaline et  Lucrèce.
texts.en:
Born on April 4, 1978, Hugues T. is originally from the historic village of Ouida. He attended class through his second year of middle school when his business suffered a fire. He entered an apprenticeship in 1991 and got trained in upholstery. In 1999, he finished, was awarded his apprentice certificate, and set off on his own. He started by making furniture of all kinds, especially stuffed armchairs for sale. His customers are made up of certain well-known figures and service managers from whom he receives regular orders for the deliver of armchairs and desks. He sometimes delivers his orders using his own funds before getting paid by his customers. For financial means, he has turned to Alidé to obtain his first loan. Married, he is the father to two children: Pascaline and Lucrèce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 piece of lumber, 4 foam pads for armchairs, 25 meters of faux leather, and 2 cans of glue

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Mr. Chab L. (shown in the picture on the left with his group members) was selected to be the group leader by members of his group who are requesting a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including his. All the group members live along National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Chab L., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Khun, 47, married in 1979 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home. One child has full-time employment and other two children study in local schools. Chab has been a provincial officer for twenty-eight years, while his wife sells porridge at home. Now she wants to create another business selling grocery items. Therefore, Chab is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase grocery items for his wife to sell.

Mr. Chanthy Khon, 26, and his wife, Mrs. Manuch Cheav, married in 2004 and have one son and one daughter. Chanthy has been a motor taxi driver for one year, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for five years. Chanthy is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to roof his house. Mrs. Kim Chhum (show in the picture on the right), 54, is a widow with seven children: two sons and five daughters. Three of her daughters are married and live outside the family home and the other four children study in local schools. Kim has been raising cows for many years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to roof her cow pen and her house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for re-sale and repair their house

loans.name: Kpomone

texts.fr: Kpomone A. est âgée de 25 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Elle est revendeuse des habits et tissus à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Kpomone est une cliente fidèle de FECECAV puisqu’elle est à son troisième crédit et les remboursements sont toujours réguliers. Avec ce crédit, elle désire augmenter le stock de ses marchandises et procéder aussi à des livraisons en gros. Elle compte sur cette chance pour mieux supporter son petit frère qui est sur les bancs de l’école
texts.en:
Kpomone A. is 25 years old, single, and has no children. She is a retailer of clothing and fabrics in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Kpomone is a loyal customer of FECECAV, since she is on her third loan and always makes her payments regularly. With this loan, she would like to increase her stock of merchandise and also to carry out bulk deliveries. She intends to use this opportunity to better support her younger brother, who is in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, leggings, and underwear

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim N. (shown in the picture while making the roof of his boat), 46, and his wife, Mrs. Doem Chun, 46, live along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have six sons. Three of their sons have full-time employment, and the other three study in a local school and help with the fishing business.

Mr. Sim has been fishing for almost twenty years. He works in Tonle Sab River and the lake behind the village and sells to villagers. His wife is assisting him in the business and takes care of the children. Sim needs a boat machine to fish in this season. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a boat machine for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a part for his boat

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun C., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sophan Soy, 27,  live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have two daughters; one of them attends school. 

Mr. Bunthoeun has been a silk weaver since 2006, a skill he learned from his wife. He is also a soldier. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old, a skill she learned from her aunt. The couple sells their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes their goods to sell in Phnom Penh.

Bunthoeun is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Salla M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Salla L., who is married and has two children aged 12 and 10. In 2008, Salla established her butchery business. Assisted by her husband, she opens her business seven days a week, 9-12 hours a day. Salla is requesting a loan in order to purchase more cattle, and in the future plans to establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Née à Savalou dans les Collines au centre du  Bénin, dame Y. Odette est originaire de la même ville. Elle a 33 ans révolus et est mariée à Agbloba Norbert, employé comme pointeur par une société de manutention portuaire. Elle a quatre enfants dont Euloge, l'aîné, est en classe se quatrième au cours secondaire. Dame Y. Odette est revendeuse de farine de manioc, de maïs et d'huile végétale. Elle  mène cette activité depuis 15 ans. Elle achète  en gros ses  marchandises qu'elle revend au détail et à crédit à sa clientèle, puis elle récupère ses fonds par quinzaine. Pour consolider son activité, elle songe à y ajouter la vente de mil. C'est dans ce sens qu'elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 100000 F CFA.
texts.en:
Born in Savalou, in the Collines region in the center of Bénin, Ms. Odette Y. is a native of the same town. She is over 33 years old and married to Norbert Agbloba, who is employed as a time-keeper by a longshoring company. She has four children, including Euloge, the eldest, who is in the 8th grade. Ms. Odette Y. is a retailer of cassava flour, corn, and vegetable oil. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She buys her merchandise wholesale and sells it retail, on credit, collecting payment every two weeks or so. To strengthen her business, she is thinking about adding millet to her sales. To pursue this path, she is requesting this third loan of 100,000 francs CFA.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 sacs of millet and 5 basins of cassava flour

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is forty-three-year-old Anna S. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of five and twenty-three. Anna has been running a cloth business since 2006. She sells traditional African cloth that her customers use to make dresses. Anna currently earns about US$ 300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional stock of cloth. Anna thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell clothes, undergarments and boxer shorts

loans.name: Alesi D.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Alesi M.. She is married and has one child, age 2. In 2007, Alesi established her retail shop business. She opens her shop six days a week, 9-12 hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Alesi requires a loan in order to purchase more sugar, salt, rice, and home appliances in bulk. In the future, Alesi plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, rice and home appliances in bulk.

loans.name: Djémilath

texts.fr: Dame SAÏBOU Djémilath est née le 31/03/1956 à Cotonou. Elle abandonna volontairement les classes au cours élémentaire première année pour aider sa maman à vendre car elle a trouvé sa vocation dans le commerce. Puis, elle fit l'apprentissage en layette. Finalement, elle a préféré le commerce. Elle a commencé par vendre alors les foulards, tissus, pagnes et aussi la layette. Mais, il y a 16 ans, elle changea d'activité et se mit à vendre les petites pièces de rechange pour moto ainsi que d'huile moteur. Pour renforcer la vente d'huile moteur et aussi vendre  des cadenas, elle a sollicité ce troisième crédit. Dame SAÏBOU Djémilath est mariée à CHANOU Ahmed, un revendeur de disque audio. Elle a 6 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djémilath S. was born on March 31, 1956 in Cotonou. She freely left off her schooling after her early primary years to help her mother with sales because she had found her vocation in commerce. Then, she undertook an apprenticeship in making babywear. In the end, she found that she preferred selling.

She began by selling scarves, cloth, "pagnes" (lengths of colorful traditional African prints) and also babywear. However, 16 years ago, she changed businesses and began selling small spare parts for motorcycles as well as motor oil. To bolster her business selling motor oil and also to be able to sell padlocks, she is requesting this third loan. Mrs. Djémilath S. is married to Ahmed Chanou, who sells audio disks. She has 6 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 50 liters of motor oil, a case of brake oil, and 30 padlocks

loans.name: Angela P.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Angela C.. She is married and has two children aged 6 and 1. In 2004, Angela established her bicycle spare parts business. Working 7 days a week and 13 - 16 hours a day, she earns about US$ 380 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Angela requires a loan in order to purchase more spare parts in bulk. In the future, Angela plans to expand and establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment--a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok P. (pictured with her fishing nets and her group member is not in the picture) was selected to be a group leader by the members of her group. The group includes two families. All the group members live along National Road 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Sok P., 54, and her husband, Mr. Hin Hun, 56, were married in 1969 and have seven children; four sons and three daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home. One son is a fisherman, one is a construction worker, and the youngest son is a garment factory worker. Sok has been selling fish for 2 years. She is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase fishing net for her son who fishes.

2-Mr. Rat E. (not in the picture because he busy with his fishing business at the lake for from village), 35, and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Phun, 35, were married in 1994 and have one son and one daughter. Rat has been a fisherman for 10 years, and his wife is a cleaner in one hotel. Rat is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase one boat and fishing nets.

loans.use: Purchase a boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Afflèhoun

texts.fr: Dame N. Afflèhoun est originaire de Porto Novo la capitale du Bénin. Née il y a 40 ans, elle est mariée au pêcheur HOUNMENOU Atchibaré et est mère de 4 enfants: Jacques, Julien, Jules et Crespin. Très tôt, elle  a commencé le commerce  avec l'aide de sa maman revendeuse de pâte de maïs bouillie. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de poissons fumés et frits. Elle s'approvisionne souvent sur la berge de la lagune de Cotonou non loin de chez elle. Elle souhaiterait augmenter son capital  et renforcer ainsi son activité avec sa clientèle qui au jour le jour s'accroît et manifeste de nouvelles préférences. Dame N. Afflèhoun est à son sixième crédit à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afflehoun N. came originally from Porto Novo, the capital of Benin. She is 40 years old, married to a fisherman, Atchibare Hounmenou, and is a mother to four (4) children: Jacques, Julien, Jules and Crespin. Very soon, she will start a new business activity selling boiled corn dough, with the assistance of her mother. She now specializes in the sale of both smoked and fried fish. She often buys her supplies along the banks of the Cotonou lagoon not far from her home. This loan request is intended to increase her funds to support her business and meet the changing needs of her customers. Mrs. Afflehoun N. is making her sixth loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 25 liters of oil and 20 kilograms of fish

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.fr: Mathilde K. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et  mère de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Elle tient bientôt un an, une baraque à Adeta, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire par ce crédit, le premier à FECECAV, d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huiles alimentaires, des cartons de laits et des boîtes de conserves et aussi louer un magasin. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mathilde K., age 38, is married and the mother of two school-attending children. For almost one year, she's been having a shop in Adeta, a village located approximately 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, her first with FECECAV, she wants to bolster her business by purchasing sacks of rice, cans of cooking oil, boxes of milk and canned food. She also wants to rent a shop. She counts on this opportunity to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, cans of cooking oil, boxes of milk, canned food, and to rent a shop

loans.name: Sdoeng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sdoeng K. (show in the picture on the right) was selected to be a group leader by the members for a loan from Maxima. Included in the group are two families. All of the group members are living along National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Sdoeng K., 42, and her husband, Mr. SoP. Net, 45, were married in 1993 and have three daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home. The other two daughters study in the local school. Sdoeng and her husband have been fishing for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase one boat for fishing. 2-Mrs. Sreytoch P. (show in the picture on the left), 24, and her husband, Mr. Heang Heng, were married in 2002 and have two sons and one daughter. Sreytoch and her husband have been fishing for five years. Sreytoch is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase one boat and fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase boats and fishing nets.

loans.name: Mary K.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Mary M.. She is married and has three children aged 29, 26 and 16. In 2003, Mary established her farm supplies business. She opens her business six days a week and 9 - 12 hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more farm supplies in bulk. In the future, Mary plans to estabilsh another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment--a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more farm supplies in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Mary I.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Mary N.. She is married and has four children aged between 20 and 8. In 2006, Mary established her Café/mama lishe business. She opens her business six days a week, and 9 - 12 hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more rice, sugar, salt, and cooking oil in bulk. In the future, Mary plans to expand and establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is 'restaurant' or 'café', you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don't even appear in the Lonely Planet's budget guide, but if you're looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar,  salt and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Rafiou

texts.fr: Rafiou D. est âgé de 38 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Il tient une boutique d’alimentation générale, depuis 5 ans, à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère par ce crédit, acheter des cartons de boîtes de conserves, des sacs de riz et des fournitures de bureau pour la revente. Cette occasion lui permettra de mieux gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Rafiou D. is 38 years old, married, and the father of two children, who are all in school. He has been running a grocery for five years in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He hopes to use this loan to buy boxes of canned goods, sacks of rice, and office supplies for resale. This opportunity will enable him to earn a better living.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of canned food, sacks of rice, and office supplies for resale

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mr. Sokun C. (not in the picture), 52, and his wife, Mrs. Soklay Hout (shown in the picture with new house), 46, who live in a small village along National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1980 and have eight children: one son and seven daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. One child has full-time employment and the other four children study in local schools.

Mr. Sokun has been a mason for twelve years, while his wife does housework and takes care of their children. The couple is building their new house but lack the money to roof the house. Therefore, Sokun is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to roof his house.

loans.use: To roof his new house

loans.name: Monica B.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania!

This is 39 year-old Monica M.. She is a widow with no children. She has two dependents, both orphans, who live with her. In 2007, Monica established her crop selling business. She opens her business six days a week, and 9 - 12 hours a day. Monica requires a loan in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, Monica plans to start another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Née vers 1958 à Cotonou, Dame A. Micheline  est veuve depuis 6  mois environ. Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont 2 sont  encore à sa charge car mineurs. Depuis son adolescence, elle a commencé à acheter du poisson qu'elle fait frire et revend au grand marché Dantokpa de Cotonou pour gagner sa vie. Au fil des années, son petit  commerce  a pris d'ampleur . Elle sollicite ce sixième crédit pour davantage accroître sa part de marché en touchant de nouveaux clients. D'ailleurs, elle dispose pour la distribution de deux jeunes dames, qui sont ses nièces dont elle a la charge.
texts.en:
Born around 1958 in Cotonou, Ms. Micheline A. has been a widow for about six months. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are still dependents of hers because they are minors. As an adolescent, she began selling fish, which she fries and sells at the grand marketplace Dantokpa of Cotonou in order to earn a living. Over the years, her small-scale business has become sizable. She is requesting this sixth loan to grow her market share even more by reaching new customers. In addition, she has two young women, her nieces who are in her care, for distributing goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three boxes of frozen fish, and 75 liters of vegetable oil

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Mr. Hean K., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Yeng Soy, 41, live in a small village across Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1992 and have four children; three sons and one daughter. Two of their sons are workers and the other two children study in local school.

Mr. Hean and his wife have been growing rice for 20 years. In addition to growing rice, Hean has been a mason for three years as well. The couple needs to buy another plot of land to expand their rice field but they lack the money.

Therefore, Hean is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase another plot of land for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for growing rice.

loans.name: Mariam M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania!

This is 45-year-old Mariam H.. She is married, and has four children aged between 10 and 32. In 2004, Mariam established her phone/voucher business. She opens her business 7 days a week, and 9-12 hours a day. She is assisted by her children. Mariam requires a loan in order to purchase more vouchers in bulk. In the future, Mariam plans to expand and establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment--a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more vouchers in bulk.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary N., 43, and her husband, Mr. Soeun Im, 48, live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have six children; four sons and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory workers and other five children study in the local school.

Mrs. Nary has been growing mushrooms for sixteen years. Her husband has been fishing for nineteen years. Besides growing mushrooms and fishing, the couple has been growing rice since they were married.

Nary is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhim C., 26, and her husband, Mr. Tha Set, 27, live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. 

Mrs. Sokhim has been selling vegetables for almost two years. She buys them from Udong Market for resale at Prek Phnao Market. Mr. Tha has been fishing in the Tonle Sab River and the lake behind the village and selling the fish to the villagers for eight years. Besides fishing, he also raises cows as well. Therefore, Sokhim is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to purchase a boat and a cow for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and a cow

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally C., 39, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Phai, 39, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in the local school.

Mrs. Phally has been selling grocery items since 2005. She buys them from Korky market for resale at her home. Her husband has been a policeman since 1990 and has been motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh since 1995. He drives his motor taxi when he is free from his work. Currently, the couple is in the process of building their new house and lacks the money to finish it.

Therefore, Phally is requesting a loan of $1000 to finish her house and buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and to finish her house.

loans.name: Djidjoho

texts.fr: Âgée de 33 ans, dame N. Djidjoho  est née à Cotonou et est originaire de Porto-Novo. Elle n'a  jamais été à l'école. Toute petite, elle a voulu faire du commerce et très vite elle se mit à vendre du poisson frit ou fumé. Cela a constitué  son activité principale depuis toujours même si par moment elle s'adonne à la vente d'articles divers dont les pâtes alimentaires et les boîtes de conserve. Elle sollicite son sixième prêt pour acheter 75 litres d'huile végétale et 4 cartons de poissons congelés de sorte à accroître son chiffre d'affaire journalier. Mariée à Clément ZINSOU TCHETAN un tailleur, dame N.  Djidjoho a 5 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djidjoho N., 33, was born in Cotonou and is originally from Porto-Novo. She has never been to school. As a young girl, she wanted to become a business person, and she very soon began selling fried or smoked fish. That has always been her main business endeavor, although from time to time she has sold various articles, among others pasta and tinned goods.

She is asking for this, her sixth loan, to buy 75 liters of vegetable oil and 4 cases of frozen fish so as to grow her daily turnover. Married to Clément Zinsou Tchetan, who is a tailor, Mrs. Djidjoho N. has 5 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 4 cases of frozen fish and 75 liters of vegetable oil

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy M., 30, is a SELFINA client. She is married with one child aged 8 years old. She also has one more dependent because she is an orphan. Emmy has been running her bar business since 2006. She sells beer, soda, wine, and drinking water. She is making a monthly profit of US$ 450 from this business. Emmy is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional stocks of beer, soda, wine, and pure drinking water. She has got one employee to help her. In future she plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer, soda, wine, and pure drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in jewelry in order to increase her income and strengthen her business.

loans.name: Mwanvua

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Mwamvua Matwi from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child aged 13. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Mwamvua has been running a shop where she sells shoes and hand bags since 2007. This SELFINA client's business is doing well. She works at the business for 8 hours per day and is assisted by one employee. Mwamvua currently earns about US$ 50 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 250 in order to purchase an additional stock of hand bags and shoes. In the future, she plans to open another business.

She thanks you for your support! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of shoes and hand bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Invest in jewelry to increase income and improve the standard of living

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
This is Emiliana M. who is 33 years old. She is married with three children between 8 and 19. She sells soft drinks such as sodas and drinking water. Neighbors and people who are passing through the place are her main customers. She started this business in 2007.

Emiliana is currently earning a monthly profit of US$ 100 from this business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 275 in order to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and pure drinking water. In future she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future. .

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Praxeda

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 42-year-old Praxeda M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 9 and 16. Praxeda has been running a snacks business since 2003. She prepares snacks such as chapati and sells them to people around her area.. She works at the business for 5 hours per day, 6 days per week and she is assisted by two employees. Praxeda R Mkandalara currently earns about $200 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 in order to buy wheat flower, cooking oil and other raw material for making snacks. In the future, she plans to renovate her business building and to establish a new business.

Praxeda thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour, cooking, and other raw material for making sandwiches.

loans.name: Margaret Nayiga 's Group

texts.en:
The leader of a five-member group, 33-year-old Margaret is divorced and the mother of three children between the ages of 17 and 7, all of whom go to school She owns a two roomed house where she lives with four people. There is no electricity or water at her home. Margaret's monthly expenses include school fees and daily transport costs to and from home.

Residing in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, Margaret works in Owino market selling second hand baby clothes, a business she has operated for three years, profitable due to the high demand. She sells to an average of 10 people a day, and works five days a week

Margaret's main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season which makes storage difficult. During the rainy season she sells door to door. She has been with MCDT for two years, working all that time with the same group members. Margaret’s is currently requesting a loan in order to increase her business stock and build rental rooms. .

loans.use: To incease her business stock and build rental rooms

loans.name: Shela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38 year old Shella K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 18. Shella K. has been running a tailoring business since 2003. Her business is doing very well. She works at the business for four hours a day, 6 days a week. Shella K. currently earns about $200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 USD to purchase additional cloth and other sewing materials such as thread. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

Shella K. thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cloth.

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry K. is a married woman who is 34 years old with three children aged between 7 and 14. Marry has two other dependents who are not her children. They depend on her because they are schooling in the area. She has been running a shop for three years. She usually sells sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. She earns about US$ 640 from this business.

Marry is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her store. She works for 10 hours per day and six days per week. In future she plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil. etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35 year old Grace P. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children, ages 7 years and 16 years. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant boy because his parents cannot take care of him. Grace  P. has been running an auto supply shop business since 2005. The business is doing fine. She works at the business 9 hours a day, 6 days a week. Grace  P. currently earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 to buy machine lubricants, machine oil, and other auto spares. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy machine lubricants, machine oil, and other auto spares.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
This is Khadija M. who is 50 years old. She is a widow with two grown children. She has two other dependants who depend on her because their parents cannot take care of them. She has been selling traditional African cloths called vitenge and kanga for about 5 years now. Khadija buys the traditional African cloths from the wholesaler and then she resells them. Currently she is making a monthly profit of about $90 USD. Khadija is requesting a loan of $450 USD to purchase additional stock of traditional African cloths. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Ndate

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ndate T. est agee de trente deux ans et fait du commerce depuis sept ans. Elle vend des produits divers d'alimentation générale dans la maison parternelle sise à Ngouye Sombel
texts.en:
Miss Ndate T. is 32 years old and has been working in commerce for seven years. She sells various food items in her father's house located in Ngouye Sombel.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell general food items

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina runs a small business selling denim clothing for women. She is married with two grown daughters. In 2007, Valentina was faced with tough circumstances; she was diagnosed with cancer. Her husband left the family, and she had to fight the disease herself. However, she didn't get desperate. She decided to trust God with her life. Today her family circumstances have stabilized. Valentina's husband returned to the family. Her daughters got settled in life. Today Valentina has about $2,000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1000. She is making about $400 in profit each month.

Valentina has been in the clothing business for over 10 years and has partnered with Nadiya Ukraine for 7 years. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain a loyal clientele. Currently, Valentina has two vending locations. Valentina would like to receive a loan for 5000 Grivnas to serve as working capital in her business. Financial assistance will help her purchase an assortment of denim wear. High-quality, durable, and comfortable merchandise will sell well and will help Valentina's business grow, especially this fall season.

loans.use: To increase stock before the fall season

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is single. He runs a small business selling linen sheets in a store located in the central city market. Sergyi is a young and eager entrepreneur. He started this business only a year ago. However, he has already invested about $8,000 in inventory. He is currently making about $600 in profit.

Sergyi is hoping to get a stable standing in life to be able to provide not only for himself, but for his potential family, as well. Sergyi's mother is an entrepreneur working in the same sphere of trade. He can always rely on her advice and experience as he is making his first steps on this extremely risky business path. Sergyi is seeking a 5000-Grivna loan to increase his turnover capital and move further with his business expansion plans.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 45-year-old Magreth K. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with two children, between the ages of 19 years and 27 years. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Magreth K. has been running a banana business since 1983. She buys bananas from farmers and take them to town where many people like to buy them. Her business is doing good. She works at the business for 4 hours per day, 6 days per week and she is assisted by one employee. Magreth K. currently earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock of bananas. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

Magreth thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of bananas.

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna sells household items in Belaya Tserkov, in a local market called Belotserkivets. She is the only vendor offering this type of product in that neighborhood. Ivanna started her enterprise about 10 years ago when she became a widow and couldn't live on the retirement pay she received. Presently, she has about $12,000 invested in merchandise. Her net profit is about $800 a month. 

Ivanna would like to invest a 3000-Grivna loan in reconstruction of her vending facility. She is hoping to see her business flourish and bring her a more sufficient income. Ivanna is planning to use part of the profit generated to finish construction of her house, which has been quite a lengthy process. Ivanna is a strategic planner, and we believe this quality will help her keep moving towards her business and personal goals. 

Note: This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To finish reconstruction of her vending facility

loans.name: Marcial Salvador

texts.es: Don Marcial tiene 57 años de edad,  es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ha estado involucrado en el negocio de las ventas desde hace 31 años. Su esposa también es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y zapatos. Juntos procrearon seis hijos tres varones y tres mujeres,  los cuales ya son independientes. Empezó trabajando en destace de res, era un negocio bastante rentable,  pero luego las ventas se pusieron  bajas y no estaba generando ganancias, esta inversión que tenia era con dinero propio,  desde ahí toma la iniciativa de cambiar su negocio a venta de zapatos y comenta que le ha ido bien. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en compra de zapatos deportivos y zapatillas, para no desmejorar la buena oferta que siempre le ha dado a sus clientes, espera poder continuar con este negocio por muchos años más.
texts.en:
Don Marcial is 57 years old and is a merchant who sells shoes. He has been involved in sales for the past 31 years. His wife is also a merchant who sells dairy products and shoes. Together they have raised six children -3 boys and 3 girls- who are now all independent. He began working as a butcher, which was a very profitable business, but later on sales fell and he was not generating any income. This was a business that he had invested in with his own money. After that, he took the initiative to change over to selling shoes and he says that this has gone well. This loan application is to invest in buying different types of sport shoes so as not to diminish the wide selection he has always offered his customers, and he hopes to be able to continue in the business for many more years.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different types of sport shoes

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Dame T. Félicienne est dans la vente d'igname, des oignons et des cossettes d'igname depuis une dizaine d'années. Elle vend également des condimlents aux habitants de son quartier. Elle se rend généralement au  grand marché Tokpa pour ses achats. Elle envisage très prochainement se rendre au nord du pays pour faire de plus importante achats. Agée de 34 ans, elle est originaire de  Savè dans le département des Collines. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Félicienne T. has been selling yams, onions, and yam cossettes (sun-dried slices of yams) for a dozen years. She also sells condiments to the residents of her district. She generally goes to the Tokpa marketplace for her purchases. She very soon envisions going up north to make more sizable purchases. She is 34 years old and originally from Savè, in the county of Collines. She has come to request this loan to bolster her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 kg of yams and 2 sacks of onions

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou D. habite au quartier Cité Lamy.Elle est agée de trente huit ans et mere de trois enfants.Elle vend des tissus depuis un an.Elle s'approvisionne à Touba ou à Dakar
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou D. lives in the Cité Lamy neighborhood. She is 38 and the mother of three children. She has been selling cloth for a year. She buys her merchandise at Touba or in Dakar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of cloth

loans.name: Levy Abdiel

texts.es: El cliente Levy Abdiel  está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Cambiarle el zinc a la casa), trabaja como docente de la Escuela Miguel Larreynaga en colonia el Serrano a 25 km de Nueva Guinea,  desde hace 7 años.  Tiene 1 hija de 8 años de edad, estudia su 3er grado de Educación primaria en la colonia Yolaina. Actuamente él esta estudiando su segundo año  en la Univesidad  URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Poco a poco a ido construido su vivienda , él se siente agradecido con AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha ido mejorando su casa. Su esposa trabaja como docente y le apoya con los gastos familiares,  su sueño es seguir  estudiando,  tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, salud  y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The client Levy Abdiel is asking for a loan in order to invest it in bettering his life (To change the zinc of the house). He works as a teacher in the Miguel Larreynaga school in the community of Serrano, 25 km from Nueva Guinea, where he has been for 7 years. He has one daughter who is 8 years old. She is studying in 3rd grade of the primary school in the town of Yolaina. At the moment, he is studying in his second year at the University URACCAN Recinto, Nueva Guinea. Little by little he is able to improve his home. He feels grateful to AFODENIC because with the loans he has taken out in the past he has improved his house. His wife works as a teacher and helps with the family expenses. His dream is to continue studying, to have a home in a better condition, health, and work stability such that he can help his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change the zinc on his home

loans.name: Flora Del Socorro

texts.es: Flora C. tiene dos hijos  y un nieto, los que son sostenidos en todos sus gastos por ella, aunque tiene su marido que la apoya, ella con la ganancia de su negocio colabora en los gastos del hogar; Flora es comerciante tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación y también se dedica a la venta de opa usada, estos dos negocios le generan los ingresoso para la manutención de su familia. El credito solicitado es para el mejoramiento del negocio con adquisicion de materiales y productos, como granos básicos y asi mostrar una mejor presentacion y calidad del servicio que brinda.
texts.en:
Flora C. has two children and a grandson whose living expenses are entirely supported by her. Although she has a husband who helps her, she contributes to houshold expenses with the earnings from her business. Flora is a shopkeeper who has a small convenience store in her house and she also sells used clothing. These two businesses generate income to maintain the family. The loan she requests it so improve the business by buying supplies and products such as basic grains, and in this way to show that she offers better goods and quality of service.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic goods for her business

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr: Mana T. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de d’assiettes et des ustensiles de cuisines à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère avec ce crédit, le troisième de FECECAv, acheter des bassines et des ustensiles de cuisine pour la revente. Cette chance lui permettra de mieux gager sa vie.
texts.en:
Mana T. is 38 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She resells plates and cookware in Adeta, a village located approximately 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, her third with FECECAV, she intends to buy and resell plastic basins and cookware, which will enable her to make a better living.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell plastic basins and cookware

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.fr: Mathilde T. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Mathilde est à son troisième crédit et les remboursements sont toujours réguliers. Elle espère avec ce crédit acheter des pages et des tissus pour la revente. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mathilde T. is 42 years old and the mother of 5 children. She's a pagne (colorful African cloth) reseller in Adeta, a village located approximately 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. This is Mathilde's third loan, and repayments were always made on time. With this loan, she hopes to buy pagnes and fabric for reselling. This opportunity will enable her to better provide for her children's needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes (colorful African cloth) and fabrics

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Née le 23 avril 1973 à Cotonou, dame A. Florence réside avec sa petite famille à Kowégbo depuis environ dix ans. Elle est mariée à AGOSSA Thierry, soudeur de son état et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre scolarisés.  Actuellement vendeuse de pagnes et de chaussures, elle a embrassé nombreuses activités par le passé. Coiffeuse de profession, elle s’était lancée très tôt dans la vente ambulante de riz. En décembre 2006, elle vint contracter son premier crédit d’un montant de 40000 F CFA afin de renforcer son capital. Avec ce crédit, elle a  réalisé des économies suffisantes. Envisageant de commencer par acheter au marché de Dantokpa des produits de beauté et peu à peu des pagnes, elle sollicita pour son troisième crédit un montant de 50000 F CFA. Grâce à sa méthode de distribution, elle s’est déjà fait beaucoup de clients et a une bonne assise dans le domaine de vente de pagnes. Elle veut maintenant contracter son cinquième crédit et demande pour cela un montant de 120000 F CFA.
texts.en:
Born on April 23, 1973, Ms. Florence A. has been residing with her small family in Kowégbo for about 10 years. She is married to Thierry AGOSSA, a welder, and is the mother of five children, four of whom are in school. Currently a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and shoes, she has embraced numerous kinds of work in the past. A hairdresser by profession, she had gotten started very early on selling rice door-to-door. In December 2006, she came to sign her first loan contract for the amount of 40,000 francs CFA in order to bolster her capital. With this loan, she realized sufficient savings. With a plan for commerce in beauty products and, little by little, pagnes purchased at the Dantokpa marketplace, she requested as her third loan the amount of 50,000 francs. Thanks to her distribution method, she has so far procured many customers and a good foundation in the domain of selling pagnes. She nows wants to sign her fifth loan contract and is asking for the amount of 120,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lengths of pagnes, pairs of shoe, and boxes of soap and detergent

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Dame L. Justine  est née le 26/08/1963 à Pahou et mariée à MITO Cosme agent comptable à ECDRA une Société privée de la place. Le couple a à sa charge quatre  enfants tous scolarisés. Dame L. Justine réside au quartier Ayélawadjè depuis bientôt 6 mois avec son époux. Elle mène depuis plus de 5 ans la vente des produits vivriers. Elle les vend par le système de distribution mais aussi à domicile devant sa maison. Actuellement elle a construit une boutique qui lui servira de lieu de stockage et d’activité. Elle a démarré ladite activité vers les années 2003 avec un fonds de démarrage de 80000 F CFA. Confrontée au problème d‘approvisionnement quelques mois après elle a eu recours au financement extérieur. C’est ainsi qu'elle obtient son premier crédit le 25/10/2004 d’un montant de 50000 F CFA qui lui a permis de commencer par acheter en gros. Elle vient solliciter pour son cinquième prêt de 250000 F CFA pour s'approvisionner.
texts.en:
Ms. Justine L. was born on August 26, 1963 in Pahou and is married to Cosme MITO, an accounting representative at ECDRA, a local private company. The couple have in their care four children, who are all in school. Ms. Justine L. has been residing with her husband in the Ayélawadjè district for almost six months. She has been selling staple foods for over five years, making sales through a distribution system but also out of the front of her house. Currently, she has built a shop that will serve as a storehouse and place of business. She started the aforementioned business around 2003 with start-up funds of 80,000 francs CFA. Confronted with the problem of inventory and supplies a few months afterwards, she turned to outside financing. This is why she obtained her first loan on October 25, 2004 in the amount of 50,000 francs, which enabled her to start buying in bulk. She has come to request as her fifth loan 250,000 francs for acquiring supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten 50-kg sacks of corn, five 30-kg sacks of rice, and the remainder for other staple foods

loans.name: Prisque

texts.fr: Née le 19/05/1973 à Cotonou, dame D. Prisque est mariée et mère de 02 enfants : Massimo âgé de 7 ans et faisant le CE 2 puis Maxia 4 ans. Son mari AZILINON Eric assure toutes les charges familiales. Couturière de profession, elle a su associer la vente à la couture ce qui lui confère à ce jour une clientèle fidèle. Ainsi, vu l’augmentation de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle, et voulant satisfaire aux mieux ces dernières, elle sollicite un crédit de 140000 F CFA. Notons au passage qu’elle réside à Sènadé depuis 08 ans et exerce cette activité depuis son enfance.
texts.en:
Born on May 19, 1973 in Cotonou, Ms. Prisque D. is married and the mother of two children: Massimo, age 7 and in 3rd grade, and Maxia, age 4. Her husband Eric AZILINON covers all family expenses. A seamstress by profession, she found out how to include selling with her sewing, which has today won her a loyal customer base. And so, given her continuously growing customer base and wanting to satisfy them better, she is requesting a loan of 140,000 francs CFA. By the way, let us make note that she has been residing in Sènadé for eight years and has been in this business since childhood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 outfits and 6 dozen shoes

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: El señor Marcos es un cliente antiguo de Emprender ya lleva trabajando con nosotros dos años, es un cliente conocido por el personal, por eso podemos decir que es un cliente responsable, hasta ahora ha sido bastante puntual al trabajar con la institución, como su profesión lo requiere y hemos podido presenciar la evolución de este cliente, que empezó con una peuqeña movilidad y ahora ya posee una segunda. Proviene de una familia muy humilde, por lo que es una persona muy conciente de sus responsabilidades tanto laborales como familiares. "Trabaja todos los días pensando en su familia".
texts.en:
Marcos is an old client of Emprender as he has been working with us for two years and is a client known by the staff. This is why we can say that he is a responsible client and to date has been very punctual in working with the institution as his profession requires it. We have been able to sense the evolution of this client, who started with a small bus and now already has a second. He comes from a very poor family and therefore he is a person very conscious of his work and family responsibilities. "He works everyday thinking about his family".

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.fr: Dame A. Mathilde est née le 05/02/1966 à Cotonou. Mariée à TCHOUBADE Abdoulaye (agent de l’OCBN), elle est mère de trois enfants. Elle mène l'activité de vente de charbon depuis 18 ans et vit à Scoa gbéto (un des plus anciens quartiers de Cotonou) depuis sa naissance. Vu son dynamisme et sa crédibilité, elle nous a affirmé qu’elle assure la majorité des charges familiales grâce aux revenus de son activité puisque son mari est un polygame. Elle est actuellement à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mathilde A. was born on February 5, 1966 in Cotonou. She's married to Abdoulaye TCHOUBADE, an agent of OCBN (Bénin-Niger Railroad and Transportation Organization) and is the mother of three children. She's been living in Scoa Gbéto (one of the oldest neighborhoods in Cotonou) since she was born. For 18 years, she's been selling charcoal. Thanks to her energy and credibility, she says she's providing for most of the family expenses with the revenues of her business, her husband being polygamous. She's now seeking her third loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Khekh Niakk  qui signifie lutter contre la pauvreté en wolof  est un groupe de quatre personne qui s'active communément dans le commerce de tissus. ce pret Contribue au renforcement de leur capital pour satisfaire la demande de clientèle dans les préparatifs des fetes de korité et tabaski.
texts.en:
Khekh Niakk which means struggle against poverty in Wolof is a group of four people who are working together in the field of selling cloth. This loan will contribute to bolstering their capital so as to satisfy the demand of their clientele as people prepare for the holidays of "korité" and "tabaski" (Muslim Feast of the Sacrifice).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dyeing

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: Joséphine A. est âgé de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle réside à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise.
