Elle souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des sacs de farine de blé et des bidons d’huiles alimentaires pour la préparation du beignet afin de les revendre aux revendeurs détaillants. Elle souhaite améliorer ses conditions de vie avec cette opportunité.
texts.en:
Joséphine A. is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five. She resides in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She would like to use this loan to buy sacks of flour and containers of cooking oil for making beignets (a kind of doughnut) in order to sell them to retailers. She would like to improve her living conditions with this opportunity.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour and containers of cooking oil to make beignets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of many goods to restock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Née le 17/09/1967 à Allada, dame B. Christine est mariée à GANDOLANHOU Octave employé à la SOBEMAP. Mère de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés et 01 pas encore en âge d’être scolarisé, elle est une femme battante. Elle est dans cette activité de vente de divers produits de consommation courante depuis 17 ans et vit à Abokicodji depuis 22 ans. Compte tenu de l'évolution de son activité et aussi de la demande de plus en plus croissante et pressante de sa clientèle, dame B. Christine sollicite à son sixième prêt un montant de 190000 F CFA.
texts.en:
Born on September 17, 1967 in Allada, Mrs. Christine B. is married to Octave Gandolanhou, who is an employee of SOBEMAP. The mother of 4 children of whom 3 are enrolled in school and one is still too young to go to school, she is a courageous woman. She has been selling various staples for 17 years and has lived in Abokicodji for 22 years. Considering the evolution of her business and the ever growing demand from her insistant customers, Mrs. Christine B. is requesting her 6th loan in the amount of 190,000 F CFA.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of tinned tomatoes, a case of sugar, and a case of sweetened condensed milk

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Khekh Niakk  qui signifie lutter contre la pauvreté en wolof  est un groupe de quatre personne qui s'active communément dans la couture. ce pret Contribue au renforcement de leur capital pour satisfaire la demande de clientèle dans les préparatifs des fetes de korité et tabaski.
texts.en:
Khekh Niakk which means struggle against poverty in Wolof is a group of four people who are working together in the field of selling dressmaking. This loan will contribute to bolstering their capital so as to satisfy the demand of their clientele as people prepare for the holidays of "korité" and "tabaski" (Muslim Feast of the Sacrifice).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dressmaking

loans.name: Gueniou

texts.fr: Gueniou D. est conducteur de taxi moto à Adeta, un village situé à environ  150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 39 ans, Gueniou est célibataire et père d’un enfant. Il aimerait avec ce crédit s’acheter une nouvelle moto étant donné que celle qu’il conduit n’est pas de sa propriété. Il espère changer les conditions de sa vie avec cette opportunité.
texts.en:
Gueniou D. is a motorbike taxi driver in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Gueniou, age 39, is single and the father of one child. He would like to use this loan to buy a new motorbike, given that he doesn't own the one he drives. He hopes to make a change in his living conditions with this opportunity.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of basic foodstuffs and alcoholic drinks for a small mini-market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy garments wholesale and move her small business forward.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Âgée de 35 ans et née à Cotonou, elle est mariée à SOKENOU Daniel architecte de profession. Mère de 02 enfants, elle arrive à joindre les deux bouts grâce aux revenus de son activité. Elle est vendeuse de produits divers. Activité qu'elle exerce depuis 10 ans après avoir abandonné la vente de poissons frais qui entre temps n’était plus une activité rentable pour elle. Résidant depuis 05 ans à Sodjéatinmè où son activité a commencé par prendre un essor considérable, elle sollicite un crédit de 120000 F CFA pour constituer son propre stock afin de lui éviter de prendre les choses en détails ou à crédit. Ceci lui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice important. Notons au passage qu’elle est à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Jeanette K., 35, was born in Cotonou and is married to Daniel Sokenou, an architect. The mother of two children, she manages to make ends meet thanks to the income from her business. She sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for 10 years, after having given up selling fresh fish, which was no longer remunerative for her.

She has been living for 5 years in Sodjéatinmè where her business has begun to be well-known, and she is requesting a loan of 120,000 F CFA to establish her own inventory so as to avoid buying what she re-sells retail or on credit. This should allow her to make a good deal more profit. This is, by the way, her third loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of palm oil, peanut oil, tinned tomatoes and various condiments

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama A. est âgée de 62 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle habite à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est revendeuse de « sodabi », une liqueur tant appréciée par la population locale. Elle aimerait par ce crédit faire d’avantage de stocks pour répondre à la demande. Elle désire changer les conditions de sa vie avec cette opportunité
texts.en:
Ama A., 62, is married and the mother of 7 children. She lives in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She sells « sodabi », a liquor very much appreciated by the local population. She would like to have this loan to stock up so as to respond to demand for her product. She would like to change her living conditions thanks to this opportunity.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "sodabi" for re-sale

loans.name: Khekh

texts.fr: Khekh Niakk  qui signifie lutter contre la pauvreté en wolof  est un groupe de cinq  personnes qui s'active communément dans la couture. ce pret Contribue au renforcement de leur capital pour satisfaire la demande de clientèle dans les préparatifs des fetes de korité et tabaski.les membres du groupe habitent dans le quartier  Diakhao de thiés.
texts.en:
Khekh Niakk which means struggle against poverty in Wolof is a group of four persons who are working jointly in the field of dressmaking. This loan will contribute to bolstering their capital so that they can satisfy the demand of their clientele as they prepare for the holidays of korité and tabaski (Muslim Feast of the Sacrifice).l The members of the group live in the neighborhoods called Diakhao in Thiés.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dressmaking

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase materials and products for her small beauty salon.

loans.name: Abibou Hamida

texts.fr:
Madame - I. Abibou Hamida est née en 1969 à Sokodé dans la région centrale. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a ouvert en 2003 une boutique de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè situé à 12km du centre ville de Lomé. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et à bien remboursé. 
Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 10 sacs de sucre en poudre, 08 sacs de riz, 12 cartons de savon et 6 bidons d’huile. Elle compte avoir une grande part de marché par ce nouveau stock qu’elle aura à constituer.
texts.en:
Ms. Abibou Hamida I. was born in 1969 in Sokodé in the central region. She is married and the mother of two. She opened a shop in 2003 selling basic provisions in the Agoè district located about 12 km from downtown Lomé. She once benefited from a loan from WAGES and repaid it. She is requesting this second loan for supplies through the purchase of 10 sacks of powdered sugar, 8 sacks of rice, 12 boxes of soap, and 6 drums of oil. She intends to have a large market share by this new inventory that she will have to build.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic provisions

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Née le 07/02/1972 à Lomé, dame H. Yvette est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est dans cette activité de vente de divers produits de consommation courante depuis 04 ans et vit à Missessin depuis 07 ans. Compte tenu de son activité de plus en plus croissante et aussi de la demande de plus en plus croissante et pressante de sa clientèle,dame H. Yvette sollicite pour son quatrième prêt un montant de 190000 F CFA et affirme que ceci lui permettra de satisfaire les différents besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on February 7, 1972 in Lomé, Ms. Yvette H. is married and the mother of two. She has been doing this work in selling various common consumables for four years and has been living in Missessin for seven years. Given that her business is growing more and more, and so is the customer demand, which is more and more urgent, she is requesting as her fourth loan an amount of 190,000 francs CFA. She asserts that this will enable her to meet the different needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a box of canned tomatoes, a box of sugar, a box of milk, and various goods

loans.name: Afissétou

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1962 à Gléi dans la préfecture de l’Ogou au Togo, dame I. Afissétou est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle exerce le commerce de pétrole dans son quartier. En 1997, année dans laquelle elle a commencé son commerce la plupart de la population de son quartier n’utilisait que les lampes à pétrole. Elle vendait et faisait beaucoup bénéfice. 
En 2005 elle a obtenu un premier crédit et a commencé la vente des sacs de riz. Son activité prospère et elle aide beaucoup son mari qui est chauffeur dans les dépenses journalières.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de payer 800 litres de pétrole et 10 sacs de riz afin de pouvoir bien servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1962 in Gléi, in Ogou Prefecture, Togo, Ms. Afissétou I. is married and the mother of four. She does commerce in kerosene in her district. In 1997, the year in which she started her business, most people in her district used only lamp oil. She sold and made a lot of profit. In 2005, she obtained an initial loan and started selling sacks of rice. Her business is prospering, and she does a lot to help her husband, a driver, with the day-to-day expenses. This second loan that she is requesting will enable her to pay for 800 liters of kerosene and 10 sacks of rice in order to be able to serve her customers well.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of rice and 800 liters of kerosene

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Doña Fidelina habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, con dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposo trabaja en la policía y juntos se apoyan para sacar adelante a su familia. Doña Fidelina trabaja como oficial de policía y tiene veintiséis años laborando para esta institución. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para hacer mejoras a su vivienda en la compra de perlines y zinc para reparar el techo de su vivienda que está en mal estado. Espera conservar su trabajo para seguir mejorando su vivienda y apoyando a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Fidelina lives in the Reconciliación neighborhood, is 49 years old, married, with two school-aged children. Her husband works as a police officer and together they support their family. Fidelina has worked as a police official for 26 years. The loan will be used to make home improvements by purchasing perlines and zinc to repair the roof of her home which is in disrepair. She hopes to use her work to continue improving their home and supporting their childrens' education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc and perlines to change the roof of his home

loans.name: Awaou

texts.fr: Née le 04/02/1958 au Sénégal, dame A. Awaou est divorcée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 sont à sa charge.Spécialisée dans l’activité de vente de fagots de bois de chauffage depuis 12 ans, elle a sollicité pour son premier prêt à ALIDé un montant de 30000 F CFA pour augmenter son stock de fagots et faire face aux demandes de sa clientèle qui s’accroît de jour en jour. Actuellement elle est à son quatrième crédit et pour lequel elle sollicite 100000 F CFA.
texts.en:
Born on February 4, 1958 in Sénégal, Ms. Awaou A. is divorced and the mother of three children, two of whom are in her care. A specialist in selling bundles of firewood for twelve years, she requested her first loan with Alidé in the amount of 30,000 francs CFA to increase her stock of bundled firewood and to address the demands of her customer base, which grows from day to day. Currently, she is on her fourth loan, for which she is requesting 100,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of firewood

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando, asisten a la escuela por la tarde, y por la mañana ayudan a su mama a cuidar los cultivos.  Su esposo  trabaja en servicios de seguridad y siempre está pendiente que a su familia no le falte nada. Doña Reyna trabaja en la agricultura y también es comerciante, tiene quince años de estar trabajando las tierras, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingreso para mantener a su familia. Conoce mucho de hortalizas por que sus padres también se dedicaban a esta actividad. El préstamo solicitado es para mantenimiento del cultivo, comprará abonos orgánicos y así poder obtener una cosecha de muy buena calidad. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan heredar el mismo gusto por las tierras que ella tiene, y así puedan seguir con esta actividad de cultivos de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Reyna lives in the town of Ticuantepe in the city of Managua. She is married and has four children who are studying. They attend school in the afternoon and in the the morning they help their mom care for the crops. Her husband works in security services and is always working so that his family does not lack anything. Doña Reyna works in agriculture and also is a trader, and she has been working the land for fifteen years and it has been one of her main sources of income for raising her family. She knows the crops very well because her parents were also dedicated to this activity. The requested loan is for maintenance of the crops; she will buy organic manure fertilizer and this way be able to attain a harvest of very high quality. Her biggest dream is that her children can inherit the same love for the land that she has and continue this activity of cultivating vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy organic manure fertilizers

loans.name: Bayi

texts.fr:
Madame A. Bayi est née le 31 décembre 1955 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des sacs d’écoliers et de sacs de voyage à côté d’une grande station d’essence de son quartier.
Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2002 et à une expérience qui lui permet de bien vendre malgré la concurrence.
A l’approche de cette rentrée scolaire, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 120 sacs d’écoliers et 40 sacs de voyage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bayi A. was born on December 31, 1955 in Lomé. She is married and is the mother of 4 children. Her business entails selling school bags and travelling bags beside a big petrol station in her neighborhood.

She began this business in 2002 and has enough experience to allow her to make a lot of sales in spite of the competition.

As the school year begins, she is requesting this first loan to buy 120 school bags and 40 travelling bags.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of travelling bags and school bags

loans.name: Ferdine

texts.fr: Née le 26/11/1962 à Tokpa Domè dans la commune de Sègbohouè, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.Son époux ADOLIGBE Raymond technicien à ASECNA assure toutes les charges familiales. Elle est vendeuse de divers produits tels que les cartes de recharge GSM, du yaourt et autres. Elle est dans cette activité depuis 07 ans, juste après l’ouverture de son atelier de couture. Dame A. Ferdine réside à Cadjèhoun depuis 10 ans. Actuellement elle éprouve des difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce prêt  de 200000 F CFA afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d’élargir son champ d’activité.
texts.en:
Born on November 26, 1962 in Tokpa Domè in the commune of Sègbohouè, Mrs. Ferdine Aitchedji is married and the mother of 4 children. Her husband, Raymond Adoligbe, who is a technician at ASECNA, supports the family. She sells various products such as GSM rechargeable phone cards, yogurt, etc. She has been in this business for 7 years, just after she opened her sewing workshop.

Mrs. Ferdine Aitchedji has been living in Cadjèhoun for 10 years. Presently, she is having some difficulty stocking her products, which is the reason why she is asking for this loan of 200,000 F CFA so as to satisfy the demand of her clientele and also expand her field of activity.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for cell phones, pots of yogurt, and other snacks

loans.name: Jader Antonio

texts.es: El joven Jader Antonio L., de 27 años de edad, casado con la joven Marlin Gurdián Trujillo, ingeniero agrónomo, con un hijo de 3 años, él trabaja como fontanero en ENACAL desde hace 11 años, alquilan una casita, su hijo es cuidado en un C.D.I donde ella también trabaja. El señor L. está solicitando su crédito, el que utilizará para la instalación del agua y la luz de su vivienda, construcción de una letrina y cancelará unos perlines que utilizó para su casa, la que ha ido construyendo poco a poco con los créditos que AFODENIC le ha otorgado. Agradece a AFODENIC, porque con los créditos brindados pronto estará habitando su propia casa y su hijo y su esposa tendrán un techo propio y digno, espera continuar trabajando con la institución para posteriormente hacerle otro detalles a su casa que son de menos importancia, pues con este crédito tendrán los servicios básicos y ya podrán habitar en su propia casa.
texts.en:
The young Jader Antonio L. is 27 years old, married to Marlin Gurdián Trujillo, agricultural engineer, with one 3-year old child. He has worked as a plumber at ENACAL for the past 11 years. They rent a small house, and their young son is cared for at a C.D.I. where she also works. Mr. L. is seeking a loan which he will use to install running water, electricity and a bathroom in their home. He will also cancel some beams that he used for his house, which he has been building little by little with the loans which AFODENIC has granted him. He thanks AFODENIC because, with the loans they have provided to him, he will soon be living in his own house and his wife and child will have their own roof over their heads and live with more dignity. He hopes to continue working with the institution subsequently, to add other details to his house which are of less importance. With this loan they will be able to have the most basic services and live in their very own home.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom, and install electricity and running water in his house.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La profesora Martha Lorena de 33 años de edad, soltera, sin compromiso, está solicitando su crédito, el que utilizará para la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda donde levantará solamente 2 paredes, su hermana desde hace 2 años está en Costa Rica con todo su familia y ella habitará sola la casa. De los 7 créditos que ha solicitado uno lo utilizó para comprar un solar, cinco para construcción de su vivienda y uno para los trámites de su título universitario, trabaja con AFODENIC desde el año 2001, se siente bien atendida y los créditos le han servido de mucho pues con su salario de maestra nunca había logrado coronar sus esperanzas de tener una vivienda digna, trabaja como docente en el Instituto San Sebastian con un horario de 1:00p.m a 6:00pm de lunes a viernes desde hace 8 años, plantea que siempre que haya trabajo seguirá invirtiendo en las mejoras de su vivienda para que cuando logre formar una familia ya tenga una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Professor Martha Lorena is 33 years old, single, and is requesting a loan which she will use for the construction of a room in her home where she only needs to put up two walls. Her sister has been in Costa Rica for two yeas with her entire family, so she will live alone in the house. Of the seven loans she has requested, she used one to buy a plot of land, five for the construction of her house, and one for the processing fees for her university degree. She has worked with AFODENIC since 2001 and feels well taken care of. The loans have helped her a lot because her teacher’s salary has never allowed her to achieve her hopes of having a dignified home. She has worked as a teacher at the San Sebastian Institute from 1:00pm until 6:00pm Monday through Friday for the past 8 years. She suggests that as long as there is work, she will keep investing in improvements to her home so when she succeeds in forming a family, she will already have a dignified home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of a room in her home

loans.name: Kotchire Rosalie

texts.fr: Dame M. Kotchire Rosalie est née le 03/09/1965 à Cotonou. Mariée à KPAMEGAN Pamphile agent de l’OCBN, elle est mère de 04 enfants dont 02 majeurs et les 02 autres à sa charge. Elle est dans cette activité de vente de condiments, de farine de maïs bouillie et de divers depuis 25 ans et réside à Cadjèhoun depuis sa naissance. Elle est aidée par son époux dans l’assurance des charges familiales. Actuellement, elle veut diversifier son activité à cause de sa situation géographique favorable à l’activité commerciale en achetant un moulin à condiments et en vendant aussi l’eau de pompe. C'est pour atteindre ses objectifs qu'elle vient solliciter ce prêt. Notons au passage qu’elle est à son troisième prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kotchire Rosalie M. was born September 3, 1965 in Cotonou. Married to Pamphile Kpamegan, an employee of the OCBN (the Bénin-Niger Railroad and Transportation Organization), she is the mother of four children, of which two are adults and the other two are under her care. She has been in the business of selling condiments, corn flour, and other goods for 25 years and she has lived in Cadjèhoun since she was born. Her husband helps her with the family expenses. She wants to diversify her business—because her geographical situation is favorable to commercial activity—by purchasing a spice mill and by selling water that she pumps herself. These are the reasons why she is requesting this loan. This is her third loan with ALIDE.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a box of condensed milk, a box of spaghetti, and other various goods

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra D. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite à WOme, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togo. Revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale, Abra souhaite accroître la taille de son commerce en s’approvisionnant en achetant des cartons de boîtes de conserves, de savons, desvsacs de riz et autres produits ainsi que de louer un magasin. Elle compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie
texts.en:
Abra D. is 45 years old. married, and the mother of three (3) children. She lives in Wome, a village located approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Abra sells basic necessity products. She would like to increase the size of her stock and business by purchasing cartons of boxes, jams, soap, sacks of rice, and other products as well as paying for the rent of her store. She hopes that this opportunity will improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cartons of boxes, jams, soap, sacks of rice, and other products and paying for the rent of her store.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr: Rachelle A. est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des bidons d’huiles alimentaires de sacs de riz et des cartons de boîtes de conserves afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la population.
texts.en:
Rachelle A. is a retailer of food in general in Wome, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She would like to use this loan to increase the capacity of her business through the purchase of containers of cooking oil, sacks of rice, and boxes of canned food in order to respond to the needs of the population better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drums of cooking oil, sacks of rice, and boxes of canned food

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth F. est âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Elle réside à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elisabeth subvient difficilement aux besoins de ses enfants puisque les revenus de son activité ne représente qu’une infime partie de leurs besoins. Avec ce crédit, elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique d’limentation générale. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Elisabeth F. is 50 years old, married, and mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives in Womé, a village situated about 130 kilometers away from Lomé, which is the capital of Togo. Elisabeth has trouble meeting her children's needs because her income is insufficient. With this loan, she hopes to open a general food store. She is hoping this will allow her to improve the lives of her family members.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of cartons of milk, sacks of rice, and to rent a store

loans.name: Edem

texts.fr: Edem G. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse, depuis plus de 3 ans, des produits génériques à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère avec ce crédit, accroître la taille de son activité en commandant beaucoup plus de marchandises pour satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Edem G. is 38 years old, married, and mother of three children. For more than three years she has been a retailer of generic medical products in Womé, a village situated about 130 kilometers away from Lomé, which is the capital of Togo. With this loan she hopes to increase the size of her business by ordering much more merchandise so she can keep up with customer demand.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for retail

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restart her small business of selling sandwiches and juices.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sweets and cookies to sell in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fresh meat, vegetables and other goods to keep selling fried food.

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es: La profesora Johana del Socorro, soltera de 37 años de edad, con una hija de 6 años la que está estudiando 1er. Grado, es trabajadora del INTAE, se desempeña como responsable de certificación.  Está solicitando su crédito No.7 el que utilizará para compra de  materiales de construción como piedra cantera y hierro, posteriormene comprará el cemento y otros materiales para realizar la contrucción de un cuarto. Johana ha demostrado responsabilidad y honradez en los créditos que hasta ahora se le han otorgado, y entre sus compañeros es reconocida también como una persona trabajadora y servicial.  Le gustaria optar por un crédito mayor y a mayor plazo para poder resolver el problema de su vivienda, no cuenta con ningún apoyo, ella es madre y padre para su hija.
texts.en:
Johana del Socorro, a teacher and 37 year old single woman, has a 6 year old daughter who is in first grade. Johana works at INTAE, and has the responsibility of certification. She is asking for her seventh loan, which she will use to purchase construction materials like stone quarries and iron. Next, she will buy cement and other materials in order to build a room. Johana has demonstrated responsibility and honesty with the loans that she has been granted so far. Moreover, she is known as a worker and helper among her friends. She would like a bigger loan and a longer period of time in order to solve her housing problem, not to mention that she is without help as both the mother and father for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone quarries and iron

loans.name: Puerta Del Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Puerta del Sol, se fundó el año pasado en la ciudad D. La Paz, está compuesto por cuatro miembros, que están unidos por un furte lazo familiar entre algunos y D. amistad entre otros, tienen en común además la cercanía D. sus puestos D. venta.

El señor Basilio es considerado por el grupo como un "ejemplo D. vida", debido a que trabaja muy duro para mantener a sus 2 hijos pequeños, a quienes cuida desD. el fallecimiento D. su esposa, y a quienes atienD. con mucho cariño para brindarles un ambiente familiar. Se dedica a la manufactura D. calzados, labor que realiza muy habilmente, solamente trabaja con nuestra institcucion, es por ello que es considerado por nosotros como un cliente "fiel"
			
La señora Olga, en el ámbito familiar, es separada D. su marido hace ya algunos años, no tiene hijos que mantener porque ellos ya son adultos y trabajan por su cuenta, sin embargo tiene nietos a quienes cuida mientras sus padres estan trabajando, asi que además cumple una labor D. crianza para con sus nietos. En el ámbito laboral, es artesana en tejidos, los cuales venD. para sobrevivir.

La señora Elvira es madre soltera, tiene 2 niños peuqños a los cuales mantiene, con su trabajo. Vive en una casa familiar, muy humilD. pero muy bien cuidada. Para sobrevivir, hace manualidades, es muy buena para pintar en tela, con ello que hace manteles pintados a mano los cuales venD. exitosamente.

La señora María Lourdes, cuenta con casa propia, vive con sus hijos a quienes mantiene mediante la venta D. calzados, paralelamente hace reposteria que también venD. con la ayuda D. sus hijos, es considerada una "mujer valiosa" en su zona.
texts.en:
The group Puerta del Sol was founded last year in the city of La Paz. It has four members who are joined by a strong family bond among some and friendship among others. They also share the proximity of their stalls in common.

Basilio is considered by the group as an example of life because he works hard to support his two young children who he has taken care of since the death of his wife. He attends to them with a lot of love and provides a family environment for them. He dedicates himself to making shoes; work which he performs very skillfully. He only works with this institution which is why he is considered a loyal client.

Olga has been separated from her husband for a few years. She does not have children to support because they are adults and work on their own. She does however have grandchildren who she takes care of while their parents are working. Besides raising her grandchildren, her business is selling her knitted crafts.

Elvira is a single mother and has two small children who she supports with her work. She lives in a humble family home that is well taken care of. She makes handicrafts to survive. She is very good at painting on fabric and makes hand painted tablecloths which she sells with great success.

Maria Lourdes has her own home. She lives with her children who she supports by selling shoes. She also makes pastries which she also sells with the help of her children. She is considered a valuable woman in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of prime material.

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es: El profesor C.,  de 42 años, separado, con 2 hijos 1 varón de 7 años y una niña de 11 años, ambos estudian la primaria. En estos momentos está en proceso de separación y ha tenido que dejar su casa y todos los bienes a sus hijos, trabaja como director del Instituto San Sebastián de Acoyapa, desde hace 14 años. Solicita su 3er crédito el que necesita con urgencia ya que está habitando en la casa de los nuevos suegros y tiene que hacer una división para un cuarto para habitar con su nueva pareja. El Señor C. ha sido un excelente cliente con el pago de sus créditos anteriores demostrando responsabilidad. Espera muy pronto pder tener su propia casa en donde habitar con su nueva familia, y donde también poder recibir y atender a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Professor C. is 42 years old, separated from his wife, has 2 children, a son 7 years old and a daughter 11 years old, both of whom are in elementary school. Today he is in the process of getting a separation and he had to leave his house and his things for his children. He has worked as the director of the San Sebastián Institute in Acoyapa for 14 years. He is seeking his 3rd loan, which he urgently needs, as he is now living in the home of his new partner's parents an dhe has to make a wall for a room for himself and his new partner. C. has been an excellent cliente and has paid his previous loans responsibly. He hopes to soon be able to have his own home where he can live with his new family and also where he will be able to host and take care of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make walls for a room

loans.name: Danixa Del Rosario

texts.es: Danixa tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un niño de 3 años, trabaja en el C.D.I como educadora desde hace 9 años. Habita en el municipio de Juigalpa, mismo en donde trabaja.  Está solicitando crédito para compra materiales de construcción como son : Piedra cantera, cemento y hierro, el que utilizará en la casa que actualmente habita, que está a su nombre y a nombre de dos hermanos más. Le ha costado mucho a Danixa salir adelnate ya que es madre soltera y la manutención de su familia le ha tocado sólo a ella, pero poco a poco le está haciendo la inversión a su vivienda, y espera dentro de algunos años poder ver su casa terminada para así darle a su hija una vivienda digna, y también como toda madre soltera espera poder darle educación a su pequeña niña.
texts.en:
Danixa is 28 years old, single, has a 3 year old child, and she has worked in the C.D.I. as an educator for 9 years. She lives and works in Juigalpa. She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as: stone, cement, and iron which will be used in the house where she lives, which is in her and two of her brothers names. It has been a struggle for Danixa to get ahead as she is a single mother and supporting her family is something she has to do alone, but little by little she is making an investment in her home, and she hopes that with a few years she will be able to see her house completed in order to give her daughter a deserving home, and also like all single mothers she hopes to provide an education to her small daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room of her home

loans.name: Blanca Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Amelia V. Ibáñez, tiene cincuentaicinco años y vive en la calle San Martín 204 del distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió la primaria completa, sus padres no pudieron seguir educándola por medios económicos.
Se casó de diecisiete años con el señor Robert Santos Guzmán y tiene dos hijos vivos y dos hijos muertos. 
Su negocio que funciona en su casa es de compra venta de cerdos, los compra vivos y los vende en carne.
Recuerda que empezó a trabajar con Manuela Ramos desde hace once años aproximadamente, en ese entonces tenía una bodega, así que su primer préstamo de 300 soles los invirtió en comprar arroz, fideo, gaseosas y cerveza para surtir su bodega, devolvió el préstamo en cuatro meses.
Actualmente solicitará un préstamo de 1000 soles con los que comprará siete cerditos pequeños, los que engordará y serán vendidos en carne, ese préstamo también será devuelto en cuatro meses.
Blanca es una mujer con mucha visión de negocio, es muy activa con mucha vitalidad para organizarse y trabajar desde tempranas horas.
Participa como socia en el comedor popular Corazón de María y es presidenta en el Banco Comunal Progresistas.
Sueña con viajar mucho y conocer el Perú en especial el Cuzco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Amelia V. Ibáñez is 55 years old and lives on San Martin Street in the Mache district of Otuzco, in the La Libertad department of Peru. She completed an elementary school education, but for economic reasons her parents were unable to continue educating her. When she was 17, she married Mr. Robert Santos Guzman and they had four children, two of whom died.

She runs her business buying and selling pigs from her house. She buys the animals alive, then sells their meat. She says that she began working with Manuela Ramos 11 years ago, when she had a general store, and she spent her first loan on rice, pasta, sodas and beer to supply her store. She paid off the loan in 4 months.

She is currently requesting a loan of 1000 soles (about US $330) to buy seven piglets, which she will fatten up, slaughter and sell their meat. She will pay off this loan in 4 months.

Blanca is a woman with a vision for her business. She is very active and has the liveliness to get organized and start working at the crack of dawn. She is a member of the Corazon de Maria eatery and is president of the Progresistas Communal Bank. She dreams of traveling, and would like to get to know other parts of Peru, especially Cuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Juana Bacilia

texts.es:
La señora Juana Bacilia C. Z. tiene 49 años de edad, ella nació en Piscopampa, distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad.
Juana estudio educación Primaria completa, pero ya no siguió estudiando debido a que su papá piensa que las hijas mujeres no tienen necesidad de estudiar mucho.
Se caso a los 18 años con don Benjamín Espinola Rubio, con él tienen 2 hijos, una hija mujer de 27 años que ya es casada y su hijo varón de 23 años que depende económicamente de la pareja.
Se dedica a negocios múltiples, compra leche y hace quesillos, queso y manjar en el caserío de Piscopampa y los vende los días lunes en Trujillo y otros días en Mache.
El primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue hace 6 años, recuerda que le dieron 300 soles los que devolvió a los 4 meses y con el compró leche y menestras, para vender en Trujillo.
Actualmente tiene una camioneta rural con la que hace servicio urbano en Trujillo, pero manifiesta que es un trabajo muy fuerte y prefiere volver a su trabajo anterior.
Con este préstamo de S/ 2000 soles, el mismo que será devuelto en 4 meses, los invertirá en comprar una vaca con su becerro, para aprovechar la leche, en eso invertirá 1500 soles y los 500 restantes los usará para comprar ropa y zapatos en Trujillo y venderlos en Mache.
 Juana sueña con tener una casa más grande y tener un negocio más descansado.
Pertenece al comedor popular Ana Harvis, anteriormente fue tesorera de su Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, ahora es solamente socia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Bacilia C. Z. is 49 years old. She was born in Piscopampa in the Mache District of the Otuzco Province in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed primary school, but was unable to continue her studies because her parents did not believe it was necessary for girls to get a good education.

When she was 18 years old, she married Mr. Benjamin Espinola Rubio, with whom she has two children, a 27-year-old woman and a 23-year-old man; the latter is still financially dependent on his parents.

Juana is involved in several different businesses. She buys milk and makes cheeses and manjar (a sweet caramel made from condensed milk, similar to dulce de leche) in her farmhouse in Piscopampa. She sells her products in Trujillo on Mondays and in Mache on other days.

Juana's first loan from Manuela Ramos was taken out six years ago. She tells us that she took out 300 soles (about US $100) to buy milk and vegetable stew to sell in Trujillo. She repaid the loan in four months.

Juana currently drives a moving truck in the rural area, but she says that the work is very tough and she would prefer to return to making and selling cheeses and manjars. With this loan of 2000 soles (US $675), Juana will buy a cow and its calf so that she can use the cow's milk. This will cost about 1500 soles, and she will use the remaining 500 soles to buy clothes and shoes in Trujillo to sell in Mache.

Juana dreams of having a bigger home and a more relaxing business. She belongs to the Ana Harvis working-class eatery. She also used to be the treasurer of the Mujeres de Trabajo Communal Bank (a group loan), but stepped down from this position and is currently just a member.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow and calf, plus clothing and shoes

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: Luis Humberto tiene 21 años de edad, habita en el barrio Reparto Shick de la ciudad de Managua, es soltero. Luis se dedica a la zapatería, trabaja reparando zapatos y tiene ocho años de experiencia, el inició desde que tenia doce años aprendiendo el oficio de su papá. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para compra de materia prima para el trabajo que desempeña, por ejemplo tacones, hilo, pega. Y así poder ofrecer más servicios a sus clientes y por ende tener más ganancias. Sus planes son poder apoyar a su familia siempre en los gastos del hogar porque él dice que le debe a su papá toda la experiencia que ha adquirido y espera poder ayudar a sus papás en la vejez.
texts.en:
Luis Humberto is 21 years old. He lives in the Reparto Shick neighborhood in the city of Managua and is single. Luis is a cobbler, he repairs shoes and has eight years of experience. He started when he was 12 years old and learned this trade from his father. The loan he is requesting is to buy supplies for the work he does, for example, heels, thread, glue, so that he can offer more services to his clients and have more earnings. His plans are to always be able help his family with household expenses because it´s owing to his father that he has the experience he has acquired, and he hopes to be able to help his parents in their old age.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for his cobbler shop

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia Z. D. C. tiene 52 años y vive en la Avenida Quiñigon  sin número sector Miramar D. distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad  Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres eran personas muy pobres y ella desde muy pequeña tuvo que empezar a ayudarlos a trabajar.
Se casó con el señor Birilo C. con el que tuvo cuatro hijos, pero solo dos dependen de ella económicamente.
Se dedica a la compra venta de animales menores y compra venta de trigo o menestra de la estación, lo que puede venderlo en grano o en harina, manifiesta que vender el trigo en harina cuesta más y su ganancia es mayor. Su negocio lo realiza en su casa.
Recuerda que el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles para ser devueltos en cuatro  meses, compró cuyes y gallinas a muy buen precio y los vendió ganando muy bien.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 soles, el cual pagara en 4 cuotas, comprará dos cerdos y dos ovejas.
Julia sueña con conocer el Perú de norte a sur. 
Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache.
texts.en:
Julia Zaveleta D. Castilo is 52 years old and lives on Quinigon Avenue in Miramar, a town in the Otuzco province of La Libertad, Peru. Julia is a member of the Communal Bank of Women of Mache and dreams for seeing all of Peru, from north to south. Julia finished 3rd grade and then went to work with her parents. She was unable to continue studying because her parents were very poor. Julia later married Birilo C. and had four children. Two of their children still depend on their parents for support and the other two have moved on. Julia works out of her home as a trader. She specializes in buying and selling agricultural products such as small animals and grain. She sells grain in both seed form and flour form (flour earns better profits). Julia has taken out one loan from Manuela Ramos previously. The first loan was for S/. 300 (apx. $100) and was repaid within four months. Julia used the funds to purchase guinea pigs and chickens at a very low price, which she later resold at a good profit. Julia is now requesting a loan of S/. 2,000 ($675). She will similarly repay this loan in four months and plans to purchase two hogs and two lambs.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hogs and lambs.

texts.es:
Liz Kelly tiene 28 años y vive en el jirón Las Fábricas Manzana R  lote 8B  Semirustica El Bosque Trujillo La Libertad Perú, donde también funciona su negocio.
Estudió secundaria completa pero ya no siguió estudiando por razones económicas y sobre todo porque se casó con Wilson Rolando Medina Morales y tienen tres hijas que dependen de la pareja.
Con un ahorro que tenía empezó a vender gaseosa y se dio cuenta que podía vender también otras cosas como azúcar, arroz, aceite y sobre todo detergente que también le sirve para lavar ropa ajena algunas veces.
Ha recibido su primer préstamo de 300 soles con lo que compró arroz, azúcar y detergente.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500 soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, piensa invertir en su negocio comprando gaseosa, papel higiénico y detergente.
Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y ver a sus hijas profesionales y con un gran futuro.
Liz Kelly pertenece al Banco Trabajo  y Amor, cuenta que el Banco le ayuda mucho a reflexionar sobre la importancia de tener educación y visión de trabajo.
texts.en:
Liz Kelly is 28 years old and lives in the street Las Fabricas Manzana R lote 8B, Semirustica El Bosque Trujillo La Libertad, Peru, where she runs her business. She completed high school but has not continued studying due to economic reasons and above all, because she married Wilson Rolando Medina Morales and has three daughters that depend on her and her husband. With the savings she had, she started to sell soda and realized that she could sell other products as well such as sugar, rice, oil, and most importantly, detergent that would allow her to provide laundry services. She has received her first loan of 300 soles with which she will buy rice, sugar, and laundry detergent. With this loan of 500 soles, which she can pay back in 4 months, Liz believes she can invest in her business by purchasing soda, toilet paper, and laundry detergent. Liz’s dream is to grow her business and see her daughters become professionals with a grand future. She belongs to Banco Trabajo y Amor and says that the bank has significantly helped her to reflect on the importance of obtaining an education and having a vision of business.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery products

loans.name: Berha Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora Bertha, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Banda de Shilcayo. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir tanto para damas como para caballeros y niños. El taller está ubicado en el Jr. Recreo Mz G Lt- 7, lugar donde confecciona y vende. También trabaja en base a pedidos.

Las ventas y pedidos han aumentado gracias a su responsabilidad, puntualidad y buen acabado de sus confecciones, con ello espera mejorar su condición económica y disponibilidad de capital. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, blondas, cierres, telas de diversas variedades, colores y acabados, y de esa manera poder contar con lo necesario cuando tiene que realizar sus trabajos en la confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir que le solicitan sus clientes, lo cuales muchas veces sólo le piden dan el modelo para que ella los confeccione y los venda.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres de la Colina II,” she lives in the region and province of San Martin in Banda de Shilcayo state. For 10 years she has dedicated herself to making all kinds of clothing items for men, women and children. The workshop is located on Jr. Recreo Mz G Lt- 7, where she makes and sells her items. She also takes orders.

The sales and orders have increased thanks to her responsibility, punctuality and good quality of her work, and she hopes to improve her economic situation and have more capital available.

With this loan of S/.1200, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy different color threads, silk lace, zippers, a variety of fabric of different colors and finishes, and in this way she will be able to have everything necessary in order to complete her work making all kinds of clothing items that her customers request, which many times they only have to ask and she will make and sell the items.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads and fabrics

loans.name: Madeleyne

texts.es:
La señora Madeleyne Rodríguez U. tiene treintaiocho años  y vive en la calle soledad sin número del distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta  tercer año de primaria,  ya no siguió estudiando porque sus padres eran negociantes y ella tenía que ayudar en el negocio dedicándose al cuidado de los animales.
Se casó de diecisiete años con el señor Miguel Carranza Castillo y tienen tres hijos los que todavía son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la compraventa de animales, reses, cerdos y ovejas, los compran de las chacras y los venden en las plazas pecuarias a mejor precio. Su negocio se ubica en las plazas pecuarias de Julcán y Otuzco.
Recuerda con gratitud que Manuela Ramos le otorgó un préstamo de 300 soles por primera vez, con lo que compró productos para una bodega que tenía en ese tiempo. “Se vendía mucha golosina porque mi casa está muy cerca de la escuela” comenta Madeleyne. El préstamo lo devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/ 2000 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará dos terneros, para ser vendidos en la plaza pecuaria de Julcán.
Tiene un gran sueño y es el de conocer Europa.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo desde hace aproximadamente diez años.
texts.en:
Madeleyne Rodríguez U. is 38 years old and lives on Soledad Street in the district of Mache, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied up to third grade of primary school, but did not continue her studies because her parents were merchants and she had to help out in their business by taking care of the animals. She married Miguel Carranza Castillo when she was 17 years old and they have three children who are students. Their business is the purchase and sale of animals: cows, pigs and sheep. They buy them from farms and sell them at livestock markets for a higher price. The business is located in the livestock markets at Julcán and Otuzco. She remembers with gratitude the first time that Manuela Ramos granted her a loan for 300 soles, with which she bought products for a small general store she had at that time. "A lot of sweets were sold because my house was very close to a school," says Madeleyne. That loan was repaid in four months. With this loan for S/2000 soles, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy two calves to be resold in the livestock market at Julcán. She has a huge dream and that is to go to Europe. She has belonged to the Working Women Communal Bank for approximately 10 years.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock (two calves).

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La señora Diana, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Organizadas”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Huicungo. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, cosméticos y a la venta de comida. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Libertad con Arica s/n,  lugar donde espera a sus clientes para atenderlos con amabilidad, los cuales en su mayoría son los vecinos, amigos y visitantes.
 
Diana decide iniciarse en el negocio para generar ingresos y contribuir en los gastos de su casa, porque aún tiene hijos que están estudiando.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite, leche de tamaño grande y pequeño en cajas, fideos, papel higiénico, sal en paquetes, sillao, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, sardinas, papa, cebolla, tomate, entre otros, para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  

Diana tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer muy entusiasta, perseverante e independiente, además le gusta manejar su dinero y  tiene como meta ampliar el negocio de comida abriendo un restaurante y también quiere vender ropa.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Organizadas,” she lives in San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres province, Huicungo state. She sells groceries, cosmetics, and sells prepared food. The business is located in her home on Jr. Libertad at Arica s/n, a place where she waits for her customers with friendly service. The majority of her customers are neighbors, friends and visitors. Diana decided to begin this business in order to generate income and contribute to the household expenses because she still has children studying in school. With this loan for S/.3,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy rice, sugar in bags, oil, large and small cartons of milk, noodles, toilet paper, salt in packages, soy sauce, different flavors and brands of soda pop, sardines, potatoes, onion, tomatos, and more, in order to stock her business and satisfy the needs of her customers. Diana is 30 years old, she lives with her husband and three children who still depend upon her. She is a very enthusiastic, perseverant, and independent woman. In addition she likes to manage her money and she has the goal of expanding her food business by opening a restaurant and she also wants to sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora Fidelina, socia del BC “Micaela Bastidas”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de plátanos, yuca, limones, aguajes, paltas, frijoles, hojas de bijao, culantro, etc., en el puesto de venta que tiene en el mercado Poma Rosa de la ciudad  de Juanjui. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  racimos de plátanos, aguaje en sacos, hojas de bijao para juanes, papayas y  sacos de yuca, y de esa manera surtir más el negocio y atender las exigencias de sus clientes. Las ventas han aumentado en estos últimos tiempos por el trato que da a sus clientes.  

La señora Fidelina tiene 61 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora e independiente, vive con su hijo, quien la apoya en sus momentos libres. Su meta es aumentar el negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Fidelina, member of the Communal Bank “Micaela Bastidas,” lives in the San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres, Juanjui state. She sells bananas, yucca, lemons, aguajes, avocados, beans, bijao, cilantro, etc. in a stall that she has in the Poma Rosa market in Juanjui city. With this loan of S/.1,000 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy bunches of bananas, sacks of aguaje, bijao leaves to make juanes (a dish wrapped with the bijao leaf), papayas, sacks of yucca, and in this manner stock her business and meet the needs of her customers. The sales have increased lately because of the service she gives her customers. Fidelina is 61 years old, is a hard-working and independent woman, she lives with her son who supports her in his free time. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, aguaje, papaya, yucca, etc.

loans.name: Glinda

texts.es:
La señora Glinda, socia del Banco Comunal “María Magdalena”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Distrito de Juanjui. Tiene una quinta y alquila cuartos a personas que trabajan y a estudiantes que llegan de otros lugares. Decidió  alquilar sus cuartos porque ya no tiene ningún hijo a su cargo, además tiene que mantener su casa y los gastos que ello requiere.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará  baldes de pintura de varios colores para darle mantenimiento y poder alquilar, ya que depende mucho de la presentación de ellos para que la gente solicite sus cuartos y darle un buen precio.

La señora Glinda tiene 67 años, es una mujer amigable y siente que tiene más libertad de decidir. Espera que con estos ingresos mejorar su calidad de vida. Su meta es tener su casa arreglada para satisfacer las necesidades de los inquilinos y las demás personas que lleguen a solicitar sus cuartos.
texts.en:
Glinda is a member of the Communal Bank "María Magdalena," she lives in the San Martín area, Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui state. She has a boarding house and rents rooms to people who work and students who come from other places. She decided to rent her rooms because she doesn't have any children to take care of, in addition she has to maintain her home and meet her expenses. With this loan for S/. 1,800, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy pails of various colors of paint to maintain her rooms and be able to rent them, as much depends on the presentation of the rooms so that people request her rooms and are willing to pay her a good rental price. Glinda is 67 years old, she is a friendly woman and feels that she has liberty to make decisions for herself. She hopes that with this income her quality of life improves. Her goal is to have her house fixed to her renters satisfaction to meet the needs of her renter and other people who may arrive to rent her rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paint to paint rooms she rents.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Señora Juana, socia del Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Desde hace 6 años se dedica al diseño de modas y a la costura. El taller está ubicado en el Jr Mariscal Cáceres Nº 663, lugar donde acuden los clientes, porque es muy solicitada en la confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir, tanto por su responsabilidad, puntualidad y como también por el buen acabado que le da a sus trabajos. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas de diversos colores y calidades, moldes, agujas y repuestos para su máquina. Además desea tener en stock todo lo necesario para atender sus pedidos. También trabaja con algunas instituciones en la confección  de uniformes.
 
Juana tiene 45 años, es separada, tiene 3 hijos a quienes quiere darles un futuro mejor y además son la razón de lucha cada día. Su meta es implementar su taller con máquinas, remalladora, maniquíes entre otras cosas, y de esa manera dar trabajo a personas que lo requieran.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana S., a member of the “Micaela Bastidas” microfinance institute, lives in the San Martín region of the Mariscal Cáceres province, in the Juanjui district. Ever since the age of six, she has been involved in fashion design and dressmaking. Her sewing workshop is located on Jr Mariscal Cáceres Nº 663, where her customers frequent because of her skills in making all kinds of apparel, her dependability, her punctuality, and her high quality finished products.

With this loan of 1,200.00 PEN, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase different color thread, various types and colors of fabric, sewing patterns, needles, and spare parts for her sewing machine. Additionally, she would like to have everything she needs in stock so that she can fill her orders. She also works with schools in order to make uniforms.

Juana is 45 years of age, separated, and has 3 children whom she wishes to give a better future; they are the reason why she struggles hard everyday. Her goal is to expand her workshop with more sewing machines, overlock machines, and mannequins, among other things, thus allowing her to offer employment to whoever may need it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread, fabric, sewing patterns, needles, and spare parts for sewing her machine

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La señora Judith, socia del BC “Las Piedras”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia D. Lamas, distrito D. Tabalosos. Se dedica a la venta D. todo tipo D. dulces, panes y cecinas D. la región elaborados por ella misma, además complementa su actividad con la venta D. huevos. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el Jr. 13 D. Diciembre No 255 del barrio San Juan D. su distrito. 

DesD. niña se dedicó a esta actividad y aprendió con la ayuda D. su abuelita, y D. esta manera pueda cubrir los gastos D. su familia ante el fallecimiento D. su mamá. Por la calidad D. sus productos atienD. pedidos, sobre todo D. las rosquitas D. almidón que la gente busca para llevar a otros lugares.   

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será  cancelado en  6 meses, comprará harina D. trigo, harina D. maíz, azúcar en sacos, almidón en kilos, manteca en cajas y otros insumos que necesita a diario como leña, sal, huevos, entre otros, para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesitan y queden satisfechos con sus productos y puedan recomendarla a otras personas.

Judith tiene 48 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, quienes la apoyan en la atención D. los clientes. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas D. salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la economía D. la casa. Desea arreglar su casa para surtir más el negocio y tener un lugar fijo para sus ventas, ya que ella sale a vender en las casas y en el mercado, y lleva los pedidos que le solicitan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Judith, member of the Communal Bank "Las Piedras" lives in the San Martín region, Lamas province, Tabalosos district. She sells all sorts of candy, bread, and cured regional meat she makes herself. She supplements her sales with eggs as well. This business is based out of her home, at Jr. 13 D. Diciembre, # 255, in the neighborhood of San Juan in her district. She has been doing this since she was a girl; she learned the business from her grandmother. This is how she has paid for family expenses after her mother passed away. Due to the quality of her products, she takes orders, especially orders of bread rolls which people take everywhere. With this loan of $500 USD, she will buy wheat flour, corn flower, sacs of sugar, kilos of starch, boxes of lard and other ingredients she needs on a daily basis such as firewood, salt and eggs. All this so that her clients find what they need and leave satisfied with her products and recommend her to other people. Judith is 48 years old; she lives with her husband and children whom help her with the customers. She is a very persevering and responsible woman, with hopes to succeed and to help her husband with household finances. She would like to fix her house to stock her business better and have a permanent place from which to conduct her sales, since now she does so door to door, delivery and at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase wheat flour, corn flour, sugar, starch, lard etc.

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.es:
La señora Laurinda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Organizadas”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Huicungo. Se dedica a la venta de comida, juanes, bebidas y algunos abarrotes. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el puerto Callao de su distrito, lugar donde  acuden diariamente sus comensales, los cuales son moradores de su barrio y visitantes de otros lugares. Aprovecha la ubicación de su casa porque el puerto es muy concurrido y es punto de partida y llegada de  las embarcaciones que hacen transporte hacia las demás localidades de esa parte de la región. 

Con este crédito de S/ 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, y de esa manera poder surtir bien el negocio y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Laurinda tiene 53 años, es una mujer decidida, alegre y muy trabajadora. Tiene como meta implementar, ampliar y arreglar su casa para dar comodidad y  seguridad a su negocio porque  su clientela está en aumento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Laurinda belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Organizadas" (organized women). She lives in the Region of San Martin, Mariscal Caceres Province, Huicingo district. She works selling food, juanes (a typical dish of rice and meat wrapped in a bijao or banana leaf), drinks, and some basic need items. Her business is located in her own home, in the Callao harbor of her district, a place to which people, both neighbors and visitors from other places, go daily to eat. She takes advantage of the location of her house because the harbor is very popular and is the point of departure and arrival of ships that transport to other locations from that part of the region.

With this loan of S/ 3,000, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy basic need products such as rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil, different sizes of boxes of preserves, packages of toilet paper, detergent, different brands and sizes of soap, among other things. In this way she will be able to stock her business well and ensure her customers find what they are looking for.

Laurinda is 53 years old, she is a decisive, joyful, and hard-working woman. Her goal is to build, expand, and accommodate her home to offer comfort and security to her business because clientele is increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic need items (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
La señora Lily, pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las perlitas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de refrigerios, como jugos de frutas naturales, tamales, juanes, humitas, arroz chaufa, papa rellena, cutacho, kekes, sándwiches y refrescos. El negocio lo realiza en la casa de su suegra, en el Jr, Libertad Nº 460,  lugar donde acuden sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, colegiales y transeúntes.

Con este crédito recibido de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de potes de un cuarto de kilo, azúcar, leña, maíz, arroz, papa, huevo, frutas naturales, panes, y otros ingredientes que a diario necesita para la preparación de los refrigerios que oferta.

Lily es natural de San Antonio de Cumbaza, lugar donde ella cultiva la uva,  tiene 21 años, es una mujer responsable y emprendedora. Su meta es la de industrializar las uvas en la elaboración de mermeladas y néctares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lily belongs to the "Meanwhile" Credit Group, "Little Pearl" division. She lives in the San Martin providence in the district of Tarapoto. She is a food saleswomen, including fruit juices, tamales, juanes (a typical andean food), sweet corn, a rice and meat dish (arroz chaufa), stuffed potatoes, a plantain and peanut dish (cutacho), pastries (kekes), sandwiches and soft drinks. Lily operates the business out of her mother-in-law's house, which is located at 460 Jr. Libertado street. The majority of her clients are neighbors, schoolchildren and passers-by. With the 1,000 soles loan which will be repaid in 6 months, Lily will purchase a 1/4 kilogram pot as well as sugar, wood, corn, rice, potatoes, eggs, fruit, bread and other ingredients that she needs to prepare her dishes. Lily is from San Antonio de Cumbaza, where she also works as a grape-harvester. She is 21 years old and a responsible and enterprising woman. Her goal is to industrialize the process of making grapes into nectars and marmalades.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, wood, corn, rice, potatoes, eggs, fruit, and bread

loans.name: Ernesto Javier

texts.es: Ernesto Javier B. tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua. Su compañera de vida es ama de casa, se dedica al cuido del hogar y de su hija de 10 años de edad. Ernesto se dedica a la distribución de pan desde hace 6 años, actividad que inició con capital propio. Se encarga de distribuir pan en varias pulperías de algunos barrios de Managua, y su plan es poder ampliar la red de distribución que actualmente tiene. El medio utilizado en esta actividad es la bicicleta, el uso del préstamo será para reforzar la línea de distribución, invertirá en la compra de más inventario para así poder agrandar más el servicio. Espera poder mantener la estabilidad económica que hasta ahora ha tenido, para así darle a su familia todo lo que necesite
texts.en:
Ernesto Javier B. is 42 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. His wife is a housewife who takes care of their home and their 10 year old daughter. Ernesto has been distributing bread for 6 years, an activity he began with his own savings. He is in charge of distributing bread to convenience stores in various neighborhoods in Managua. His plan is to be able to expand his distribution network that he has. He distributes bread by bicycle, and he will use the loan to increase his distribution line, investing in purchasing more inventory in order to be able to expand his service. He hopes to be able to maintain his economic stability that until now he has had, thereby being able to give his family everthing that his family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase distribution line of bread

loans.name: Lita Elinor

texts.es:
La señora Lita, socia D. Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en la región  San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Distrito de Juanjui, de profesión Secretaria. Lita y su esposo cuentan con una emisora radial para dar oportunidad de trabajo a quienes lo requieran. Ya tiene 5 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien. Se dedica a la administración de su empresa radial.

Con este crédito de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará una computadora bien implementada que tanta falta le hace en su emisora, y otros equipos que son muy indispensable para el buen funcionamiento de la emisora radial y poder dar un buen servicio a los clientes y a la comunidad. 

La señora Lita tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo que aún está a su cargo. Es una mujer muy responsable, carismática y sobre todo decidida. Su meta es seguir implementando su emisora para tener más cobertura y llegar a más ciudades de la región.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lita, member of the "Hidden Treasure" community bank, lives in in the San Martin region, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the district of Juanjul. She is a secretary by trade. Lita and her husband own a radio station which offers job opportunities to those that need them. She has already been doing this activity for 5 years and things are going very well for her. She works as a manager at her radio station. With this 3,000 soles loan which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase a well-functioning computer, which she is lacking in her business, as well as other pieces of equipment needed in running a radio station so that she can offer a high quality service to her clients and the community. Lita is 35 years old and lives with her husband and son, whom is still under her care. She is a responsible, charismatic, and above all else dedicated woman. Her goal is to continue expanding her radio so that she can increase it's coverage and transmit it to more cities in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer and other equipment needed in managing a radio station.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa tiene 30 años de tener un negocio de venta de comida, cuando comenzó lo tenia cerca del mercado del municipio, ahora cuenta con un local propio y mejor ubicado. 

Ella no ha tenido el apoyo de mi esposo, y  siempre me ha defendido sola.  Comenta que ha tenido decepciones en la vida, pero gracias a Dios siempre  ha salido adelante.  Les ha brindado sus estudios a sus 6 hijos, 5 ya están casados, y uno que aun le ayuda en el negocio.

Durante todo el tiempo que ella ha tenido su negocio, se ha ganado el respeto de toda la gente.  Ahora tiene más pedidos de comida para desayunos  y almuerzos.  Este préstamo lo solicita para comprar más ollas, una estufa más grande, mesas,  sillas y utensilios de cocina, así como para comprar un mostrador para poner mis utensilios de cocina.

Ella agradece mucho el apoyo que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa has had a business selling food for 30 years, when she started it was located close to the municipal market, now she has her own locale in a better location.

She didn't have the support of her spouse and she has always taken care of herself. She says that she has had disappointments in life, but thank God she has always been able to overcome them. She has provided an education to her 6 children, 5 of whom are now married, and one that still helps her with the business.

During all the time she has had her business, she has earned the respect of those around her. Now she has more orders for breakfast and lunch meals. This loan she seeks will be used to buy more pots, a larger stove, talbes, chairs, and kitchen utensils, and also to buy a counter to put her kitchen utensils.

She is very thankful for the support she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils, a larger stoves, tables, chairs, and a counter.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Lucinda, socia del Banco Comunal, “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Tiene un taller de mecánica donde reparan todo tipo de vehículos menores, sobre todo motocicletas y motocarros. El taller está ubicado en su casa en el Jr Trujillo, la Merced c-3. Los clientes son mayormente los motocarristas y personas que tienen moto en la ciudad.
 
Con este crédito de  S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará una máquina taladro que es muy necesario en el taller. Dado la buena acogida que tiene, necesita implementar el taller con más materiales para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, quienes a diario llegan con sus movilidades para ser reparados y así poder seguir circulando.   

La señora Lucinda tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes aún dependen de ella, los cuales también la apoyan en algunas actividades del taller. Es una persona perseverante y luchadora, quien anhela  ampliar y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucinda, member of the "Santa Rose de Lima" community bank, lives in the suburb of San Martin in the province of Marsical Cáceres in the district of Juanjul. She has a mechanical workshop where she repairs all types of small vehicles, especially motorbikes and motorcycles. The workshop is located in her house on Jr. Trujillo street in "la Merced" c-3. Her clients are mostly motortaxi drivers and others who have motorbikes in the city. With the 500 soles loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase a mechanical drill, which is essential in a workshop. Due to the good reception that she has had, she needs to equip the workshop with more materials to offer her clients a good service, including repairing their vehicles the same day so that they can continue working. Lucinda is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children who are still her dependents and assist her in the workshop. She is a persevering and fighting person who longs to expand and fix-up her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mechanical drill

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La señora Ludith, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Organizadas”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín y Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Distrito de Huicungo. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a  la venta de cosméticos y  comidas en el kiosco de la escuela Nº 0419, sus clientes son los alumnos y profesores.
 
Con este crédito de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes, colonias, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, talcos, etc., de esa manera poder surtir su negocio y luego los vende al precio de catalogo, generando un mayor margen de utilidad a su favor. También comprará arroz, plátano, papa, huevos, panes, galletas, caramelos, dulces, gaseosa, Kekes, frugos (pulpin, cifrut). Y los insumos que a diario necesita para preparar los platos que oferta a sus clientes.

Judith tiene 43 años y es soltera. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es continuar con sus negocios para aumentar sus ingresos y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Judith, member of the "Organized Women" community bank, lives in the suburb of San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres in the district of Huicungo. For three years she has been selling cosmetics and food in the school corner shop # 0416. Her clients are students and teachers. With the 3,000 soles loan which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase on-sale beauty products, such as perfumes, colognes, deodorant, jewelry, nail polish, and talc. In this way, she will be able to supply her business with products to later sell at catalogue-price, and generate a greater profit margin. She will also purchase rice, bananas, potatoes, eggs, breads, crackers, candy, sweets, soda, kekes (andean pastry), frugos, and other products which she needs to cook the dishes she sells.
