Judith is 43 years old and is single. She has always stood out for being a hard-working woman and a good manager. Her goal is to continue with her business to increase her income and continue ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase on-sale beauty products as well as rice, bananas, potatoes, eggs, breads, crackers, candy, sweets, soda, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Piedras”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Tabalosos. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y frutas, sobre todo plátanos. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Miraflores  Nº 250. Las frutas las lleva al mercado de la ciudad de Tarapoto para venderlas al por mayor, y de esa manera abastece a los vendedores minoristas de frutas.
 
Decide iniciarse en el negocio por la iniciativa de su mamá para poder generar ingresos y contribuir en los gastos de su casa y las de su hijo, ya que ella es madre soltera. Ahora está agradecida a su mamá porque le está yendo muy bien, empezó sólo con frutas y ahora vende también abarrotes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual cancelará en 6 meses comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite, leche en tamaño grande y pequeño en cajas, fideos, papel higiénico, sal en paquetes, sillao, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, sardinas, papa, cebolla, tomate, entre otros, y una parte también lo invertirá en frutas y de esa manera podrá surtir el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  

Tiene 39  años de edad, vive con su hijo que aun dependen de ella,  es una mujer muy entusiasta y perseverante, le gusta el negocio, tiene como meta tener su casa propia y surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita, member of the "Rock" community bank, lives in the suburb of San Martin, in the province of Lamas, in the district of Tabalosos. She sells groceries and fruit, especially bananas. The business is located in her own house, at 250 Jr. Mifraflores street. Margarita brings the fruits to the Tarapoto city market to sell them to the public, and to other small fruit vendors. It was her mom's idea that Margarita begin this business so that she could earn an income and contribute to the family's expenses as well as her son's, as Margarita is a single mother. Now she is thankful for her mother's idea because business is going well. She began only selling fruits, but now she sells groceries as well. With the 2,000 soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk in bulk and in individual containers, noodles, toilet paper, packets of salt, soy-sauce, a variety of sizes and brands of soft drinks, sardines, potatoes, onions, and tomatoes among other things. She will also purchase fruit, and in this way be able to supply her business and satisfy the clients' needs. She is 39 years old, and lives with her son, who is still her dependent. Margarita is an enthusiastic and persevering woman. She likes her business. Her goal is to own her own house and to continue supplying her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc. as well as fruit.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria Natividad, tiene  una pequeña tienda de venta de productos de consumo básico, la heredo de su padre, quien tuvo este negocio por mas de 35 años.  Poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su negocio, con los pequeños préstamos que FAPE le ha dado.

Ella es madre soltera con una hija, y quiere darle lo mejor posible, en educación y salud.

Además los días sábados tiene una venta de comida,  de papas fritas y pollo. 

Ahora ella necesita un crédito un poco mayor  para comprar mas producto para su tienda, quiere comprar más verduras, frutas, mas aguas gaseosas, surtir mas con golosinas, algunos trastes de cocina también, quiere comprar ollas de barro, todo lo indispensable, ya que vive en una aldea muy alejada del municipio. 

Espero que me den estos préstamos ya que lo necesito mucho.
texts.en:
Maria Natividad owns a small shop, which sells basic food products. She inherited the shop from her father, who owned the business for over 35 years. Little by little she has grown the business with the loans FAPE has given her. She is a single mother with one daughter. She wants to give her daughter the best possible education and healthcare. Also, Saturdays she sells food, including fries and chicken. Now she needs a slightly larger loan to purchase more products for her store. She wants to buy more vegetables, fruit, soft drinks, sweets and kitchen utensils such as a clay pot. Everything is necessary as she lives in a village very far from the capital. She hopes that you will give her the loan because she needs it very much.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to supply her store as well as a clay pot.

loans.name: Maria Geny

texts.es:
La señora Maria Geny, socia del BC “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en el Av. Salaverry No 198, lugar donde atiende a sus clientes, los cuales son sus vecinos y transeúntes que visitan su distrito.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en  4 meses, comprará chupetines en cajas, galletas de distintas variedades en cajas, chocolates en cajas, chicles en bolsas, chizitos, papas, chifles en sobres y gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores. De esa manera sus clientes podrán encontrar lo que requieran.

Maria Geny tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y  con su última hija quien la apoya en la atención de los clientes. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante y también apoyar a su esposo en la economía de la casa. Desea seguir creciendo en el negocio y tenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Geny, member of the community bank "Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo", lives in the region and province of San Martín, district of Morales. She sells sweets and sodas. The business is located in her home where she serves her customers, which are her neighbors and visitors to the neighborhood. With this loan of $350 US, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy lollipops in cases, cases of several varieties of cookies, cases of chocolate, bags of gum, snack foods, and different brands, sizes and flavors of sodas. This will allow her customers to find whatever they may need. Maria Geny is 48 years old, lives with her husband and her youngenst daughter who helps her wait on customers. She is a very determined and responsible woman, with the desire to get ahead and also to assist her husband with the household finances. She wishes to continue to grow the business and to keep it well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lollipops, cookies, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Lenuel

texts.es: Disculpen les envio la foto del señor lenuel P.
texts.en:
Disculpen les envio la foto del señor lenuel P.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taller de torno y soldadura

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo”, vive en la Región y Provincia San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en el Jr Alfonso Ugarte Nº 164,  lugar donde acuden diariamente sus comensales, los cuales son moradores de su barrio y visitantes de otros lugares. 

Con el crédito de S/.2,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores y otros ingredientes que necesita para la preparación diaria de los platos que oferta a sus clientes como verduras, carnes (res, cerdo, pollo, pescado). Quiere tener todo listo para esperar las fiestas patronales de su distrito donde está asegurada las ventas.

La señora Maria Luisa tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos que aún depende de ella. Es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora, tiene como meta ampliar su local porque su clientela va en aumento y así poder atenderlos con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo, “ she lives in the region and province of San Martín, Morales district. She sells traditional food. Her business is located in her home at Jr Alfonso Ugarte Nº 164, where daily her customers gather, and they are regular customers from her neighborhood and visitors from other places. With the loan for S/.2,500.00 which will be reapdi in 4 months, she will buy rice, sack of sugar, gallon of oil, different brands and flavors of soda pop and other ingredients she needs to daily prepare her food that she offers her customers such as vegetables, meat (beef, pork, chicken, fish). She wants to have everything ready in anticipation of the national holidays of her state when sales are assured. Maria Luisa is 47 years old, she lives with her husband and one of their children who is still dependent on her. She is a decisive and happy woman and a good manager. She has a goal of expanding her locale because her customer base is expanding and in this way she will be able to serve them with greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, soda pop, etc.

loans.name: Maria Nereidith

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Elena, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Piedras”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Tabalosos. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y de verduras. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Amazonas C-03, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, los cuales son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual cancelará en 6 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, y de esa manera poder surtir bien el negocio y que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan. Quiere aprovechar las fiestas patronales de su distrito. 

Maria Elena tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de salir adelante con su negocio. Su meta es tener su minimarket y construir cuartos en su casa para alquilar
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena, member of the Communal Bank “Las Piedras,” lives in the San Martín region, Lamas province, Tabalosos district. She sells groceries and vegetables. Her business is located in her own home at Jr. Amazonas C-03, where her customers, who are primarily her neighbors, gather daily. With this loan for S/.1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy basic needs products such as rice, sack of sugar, milk, oil, canned goods of different sizes, packages of toilet paper, detergent, different brands and sizes of soap and more. In this way she can stock her store well and have what her customers seek. She wants to take advantage of the upcoming national holidays in her district. Maria Elena is 44 years old, she lives with her husband and children who are still dependent on her. She is a hard-working woman, charismatic, and with great desires to be successful in her business. Her goal is to have a minimarket and build rooms in her home to rent.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de comida, menestras y mote sancochado. El negocio está ubicado en un puesto del mercado Nº 02 de la ciudad, lugar donde acuden sus comensales, los cuales son mayormente los vendedores de ese sector y transeúntes del lugar.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de sus platos, como azúcar, arroz en sacos, aceite en galón, fideos en paquetes, y demás insumos que compra a diario, también comprará menestras y maíz para sancocharlos y luego venderlos.     

La señora Maria Virginia tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijas, quienes la apoyan en sus momentos libres en las actividades de la casa. Ella trabaja diariamente para sacar adelante a sus hijos y también quiere darles un futuro mejor. Es una mujer muy activa, tiene como meta contar con un local para poner un restaurante con la venta de menú, y contar con un personal bajo su administración.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Virginia is a member of the “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) microfinance institute. She lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the Tarapoto district. She sells food, vegetable stews, and mote sancochado (corn kernels boiled with cilantro). Her business is located in a stand in the Nº 02 market of the city, where her patrons, who are predominantly market vendors and passers-by, got to have a meal.

With this loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare her meals, such as sugar, sacks of rice, gallons of cooking oil, packages of noodles, and other ingredients that she buys on a daily basis. She will also purchase legumes and corn in order to boil them in cilantro and sell them.

Ms. Maria Virginia is 37 years of age and lives with her husband and 2 daughters, who support her in their spare time with the household chores. Maria Virginia works everyday in order to help her children get ahead and offer them a better future. She is a very active woman who has the goal of obtaining a business space to set up a restaurant, offering an extensive menu, as well as having personnel under her administration.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare meals (sugar, rice, cooking oil, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Marilu, socia del Banco Comunal  “Mujeres Decididas” vive en el departamento y provincia de  San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta repuestos y lubricantes para todo tipo de vehículos (carros, motos), su negocio esta  ubicado  en el  Jr Shapaja  C-2, a donde a diario acuden sus clientes que en su mayoría son los motocarristas y  personas que tienen movilidad para adquirir sus productos.

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1 500.00, para ser pagado en 6 meses, comprará repuestos y accesorios diversos, lubricantes para vehículos motorizados por docenas, para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesitan y así poder fidelizar a sus clientes.   

Tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos, quienes son su motor para seguir trabajando y darles un futuro mejor, es una mujer muy optimista que anhela mas adelante tener bien surtido su negocio y tener presencia y prestigio en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ms. Marilu V., a member of the “Mujeres Decididas” (Resolute Women) microfinance institute, lives in the department and province of San Martín, in the Tarapoto district. She sells spare parts and motor oil for all types of vehicules (cars and motorcycles). Her business is located on Jr Shapaja C-2, where her customers—who are mostly motorcycle taxi drivers and people who own vehicules—go to purchase her products.

With this loan of 1,500.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase spare parts, various car accessories, and motor oil by the dozen so that her customers can find with they need in her shop, thus allowing her to foster customer loyalty.

She is 31 years of age and lives with her husband and 3 children, who propel her to keep working in order to offer them a better future. She is a very optimistic woman who longs to have a well-stocked and prestigious business in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted car accessories, spare parts and motor oil

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La señora Mery, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín,  provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a  la venta de ropa y sandalias. Desarrolla su negocio en el mercado de la ciudad. Sus clientes son las personas que a diario visitan el mercado a quienes atiende con mucha amabilidad.

Se inició en el negocio porque le gusta, además le permite generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Está contenta con lo logrado hasta la fecha. El negocio ha crecido ya que ella se inició sólo con sandalias. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños como polos, blusas, pantalones, shorts, ropa interior y sandalias de diferentes modelos, colores y tallas, con la finalidad de satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes.

La señora Mery tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, quien es su motor para seguir trabajando. Se caracteriza por ser amable y cordial con sus clientes.  Más adelante quiere contar con un local propio para asegurar y crecer más en su negocio porque vende en el suelo, en un espacio del mercado.
texts.en:
Señora Mery is a member of the "Judith Tuanama" Communal Bank and lives in the San Martin department of El Dorado province, in the San José de Sisa district. She sells clothing and sandals in the city market. Her clients are the people who visit the market each day, whom she attends in a very friendly manner.

She first became involved in this business because she enjoyed it, and because it allowed her to generate income and to help her husband pay for their household expenses. She is content with what she has achieved up to this point. She business has grown; when she started out, she sold only sandals.

With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy women's, men's, and children's clothing like polo shirts, blouses, pants, shorts, underwear and different styles, colors and sizes of sandals, in an effort to satisfy her customers' needs.

Mery is 24 years old and lives with her husband and their young son, who is her motivation to keep working. Mery is always friendly and polite with her clients. In the future, she wants to have her own store for stability's sake and to help grow her business, since she currently spreads her wares out on the ground in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for men, women and children.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Juana Teodora

texts.es: La señora G. H., tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, es madre de un hijo el cual tiene 13 años de edad el cual cursa el sexto grado de primaria, su conyugue esta sin empleo atendiendo una pequeña pulperia, que tiene en conjunto con su esposa en su casa de habitacion, mientras la señora se desempeña como comerciante de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, teniendo como proposito con los creditos poder fortalecer su negocio de pulperia a fin de poder mejorar sus condiciones economicas y dejar de vender de forma ambulante frutas y verduras, la cual tiene ocho años de desempeñar, actividad con la cual ha dado continuidad a los estudios de su hijo y de igual manera a llevado el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Ms. G. H. is a 40-year-old married mother of a 13-year-old son, who is in 6th grade. Her spouse is currently unemployed, so he is running a small general store in their home that he and his wife own. Meanwhile, she works as a fruit and vegetable street vendor. She is requesting this loan with the aim of strengthening their general store business so that they can improve their financial status and she can stop working as a street vendor, which she has been doing for eight years. With this job, she has been able to both provide an education for her son and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Ileana Sofia

texts.es: La señora Ilena V. tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 5 años de edad que cursa el tercer grado de primaria, vive en casa propia, su actividad economica es la comercializacion de cosmeticos y ropa como perfumes y blusas para damas, tambien se dedica a dar clases de español a extranjeros en su casa de habitacion, para lo cual con un poco mas de apoyo poder concretizar una escuela o un salon de estudios de español para extranjeros, ya que ella es licencianda en Español, obteniendo otras fuentes de ingresos al ofrecer estas clases. Su mayor sueño es poder obtener el apoyo de una mano amiga que le ayude a desarrollar su proyecto, ya que en leon son muy pocos los centros de aprendizajes para extranjeros, y los pocos que hay tiene altos costos, que al contrario de estos centros  ella ofrece un servicio personalizado y bajos costos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ilena V. is 30 years old. She is a single mom and has a 5-year-old daughter who is in 3rd grade. She owns her home and her business is selling cosmetics and clothes, like perfumes and women's blouses. She also works teaching Spanish to foreigners in her boarding house, which she thinks with a little more support she will be able to realize into a school or classroom for Spanish studies for foreigners, since she has a degree in Spanish. Offering these classes would allow her to obtain more sources of income. Her greatest dream is to get support from a friendly hand that will help her develop her project, given the lack of schools for foreigners, and the high cost of the few that exist. In contrast to the existing learning centers, she offers a personalized service at a low cost.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Doña Isidora M. tiene 43 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, mayores de edad, es casada, su esposo es guarda de seguridad, su proposito es poder mejorara sus condicones de vida y ampliar su negocio siendo este una pequeña pulperia, tambien tiene un pequeño kiosko donde ofrece productos como gasesosa, bisuteria, golosina actividad que tiene poco tiempo de desempeñar ya que ella es una mujer muy luchadora y busca opciones de negocio por consiguiente de obtener otros ingresos para el nucleo familiar ya que aunque no tenga dependientes tiene que buscar el sustento diario. Uno de sus mayores sueños es poder mejorar las condicones de infraestructura de su vivienda y con los creditos poder ampliar y fortalecer el invetario de su pulperia de tal manera que las ganancias de su pequeño negocio tambien tener un poco mas de condiciones de vida, contando con el apoyo de manos amigas e instituciones que crean en su idea de negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isidora M. is a 43-year-old married woman with two grown-up children. Her husband works as a security guard. Her goal is to be able to improve her living conditions and expand her general store. She also owns a small stand in which she sells products like soft drinks, costume jewelry, and candy. She has not had this business for very long, but she is a fighter who is always looking for business opportunities in order to earn extra income for her family. Even though she no longer has dependants, she still needs to earn a living. One of her greatest dreams is to be able to improve her home’s infrastructure. With the loan, she wants to increase her store’s inventory so much that the profits from her small business will improve her living conditions. She is counting on the support of friendly hands and institutions that will believe in her business plans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Yader Jose

texts.es:
El señor yader R. tiene 29 años de edad, es soletero no le tienen hijos, habita en casa de familiares, su nivel de escolaridad es primaria cursada, la actividad economica que el señor tiene es la comercializacion de cerdos en pie que posteriormente comercializa a clientes que le encargan de acuerdoa a la necesidad del mercado y sector al cual se orienta.
El señor tiene como proposito mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y mejor un area para poder criar cerdos que en la actualidad solo compra y entrega, y buscar la manera de ir creciendo en su actividad, en dicho negocio tiene  cinco años de ejercerlo dando inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y una forma de subsistencia.
texts.en:
Señor Yader R. is 29 years old, single, and does not have any children. He lives in the home of his relatives and went to school through the primary grades. His job is selling pigs on foot. He sells them to clients that put him in charge of delivering the pigs from the market to the desired locations. Yader's goal is to improve his conditions of living and also create an area to be able to raise pigs that, presently, he just buys and delivers; he is searching for a way to do his own raising of pigs in this business. He has five years experience in this business, which has given him an alternative to unemployment and a form of subsistence.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Denis Julian

texts.es: Don Denis H., es un hombre que tiene 43 años de edad, es casado le tiene tres hijos con edades comprendidas entre los doce, diez, y ocho años respectivamente cursando la primaria todos , su esposa se desempeña como cajera  en una tienda comercial, el proposito del señor es poder ampliar sus condiciones de vida y economicas, darse a conocer ante el mercado como joyero, y no solamente darse a conocer a nivel nacional sino a nivel internacional como han llegado a darse a conocer otras joyerias de nicaragua producto del buen servicio y calidad del trabajo que ofertan, su mayor sueño es poder darle a sus hijos una enseñanza a fin de que se puedan desarrollar como profesionales, tambien tiene el deseo de instalar un local propio ya que actualmente alquila y trabajar con equipos modernos y generar empleos, el señor H., da inicio en esta actividad como apreniz y con el tiempo poco a poco a llegado a independizarse e instalar su propia joyeria.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis H. is a 43 year old man, married, with three children ages 12, 10 and 8 years old, all of whom are in primary school. His wife works as a cashier in a local store. Mr. H.'s intention is to improve his income and standard of living, become known as a jeweler, not only nationally but internationally, as other Nicaraguan jewelry stores have become known for their good service and quality work that they offer. His greatest dream is to be able to provide his children an education so that they may become professionals, also he has the wish to open his own locale as today he rents and to work with modern equipment and generate jobs. Mr, H. begins this business as an apprentice and with time little by little will become independent and open his own jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for his business

loans.name: Josefa Blasina

texts.es: La señora Blasina O., tiene sesenta años de edad, es casada, madre de once hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad, y en su defecto ellos ya trabajan y le ayudan, la actividad economica de la señora es la comercializacion de productos del hogar relacionados con su pequeña pulperia, teniendo tambien el negocio de la venta y comercializacion de tortillas, actividad con la cual crio a sus hijos, ya que su esposo ha sido albañil y los ingresos del nucleo familiar eran pocos para la cantidad de hijos que procrearon . En la actualidad doña Blasina tiene como meta poder ampliar su negocio y mantener su taller de tortilleria donde sus clientes ya le conocen.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blasina O. is 60 years old, married, and has eleven grown children. Now that they are on their own, they work and help her out. Her business involves the sale of home products, in conjunction with her small grocery store. She also makes and sells tortillas, an activity which helped her support her children as they were growing up. Her husband was in construction and his income was low for the number of children they had and needed to support. Currently, Blasina’s goal is to expand her business and maintain her tortilla workshop where her customers already know her.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Heut

texts.en: Mr. Heut T., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Sareat Ros, 28, are farmers as well as carpenters for a small private enterprise. Their combined income is approximately US$5 per day. Besides making furniture, they also grow rice as a supplemental income for the family. They live with their three children in Chrey Commune in the Battembang Province; all the children living in the family's home and attend school. When the raining season began, Heut started to grow the rice crop. Because his farmland is infertile, he needs to use fertilizer to get high rice yield, but he lacks money to do it. Hence, he decided to request a loan of US$200 to purchase fertilizer. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: On

texts.en: Mrs. On S., 47, with her husband, Mr. Leum Lay, 36, makes charcoal to sell, earning US$5 per day. She sells the charcoal from her house to her customers, who are wholesalers who come to buy at a low price. Because her income does not support the family's expenses sufficiently, Mrs. On and her husband discussed their income and family expenses, and she wants to increase her income from charcoal selling by transporting the product to customers’ homes. To achieve her plan, she needs to purchase two oxen and a cart to use for transportation. She faces, however, the obstacle of lacking money to carry out this plan. She heard about Kiva loans through a promotion of HKL (Kiva’s Field Partner). Hence, Mrs. On needs a loan of US$1,200 to purchase two oxen and a cart to use in her business. The loan will improve her business and increase their income, and she can support the family's living expenses sufficiently and their children's education as well. Mrs. On and her husband are in the picture with her charcoal kiln.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen and a cart to transport charcoal

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret L., 40, and her husband, Mr. Maly Mao, 46, are rice farmers. They have been farming for 28 years. With their experience, they earns approximately four dollars per day. The couple has three children: one repairs air conditioners, earning $60 per month; another works as a construction worker, earning $60 per day; and another is a student. All of them are living in the family's home in Andong Krosang Village, within the Snam Preah Commune, Pursat Province.

To increase the family's income, Saret needs to improve her farming business by expanding the amount of farmland they own. Hence, she decided to request a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a plot of farmland one hectare use for increasing their ability to grow rice. The loan will allow her to expand the farming business and improve the family's living conditions. Mrs. Saret's husband is pictured because Saret was not available.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland one hectare use for increasing her rice crop

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap H., 54, H. been selling groceries in Samakie Village since 1979. She sells meat, vegetable, and other food items from her house, and earns around 12,000 Riel ($3) per day. Her husband, Mr. Seng Ly, 56, sells Khmer noodles. Sopheap H. four children, two of whom are tailors and another one works as mirror cutter. The children help support the family.

Sopheap H. attracted a lot of customers, but she lacks the capital to purchase more groceries and increase her stock of goods for expanding the business. Sopheap heard about the low-interest loans and quality service that Kiva offers through Hattha Kaksekar Limited. So she is requesting a loan 1,100,000 Riel ($275) to increase the inventory of groceries to sell. She plans to use the loan to improve her business and increase her income to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mwadhani

texts.en:
Mwadhani R. is a single woman with one child aged 3 years old. Mwadhani is 24 years old, and she started running a used clothes business in 2005. Used clothes from Europe and USA are imported to Africa and re-sold. Many people like them because they are cheap.

Mwadhani earns about US$ 60 per month. Mwadhani is requesting a loan of US$ 275 in order to purchase additional stocks of used clothes. She has one employee to help her in her business. In futurer she plans to open another business.

She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
This is a 45-year-old married woman with three children aged between 19 and 22. Her name is Hamisa R.. She started her stationery business in 2000 and she sells office equipment such as books and pens. She also offers secretarial services such as printing, lamination and typing. One employee and her husband are the only people assisting her to run this business.

Currently Hamisa has been earning a monthly profit of $110. She is requesting a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock: books, glue, writing pads, and counter books. Hamisa works six days per week and 10 hours per day. In future she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock.

She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks books, glue, writing pads, and counter books.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania!

Asha Mwagu is a Tanzanian married women and a SELFINA client. She is 35 years old with three children aged between 4 and 14. Asha established her bar and poultry businesses two years ago. She has been earning a monthly profit of about US$ 580 from these businesses.

Asha is requesting a loan of US$ 875 in order to buy additional drinks for her bar such as sodas and beer, and also to purchase additional chicks in her poultry business. Asha is assisted by her husband and one employee in running these businesses. In future she plans to open another business. She thank you for your support.

A Tanzanian bar is a good place to relax with a beer. If you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. You can relax on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting 'mishikaki' (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to everyone who happens to wander by.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To buy additional drinks for her bar; also to purchase additional chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Tatu B. from Dar es salaam. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 18, and is also responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Tatu operates a cosmetics and African traditional cloth businesses eight hours per day, seven days a week, earning a monthly income of about $200.

She is now requesting a loan of $275 in order to buy additional cosmetics and traditional African food. In the future, she plans to establish another business.

Tatu thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics and traditional African food.

loans.name: Latipha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is Latipha W., 25, from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has a one-year-old child. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two other dependants because their parents cannot take care of them. Latipha has been running a beauty salon business since 2005. Client business is good. She works at the business for 13 hours a day, 6 days a week and is assisted by one employee. Latifa currently earns about $50 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 USD to purchase a dryer and other hair products such as wigs. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Latipha thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. loans.use: To purchase a dryer and other hair products such as wigs

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 42-year-old Fausta M. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with 2 children, 9 years old and 21 years old. Fausta has been running a bar business since 2003. This SELFINA client's business is doing well. She works at the business 16 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by one employee.

Fausta currently earns about US$ 300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional drinks such as beer, soda, and juices. In the future, she plans to renovate her business's building. Fausta thank you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchese additional drinks such as beer, soda, and juices for re-sale

loans.name: Kalunde

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is Kalunde Fundikira, 49. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 14 and 20. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Kalunde owns a store where she sells traditional African cloth such as vitenge and kanga. She established her business in 2007. She works at the business for four hours a day, two days a week and is assisted by one employee. Kalunde currently earns about $200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 USD to purchase additional African cloth. In the future, she plans to expand as well as to open another shop. Kalunde thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. loans.use: To purchase additional stock of Traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Medina M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 2 children, 5 months and 2 years old. Medina has been running a grocery since 2006. She sells sugar, salt, rice, wheat flour, etc. This SELFINA client's business is doing well. She works at the business for 16 hours per day.

Medina currently earns about US$ 300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional stocks of cooking oil, soda, and rice. In the future, she plans to expand and establish another shop. Medina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cooking oil, soda, and rice

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Halima C. from Dar Es Salaam. She is married. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 1 dependent who is an orphan. Halima has been running a grocery business since 2000, and her business is performing well. She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 7 days per week. Halima currently earns about $300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of wheat flour, rice, and maize flour, sugar, etc. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

Halima thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 34-year-old Agnes C. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 1 child, 12 years old. Agnes has been running a café (mama lishe) business. This SELFINA client's business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by 4 employees. Agnes currently earns about US$ 300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional equipment for her business such as chairs, tables, and rice. In the future, she plans to buy more equipment.

Agnes thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her business such as chairs, tables, and rice

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, madame Akossiwa K. est née à Lomé le 24 Août 1964. Commerçante  de produits de première nécessité, elle vit avec son  mari, un mécanicien auto au chômage. Madame Akossiwa K. est seule à s’occuper de la plus grande partie des charges financières de la maison, ce qui ne lui permet pas de faire des stocks de produits en quantité suffisante dont elle a besoin pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle sollicite ce crédit afin d’augmenter sa part de marché pour la satisfaction d’un grand nombre de clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akossiwa K. was born on the 24 of August, 1964. She is married and the mother of two (2) children, She is a seller of basic necessity products and lives with her husband, who is an unemployed auto mechanic. Mrs. Akossiwa K., alone, carries most of the financial responsibility for the home which does not allow her to build up sufficient quantities of product supplies that she needs to satisfy her customers. Therefore, she is requesting this loan to increase her business and satisfy her large number of customers.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of  products of basic necessity

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, madame Enyonam A. vit  à Lomé avec son mari. Revendeuse de charbon de bois  et mère d’un (01) enfant. Agent commercial, son mari s’en sort difficilement car il n’arrive pas à trouver un emploi stable. Et c’est grâce à son petit commerce de charbon de bois  que madame Enyonam A.  arrive à subvenir à quelques besoins urgents de la famille. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter la quantité de son stock et en les revendant en détails qu’elle puisse réaliser d’important bénéfice pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Enyonam A., 28, lives in Lomé with her husband. She sells charcoal and is the mother of one child. Her husband, a commercial agent, is having a hard time because he hasn't managed to find a steady job. And so it is thanks to her little charcoal business that Mrs. Enyonam A. manages to provide for the most urgent needs of the family. She is requesting this loan to increase her inventory which she sells retail so that she can make more profit and satisfy the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of charcoal

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq (04) enfants, madame H. Abla est couturière de profession, elle réside à Lomé avec son mari, un journaliste caméraman. Madame H. Abla aide son mari à  s’occuper des charges financières de la maison, ce qui ne lui permet pas de faire des stocks de produits de mercerie en quantité suffisante dont elle a besoin pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle sollicite ce crédit pour pouvoir agrandir son commerce de produits de mercerie et rénover sa boutique au goût de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abia H. is married and the mother of four (4) children. She is a seamstress by trade and resides in Lomé with her husband who is a journalist cameraman. Mrs. Abia H. assists her husband in providing for the expenses of the home which does not allow her to build up a sufficient supply of products that she needs to satisfy her customers. She is therefore requesting this loan to increase her supply of sewing materials and renovate her store to her customers needs.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of sewing materials

loans.name: Enele

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 28-year-old Enele N. from Dar es Salaam She is married with 2 children. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents who are orphans.

Enele has been running a bar business since 2007. This SELFINA client's business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by 2 employees. Enele currently earns about US$ 400 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to buy additional stocks of drinks such as beer, sodas, etc. In the future, she plans to purchase additional business equipment such as tables, chairs, and glasses.

Enele thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: buy additional stocks of drinks such as beer, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 24-year-old Happiness Cholobi from Dar Es Salaam. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 5 years and 8 years. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents who are orphans. Happiness has been running a shoe business since 2007. She buys shoes at wholesale and sells them to retail customers. Her business is doing well. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Happiness currently earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 in order to buy additional shoes from wholesalers and sell them to the people in the street. In the future, she plans to establish a permanent place for her business.

Happiness thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional shoes from wholesaler and  sell them to the people in street.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Née en 1971, madame Brigitte M. est une divorcée et mère d’un (01) enfant. Depuis son enfance, elle a pris goût au commerce de poissons fumés et de légumes, mais étant divorcée elle n’a personne pour l’aider à supporter son enfant  à part son petit commerce. Ainsi elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son activité commerciale et attirer beaucoup de clientèle et sortir sa famille de son état de pauvreté.
texts.en:
Born in 1971, Mrs. Brigitte M. is divorced and the mother of one child. Since childhood, she has enjoyed being in the business of selling smoked fish and vegetables, but as she is divorced, she has no one to help her support her child. She has only her little business. Thus she is requesting financing to expand her business and attract more customers so as to bring her little family out of poverty.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of smoked fish and vegetables

loans.name: Mosy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 31-year-old Mosy C. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 4 months and 6 years. Mosy C. has been running a clothing business since 1999. She buys clothing at wholesale and sell it in her store. Her business is doing good. She works at the business for 4 hours per day. Mosy currently earns about $200 from her business as a monthly profit. She is requesting a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional clothes for both women and men. In the future, she plans to establish another business.

Mosy thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for both women and men

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Née en 1957, A. Véronique est une femme divorcée avec 5 enfants à charge. Elle fait le commerce de légumes, du poisson fumé et divers. Malgré sa bonne volonté, elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle  fautes de moyens financiers. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour consolider son activité et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et réaliser des économies afin de pouvoir faire face à l’éducation de ses enfants. Son crédit lui servira à l’achat des légumes, du  poissons et divers.
texts.en:
Born in 1957, Véronique A. is divorced, with 5 children in her care. She sells vegetables, smoked fish, and other items. Despite her good intentions, she isn’t able to satisfy her clientele due to lack of financial means. She is seeking this loan to strengthen her business, increase sales, and save money to be able to pay for her children’s education. Her loan will help her to buy vegetables, fish, and other items.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables, fish, and misc. items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 40-year-old Grace M. from Dar es Salaam She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 15 and 22. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan.

Grace M. has been running a shop since 2004. This SELFINA client's business is buying lengths of African print cloth for making women's clothes from wholesalers and re-selling it retail. She works at the business 9 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Grace M. currently earns about US$ 100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional cloth and to open another shop. In the future, she plans to expand her shop further. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for women's clothes and to open another sales point

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Née en 1983 à Lomé, Elise   K. est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est couturière et à plusieurs apprenties. Dans ses efforts pour la satisfaction d’un plus grand nombre de clients, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’équiper en matériel et en outils de travail afin d’optimiser la productivité et le rendement de son atelier.
texts.en:
Born 1983 in Lomé, Elise K. is single and has no children. She is a seamstress and has several apprentices. In her efforts to satisfy as many customers as possible, she is requesting this loan to outfit herself in materials and tools so as to optimize the productivity and output of her workshop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: outfit herself in materials and tools of her trade

loans.name: Atsupui

texts.fr: Née le 27/06/1957 à Lomé, Atsupui D.  est une célibataire avec un enfant à charge. Elle fait le commerce de maïs. Malgré sa bonne volonté, elle n’arrive pas à faire décoller ses ventes comme elle le désire. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour passer  des commandes de sacs de maïs afin de devenir grossiste elle-même. Ce qui lui permettra de faire des économies et satisfaire un grand nombre de clients.
texts.en:
Born on June 27, 1957 in Lomé, Atsupui D. is single with one child in her care. She sells maize. In spite of her best efforts, she has not been able to scale up her sales as she would like to do. She is requesting this loan to be able to order maize by the sack and so become a wholesaler herself. This will allow her to put aside some savings and satisfy more customers' needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and re-selling maize

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, monsieur Kokou A. est né le 08 Novembre 1988 à Lomé. Il a arrêté ses études très tôt faute  de moyens financiers et s’est lancé alors dans l’apprentissage de la menuiserie. Aujourd’hui il dispose de son propre atelier qu’il a loué. Faute de moyens financiers, il lui manque le plus souvent de la matière à travailler notamment le bois et à faire des expositions de ces œuvres et à payer à temps le loyer. Ce crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en bois et de satisfaire les commandes de ses clients.
texts.en:
Married and the father of three children, Mr. Kokou A. was born on November 8, 1988 in Lomé. Due to financial issues, he abandoned his studies very early on and learned furniture making. Today, he has his own rented workshop. Lacking financial means, he often does not manage to buy wood, display his works or pay the rent in time. This loan will enable him to buy wood and meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and planks

loans.name: Ahonsou

texts.fr: Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, monsieur Ahonsou D. est né le 16 Avril 1969 à Accra au Ghana. Il est menuisier de formation. Sa femme est une ménagère. Donc il est seul à faire face aux charges de la famille. Malgré ses efforts il n’arrive pas à sortir du cercle vicieux de la pauvreté. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir des outils de travail pour devenir indépendant. Actuellement il travaille avec un autre menuisier. Ce crédit lui permettra de disposer de ses propres outils de travail.
texts.en:
Married and the father of 3 children, Mr. Ahonsou Danklo was born on April 16, 1969 in Accra in Ghana. He is a trained carpenter. His wife is a housewife, so he is the only breadwinner for the family. In spite of his best efforts, he has not been able to escape the vicious circle of poverty. He is requesting this loan to acquire tools so as to become independent. Right now he is working with another carpenter. This loan will allow him to have his very own tools at his disposal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of the materials he needs to work independently

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi H.  est née en Février 1961 à Lomé. Elles est mariée et a quatre  (04) enfants plus une personne à charges. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour améliorer son activité de restauration, accroître  et ouvrir une boutique d’alimentations générales et avoir ainsi une indépendance financière.
texts.en:
Ablavi H. was born in February 1961 in Lomé. She is married and has 4 children plus one other person in her care. She is requesting this loan to improve and grow her little food service business and to open a general store so as to have financial independence.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: opening a general store

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr: Débora A.  est née le 22 décembre 1980  à Lomé. Elles est mariée et a un  (01) enfant plus quatre (04) personne à charges. Son mari ne  travaille pas et n’a pas de qualification professionnelle. Elle est seule à faire face aux besoins du ménage. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour améliorer  ouvrir une boutique d’alimentations générales et passer une commande des articles qu’elle vend.
texts.en:
Débora A. was born on December 22, 1980 in Lomé. She is married and has one child plus four other persons for whom she is responsible. Her husband is not working and has no professional qualifications. She is the only breadwinner for the family. She is requesting this loan to open a general store and order the inventory for it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to open a general store

loans.name: Dela

texts.fr: Née 1978, Dela A. est une femme mariée qui a un (01) un enfant et deux personnes  à charges. Elle  vit avec son mari qui est chauffeur au chômage. Elle vend des fruits. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour  améliorer son activité en passant une commande plus importante pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1978, Dela A. is married and has one child and two other people in her care. She lives with her husband who is a chauffeur but is out of a job right now. She sells fruit. She is requesting this loan to try and make her business better by ordering more at one time so as to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ordering fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.fr: Dzifa K. est une femme de 47ans, mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Elle  vit avec son mari mécanicien dont l’activité ne marche pas comme avant. Ils vivent ensemble dans le quartier  d’Agoè et sont connus de tous les habitants de ce quartier. Elle vend des sacs de céréales tels que le maïs, le mil etc. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour  améliorer son activité en passant une commande plus importante pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins élevés de sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de venir en aide à son mari pour l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Dzifa K. is a woman of 47, married and the mother of 6 children. She lives with her husband who is a mechanic but whose business is not going as well as before. They live together in the Agoè neighborhood and are known to all the inhabitants of that district.

Dzifa sells sacks of cereals such as maize, millet, etc. She is requesting this loan to make her business better by buying more at a time, so she can satisfy the higher demands of her customers. This will allow her to help her husband pay for their children's education.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking cereals

loans.name: Déborah

texts.fr: Née en 1976 à Agoè, Madame Déborah L. est veuve et a un enfant à charge. Elle est commerçante et vend  de l’huile rouge de palme,du sel,du mais et divers. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans le soucis de développer son commerce et de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Agoè, Mrs. Déborah L. is a widow raising one child. She sells red palm oil, salt, maize, and various other items. She is requesting this loan with the intention of developing her business so she can support her little family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and re-sale of various foodstuffs, etc.

loans.name: Adzélé

texts.fr: Née en 1969 à Notsè, Mme Adzélé W.  est mariée et a cinq  (05)  enfants à charge. Elle habite le quartier Togblé  Atsanvé. Elle est commerçante et vend des sacs de charbon de bois et des sacs de maïs. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans les soucis de développer son commerce et de subvenir aux besoins de sa grande famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Notsè, Mrs. Adzélé W. is married and has 5 children in her care. She lives in the Togblé Atsanvé neighborhood. She is a businesswoman who sells sacks of charcoal and sacks of maize. She is requesting this loan with a view to developing her business and supporting her big family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and re-sale of charcoal and maize

loans.name: Woda

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Agoè Atsanvé, Woda W. est mariée et a trois (03)  enfants à charge. Elle est commerçante et vend des sacs de charbon de bois et des sacs de maïs. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans le soucis de développer son commerce et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Agoè Atsanvé, Woda W. is married and has three children in her care. She is a merchant and sells sacks of charcoal and sacks of corn. She is requesting this loan with the concern of developing her business and to provide for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal and corn

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Madame KUE–ADJA Afi, originaire d’Aklakou Hétchavi, est née en 1971. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle a pour activité la vente de la farine de manioc appelé "gari". 

Un commerce qu’elle a acquis depuis son jeune âge. De ce dernier, lui procure un revenu maigre, insuffisant aux besoins de la famille et spécialement à la scolarisation de ses deux enfants.

Dotée d’une expérience de 15 ans, cette activité n’a jamais trahi. Elle sollicite un crédit pour relancer son commerce d’où une amélioration des conditions de vie au sein du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi K. who comes from Aklakou Hétchavi was born in 1971. Married and the mother of 2 children, her business is selling the manioc flour known as "gari".

This is a business she learned at a young age. From it she draws a meager income, insufficient for the needs of the family and especially for the cost of sending her children to school.

As she has the benefit of 15 years of experience, this business has never let her down. She is requesting this loan to get her business going stronger so that her family will benefit from an improvement of living conditions in her household.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling manioc flour

loans.name: Kinméfondo

texts.fr:
Monsieur V. Kinméfondo est né en 1960 à Anyronkopé et vit dans la ville d’Aného. Chauffeur de profession, il est marié et père de huit enfants. Très dynamique, il exerce aussi le maraîchage ; ce qui lui permet de combler quelques vides financiers.

Il rend service dans le domaine des transports avec son ancien véhicule. Aussi est il celui qu’on sollicite le plus pour les déménagements. Aujourd’hui les pannes répétées de son véhicule ne lui permettent plus de réaliser ses revenus habituels sinon, des pertes.

Ainsi, il veut le changer. Mais en manque d’argent, il sollicite un crédit  pour compléter son avoir afin d’acheter un autre véhicule.
texts.en:
Mr. Kinméfondo V. was born in 1960 in Anyronkopé and lives in the town of Aného. He is a driver by trade, married and the father of eight children. Very energetic, he also practices market gardening ; this allows him to fill in some financial gaps.

He provides services in the transportation business with his old vehicle. He is also the one most called upon for moving jobs. Today with his vehicle's repeated breakdowns, he is not only not able to bring in his usual income, he has losses. So he wants to change it, but he is lacking the funds. He is requesting a loan to complete his down payment so he can buy another vehicle.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Mele

texts.fr:
Née le 07 octobre 1977 à Lomé au TOGO, Madame MELE Z. est une femme très dynamique spécialisée dans la commercialisation des céréales depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle a deux personnes à charge.

Ne disposant pas d’important fonds de commerce, elle ne parvient pas à satisfaire la forte demande de sa clientèle. Aussi, ne parvient elle pas à dégager un bénéfice substantiel lui permettant de répondre aux besoins de sa famille.

Dans la perspective d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat, aux fins de maximiser de bénéfices, elle sollicite un crédit.
texts.en:
Born in Lomé (Togo) on October 7, 1977, Mrs. Mele Z. is a very energetic woman who's been specializing in cereals sales for more than five years. She has two people to support. Because of her lack of capital, she cannot meet the high customer demand. Therefore, she does not manage to make enough profit to provide for her family. In view of maximizing her profit, she's seeking this loan to bolster her purchasing power.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell corn

loans.name: Koffi Etsè Sénamé

texts.fr:
Né le 03 avril 1981 à Sansanné Mango dans la préfecture de l’Oti, Monsieur A. Koffi Etsè Sénamé vit actuellement à Aného où il fait son commerce de quincaillerie. Père de deux enfants, il a une boutique de quincaillerie dénommée Etablissement AVOCH & Fils.

Son emplacement dans la ville fait de lui le plus fréquenté. Avec une clientèle de plus en plus croissante, l’offre diminue par rapport à la demande. 

Pour être la hauteur de la demande et satisfaire sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit pour ravitailler la boutique en quincaillerie.
texts.en:
Born on April 3, 1981 in Sansanné Mango in the Prefecture of Oti, Mr. Koffi Etsè Sénamé A. is presently living in Aného where he has his hardware business. The father of two children, he has a hardware store he calls Etablissement AVOCH & Fils.

His location in the town makes him easy to patronize. With his growing clientele, what he has to sell is gradually diminished by the demand for his goods.

In order to keep up with demand and satisfy the needs of his customers, he is asking for this loan to bolster the inventory of his hardware store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of construction supplies

loans.name: Elisabete Jacinto

texts.pt:
elisabete tem 37 anos nasceu em inhambane. E solteira e mae de 3 filhos com idades compriendidas entre 14anos a 3anos, os dois mais velhos encontram-se a estudar na escola primaria e a mais nova no centro infantil. Elisabete  muda-se para namaacha  uma vila na froneira com swazilandia  onde vivia o seu tio este que se encontrava no centro social da namaacha.

Elisabete estudou ate 5 classe teve que parar na altura devido a guerra,mas chegado a namaacha, estuda e comeca a trabalhar na OTM(organizacao dos trabalhadores de mocambique) como servente durante 2 anos, e auferia por mês 150mt. mas porque o salario não satisfazia as necessidades da casa pois ela já vivia sozinha numa casa de aluguer, aranja um novo emprego no centro de formacao de professores primarios da namaacha (CFPPN) actual instituto de formacao de professores primario da namaacha(IFPPN) que se encontra a trabalhar ate entao, trabalhando das 6:30 as 14;30h auferindo um valor de 1.800.00mt mensalmente. Com a ajuda do seu marido comeca a contruir a sua propria casa e acha que nos meados do proximo ano vai se mudar para sua nova casa. 

Este e o 2 emprestimo de elisabete com hluvuku o o primeiro com kiva. O primeiro de 10.500.00mt foram usados na compra de material de contrucao e este segundo de 10.500.00mt serao usados para o mesmo fim. Pretende futuramente pedir outros emprestimos para pintar a sua casa e mobilar.
texts.en:
Elisabete was born in Inhambane and is 37 years old. She has three children between the ages of 3 and 14 years old, the two oldest are in school and the youngest is in daycare. Elisabete moved to Namaacha - a village on the border of Swazilandia where her uncle lives. Elisabete went to school through 5th grade when she had to drop out due to the war, but after moving to Namaancha she is able to continue her studies and started working at OTM (Mocambique's Workers Organization) as a janitor, making 150MT per month. Since her income wasn't sufficient to pay for her living expenses and rent, she found another job at the Namaacha's Graduating Center of School Teachers (CFPPN), today's Granduating Institute of School Teachers (IFPPN), where she still works from 6:30AM until 2:30PM earning 1,800MT per month. With the help of her husband she began building her house and believes that she will be able to move in by mid-next year. This is her second loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. The first loan she took in the amount of 10,500MT was used to buy construction materials and this second loan in the amount of 10,500MT will be used for the same purpose. In the future she hopes to take out additional loans to help her paint and furnish her new house.

Translated from Portuguese by Camila Vasconcelos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy constructions materials

loans.name: Daniel Francisco

texts.pt:
Daniel tem 30 anos de idade nasceu em inhambane. É casado e pai de uma filha de 1 ano e 2 meses,para alem do filho e a esposa que ainda esta a fazer o ensino médio,  suetenta mais um sobrinho que vive com ele que também vai a escola. Muduo-se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com swazilândia devido a transferência no serviço. 

Daniel começa a trabalhar logo que concluie a 7ªclasse na Educação na Matola em Maputo,  mas continuava com os seus estudos no curso nocturno. Apois a conclusão do ensino médio em 2003 é transferido para Namaacha onde terabalha eté então com técnico Administrativo, é  funcionário permanente , faz 8h por dia das 7:30h as 15:30h e oufere um salário mensal de 3,283.00MTn. Responsabilisa-se tambem pela sua mãe que vive em Inhambane manda lhe 500.00MTn por mês. Em 2005 a educacção oufereceu lhe um terreno para construir a sua residência uma vez que vive numa casa cedida pela mesma instituição,mas porque ele tem muitas dispesas só fez a fundação e não conseguiu continuar, numa conversa com colegas teve infarmação dos serviços da hluvuku e dicidiu pedir financiamento.

Este é o primeiro emprestimo de Daniel na hluvuku  e com kiva, no valor de 12,000.00MTn para compra de material de construção para da continuidade da sua obra. Assim que terminar de pagar pretende pedir mais emprestimos para continuar com a obra, pois ele está ciente que com este primeiro só vai reiniciar a obra uma vez que o material está cada vez mais carro.
texts.en:
Daniel was born in Inhambane and is 30 years old. He is married and the father of a 14-month old daughter. In addition to his daughter he also provides for his wife - who is still finishing school - and a nephew who is also attending school. He moved to Namaacha - a village on the border of Swazilandia - for his job. Daniel began working after finishing 7th grade at the Matola in Maputo School, but he continued his studies in evening classes after work. After graduating he was asked to move to Namaacha where he still works as a full-time Administrative Technician from 7:30AM - 3:30PM, earning a monthly salary of 3,283MT. He also provides financial help to his mother who lives in Inhambane, sending her 500MT each month. In 2005 the school offered him land to build his house, but since he has so many expenses he only built the foundation of the house. He heard about Hluvuku's services through friends and colleagues and decided to request a loan. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva in the amount of 12,000MT to buy construction materials and resume the building of his house. Once he's done repaying this loan he plans to take out additional loans to continue with the construction of the house as he is aware that this first loan will only allow him to begin construction due to the increasing costs of building materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Camila Vasconcelos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Mme C. est dotee d une forte esperience dans la vente de produits cosmetiques. elle est une cliente fidele de la caisse avec un total de sept credit tous payes correctement. Ce huitieme credit va lui permettre d augmenter son stock et d accroitre son chiffre d affaires
texts.en:
Mrs. C. has a great deal of experience in selling cosmetics. She is a faithful client of ours with a total of 7 loans correctly repaid. This 8th loan will allow her to increase her stock and grow her daily turnover.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: reinforce her working capital

loans.name: Palmira Lucas

texts.pt:
Palmira Lucas M. é natural de Manjacaze província de Gaza tem 51 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 5 filhos com idades entre 37, 30, 27, 25 e 21 anos respectivamente, os dois últimos ainda são estudante ambos na 10ªclasse e os restantes já são trabalhadores. Para alem dos seus filhos também sustenta a sua mãe.

Palmira estudou ate 8ªclasse ainda jovem e parou por falta de condições onde foi a lar neste momento frequenta a 9ªclasse curso nocturno. Diz ela que muito cedo mudou se de cidade para Maputo no bairro suburbano Hulene na casa dos familiares. Neste momento vive numa casa própria. 

Palmira trabalha como secretaria e é funcionaria permanente a 31 anos, tem um horário de trabalha das 7:30 as 15:30, é formada em dactilografa, tem salário mensal de 2347,00mt e consegue poupar 1000,00mt por mes.

Este é o quarto empréstimo da Palmira na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva os dois primeiros destinou a compra de material de construção e o terceiro comprou congelador( 1º 6.000,00mt, 2º 10.000,00mt e 3º 10.000,00mt) este no valor de 12.000,00mt pretende continuar com a compra de material de construção. Tem como maior sonho concluir os seus estudos para melhorar o seu salário.
texts.en:
Palmira Lucas M. is a native of Manjacaze, in the Gaza province. She is 51 years old, a widow, and mother of five children, ages 21, 25, 27, 30, and 37. The youngest two are still students, both in 10th grade. The rest of the children work. In addition to her children, Palmira supports her mother.

Palmira went to school through 8th grade when she was young, then stopped because of financial constraints. Now she attends night school for 9th grade. She said that very early on she moved from the city to her relatives’ house in a suburban neighborhood of Maputo called Hulene. Currently she lives in her own house.

Palmira is a secretary and has been a regular employee for 31 years. She is certified in typing, and her work hours are from 7:30am to 3:30pm. She earns a monthly salary of 2,347 meticais (MTn) and is able to save 1,000MTn per month.
