Sabahi is 30 years old. She is married with 5 children, aged between 15 and 1. She also takes care of 3 other people, ages 24, 28, and 30. She has run her own grocery since 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Sabahi is now looking for a loan to buy more grocery items to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to improve her business

loans.name: Mrs. Vath Vanna Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vath V., the Village Bank President in Preak Ta Ten Village in Kandal Province, is a rice farmer earning a small income to help support the household. Currently, insufficient funds prevent her from buying more rice seeds, so she is requesting a loan to be able to cultivate more rice. Vath is a 42-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

One member in this village bank has end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Boutros

texts.en: Boutros is 41 years old, single, and lives in Dekwaneh, located in the suburban regions of Beirut. Boutros owns a mini-market near his home. Boutros's enthusiasm and willpower have helped his business grow every day. He has requested a loan of $500 from A. Majmoua to expand and improve his market. This is the first time that Boutros has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for Boutros's grocery market

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Tran Thi O. joined TYM Fund in 2007. For the first loan cycle, she borrowed VND 5 million to raise pigs. At present she also sells fish and her husband works as a builder. As a result, her family's average income is 3.5 million/month. In the coming time, she plans to buy a threshing-machine to thresh rice for local people. Therefore, she is applying for a loan in the amount of VND 9 million.

loans.use: to buy a threshing-machine

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 12, 10, and 8. She has run her own shop since 2004. Every day she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanaisha is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Chhom L., 42, raises pigs, and also sells fish paste from her house and in the market. She buys the fish paste from the producers and then resells it for a profit. Her husband, Mr. Mong Khun, 35, is a fisherman in Tole Sap Lake, which is the biggest lake in Cambodia, earning approximateL. US$1.00 per day. Chhom has two children, all of them are young and in school. She would like to increase her business to meet customer demand, therefore, she needs to add stock more fish paste. However, she lacks the money to carry out this plan. Chhom has heard about Kiva through HKL promotion, and she decided to request a loan of US$500 to carry out her plan.

loans.use: To buy more fish paste to resell

loans.name: Roshan

texts.en:
Roshan is a 45-year-old woman. She is married with 4 children. She is a seamstress and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Roshan's husband has a meager salary. He works in a private company but she must work hard at her business to help her family.

She needs money for her business so she has requested an individual loan to buy new machines, etc. for sewing and complete her stock. She will work hard and take a shop because now she is working out of her home. She wants to enlarge her business to make a good monthly income for her family. Roshan is happy with this process of loans. She wants to continue her business and this loan will allow her to do so. She would like to thank lenders who help poor people around this world.

loans.use: To buy new machines for tailoring

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi M. is 48 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 1998. For the first cycle, she borrowed VND 500,000 to raise pigs. At present, she earns a living mainly by raising animals and farming. Her income is VND 4 million/month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 10 million to buy a buffalo to plough her rice fields.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo to plow her ricefields

loans.name: Mwanajuma's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Mwanajuma, 38 years old and married with three children aged 21, 15 and 8, has run her own shop since 2003. Working everyday from 6 a.m. to 6.30 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanajuma is now requesting a loan to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanamrisho, who has a business selling fish, cassava and juice.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Phan Thi P. is 55 years old. Her three children are all grown up and have stable jobs. She joined TYM Fund in 1997 to borrow loans for animal raising. At present, besides animal raising, she has a rock grinding machine and grinds rock for people in her area. For the next loan cycle, she is applying for VND 10 million to buy a threshing-machine to serve local people.

loans.use: to buy a threshing-machine

loans.name: Taniil

texts.en:
Taniil is 48 years old, married, and the father of 3 children who are his inspiration and motivation to move forward. Taniil lives with his family in Dora, located in the suburbs of Beirut.

Taniil owns a café where he sells snacks, coffee, and tea to local customers. He has asked Al Majmoua for a US$ 1,000 loan to purchase an espresso machine and other supplies for his café. This is the first time that Taniil will be working with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase an espresso machine and other supplies

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Phan Thi H. joined TYM Fund in 2005. At present she lives with her husband and two children in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An commune. Her family's main source of income is their restaurant. For 2 years in TYM, Mrs. H. has complied with TYM's regulations very well and repaid her loans in a timely fashion. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to buy a cow and raise it for sale.

loans.use: buy a cow to raise for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Long Sinith Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Preak Ta Ten Village in Kandal Province are members of the Village Bank loan, and they plan to use the loan for a variety of purposes. Mrs. Long S., the Village Bank President and a vegetable farmer, is a 54-year-old widow with two children who are employed in a garment factory. Long’s plantation field is currently infertile; in order to solve this problem, she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her field as well as more pesticides to kill a variety of crop-threatening insects. 

Mrs. Mann N. is represented in the picture by her husband.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her field and more pesticides to kill a variety of crop-threatening insects.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 34 years old and has two children. She joined TYM Fund in 2002 and used her first loan for farming. Today her family has a big lemon garden, which brings about VND 20 million/crop. As this business is profitable and is the main income of the family, she wants to borrow VND 4 million to buy more young lemon trees and fertilizer for this business.

loans.use: buying more young lemon trees

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi C. is 44 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2002. She used her first loan for pig raising, then she borrowed another loan to buy a milling machine to serve the villagers in her area. At present, her family's earnings come from pig raising, rice milling, and the salary of her husband, a builder. She now wants to borrow VND 6 million to buy unhusked rice, husk it and sell it to people to earn more money for her family.

loans.use: buy unhusked rice to husk and sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi K. joined TYM in 2002. For the first loan cycle, she borrowed VND 1 million to raise pigs. At present, her family's main source of income is pig raising and farming. Besides, every month she receives financial assistance from her children. Owing to that, she repays her loans very well. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 6 million to raise a cow.

loans.use: buying a cow to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Chea Rom Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chea R. is the group leader of four who all live in Chrouy Ampil Thmey Village in Kandal Province. Now single and living with her mother, Chea is a scarf weaver and seller who makes a small income to support her family. Since she has many customers and not enough scarves to sell, she is requesting a loan to buy more scarves to meet customer demand. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more scarves to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi M. is 47 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2002 and borrowed  VND 1 million to invest in farming. At present, her family has a big lemon garden with an income of VND 15 million/year. Besides, every month her husband works as a builder helper in his spare time. With these sources of income, she repays her loans very well. For the next loan cycle, she is applying for VND 4 million to buy more young lemon trees and fertilizer for this business.

loans.use: to buy more young lemon trees and fertilizer

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 37 years old and she is a widow with 4 children aged 12, 8, 6 and 4 years old. She has been a bites (maandazi: bread-like rolls) and juice seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 6am to 10:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Maryam is now requesting a loan to improve her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.use: To improve her business by adding items to her current stock

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya, 21, is married with two children, ages 3 and 6. She has been a chips and shoes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 9.30am to 6.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asya now seeking for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 30 years old. In 2002 she joined TYM Fund and borrowed a loan for pig raising. At present, she is responsible for this business and her husband drives a small truck to transport goods for other people. For 6 years in TYM she has complied with TYM's regulations and repaid loans in a timely fashion. For the coming loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 6 million to buy a cow to raise for sale.

loans.use: buy a cow to raise for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Ry Sokchea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loan consists of ten members living in Preak Samraong Village in Kandal Province, and all plan to use the loan for a variety of purposes. For example, Mrs. Ry S., the 24-year-old Village Bank President and mother of a three-year-old, owns a small but successful grocery store. She is requesting a loan to buy more grocery products to meet her customers’ needs. Ry is assisted in this business by her husband, Mr. Yom Vannith.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainL. of end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Resty Kayondo's Group

texts.en:
Resty is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 45-year-old divorced woman with 1 daughter, age 30. She resides in and owns a 3-room house, where she is staying with 4 people. Resty takes care of her mother. There is electricity and piped water at her home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Resty sells newspapers and operates a public pay phone in Bwaise, one of the city suburbs. She sells to an average of 50 people a day and works 6 days a week.

Resty's major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and medication. Resty rides a bicycle to and from work. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Resty's main challenges include the rainy season, which disturbs her a lot and which she overcomes by using umbrellas. Resty has been with MCDT for over 5 years with the same group mates and is servicing her eighth loan. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business and acquire more telephone booths. .

loans.use: To increase stock in her business and to buy another telephone booth

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is married with 6 children aged between 17 and 3 years old. She has been a potato seller since 2007. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Hidaya is now looking for a loan to buy more potatoes for re-sale in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for re-sale

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 30 years old. She is a widow with 4 children aged between 11 and 6 years old. She is a charcoal seller. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Maryam is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Kha

texts.en:
Mrs. Kha P. is 29 years old and has four young children. Kha lives in Koktlokleu Commune in the Siem Reap Province. She is farmer who grows rice, earning 5,000 Riel ($1.25) per day. Her husband, Mr. Map Khoun, is 33 years old and is employed as a chopping wood worker, earning around 6,000 Riel ($1.50) per day.

Kha faces difficulty farming because she lacks oxen to use for plowing farmland. Hence, she requests a loan of 3,000,000 Riel ($750) to purchase two oxen to use to plow farmland. She hopes the loan will improve her business more than in the previous year and adequately sustain her family's living expenses.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to plow farmland.

loans.name: Mrs. Vann Savorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nine people who live in Preak Samraong Village in Kandal Province are members of the Village Bank loan, led by 38-year-old Village Bank President and mother of a school-aged child, Mrs. Vann S.. A pig breeder currently raising seven pigs, Vann does not have enough money to purchase pig food and so is requesting a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Peng Sarorn, assists in his wife’s business in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en: Antoine. 49, is married and has four children. He lives in the region of Saida in southern Lebanon where he works as a maintenance employee at the International Lebanese University. He doesn't earn much but it is a stable job. Antoine loves to keep active, and in his free time he works in in the agriculture industry. This extra income is very important for his family as well as Antoine's own peace of mind. Antoine has asked Al Majmoua for a $1,000 loan to purchase a cutting machine and a motor for pulverization to be used in his farming activities. This is the first time that Antoine has worked with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new farming machines

loans.name: Mrs. Khorn Lei Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank loan consists of ten members living in Preak Samraong Village in Kandal Province who plan to use the loan for a variety of purposes. For example, Mrs. Khorn L., the Village Bank President and a vegetable farmer growing corn on her 0.2 hectare field, is requesting a loan to purchase more corn seeds to cultivate. Her husband, Mr. Bon Bundara, is a construction worker who can earn $2.50 per day to help support his family. 

Khorn is 28 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one, three years of age, is yet too young to attend school.

loans.use: To purchase more corn seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 40 years old. She is a widow with 3 children aged 22, 14 and 4 years old. She has been a clothes and coconut seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Maryam is now seeking a loan to buy more clothes and coconuts to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and coconuts to improve her business

loans.name: Amina's Rabi Tupe Kheri Group

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years and married with 9 children between 5 months and 15 years old. She has been a clothes and snacks seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8AM to 6PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Amina is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothes sales, snacks sales, a retail shop, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding her current stock.

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is 20 years old and she is married with a child one year old. She has been a vegetable seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $105 from her sales.

Hadia is now looking for a loan to buy more vegetables for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Ok Saruot Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank loan consists of seven people living in Spean Thmar Village in Kandal Province who plan to use the loan for various purposes. For example, Mrs. Ok S., the Village Bank President and farmer growing rice on her 0.7 hectare field, is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers in order to produce a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Tin Chea, assists his wife in her farming.

Mrs. Ok S. is 45 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The youngest, two years old, is yet too young to attend school.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Mrs. Sam On Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank loan consists of 16 members living in Chouy Dang Village in Kandal Province, led by Village Bank President Mrs. S. O., who owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it and so is requesting a loan to add more grocery goods to her inventory. Her husband, Mr. HoE. La, is a fisherman who makes a small income through the sale of his catches. 

Mrs. S. O. is 38 years old and the mother of three children, two of wH. are employed in a garment factory while the youngest is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Resty Kayondo's Group

texts.en:
Resty is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 45 year divorced with one daughter aged 30 years. She resides and owns a three roomed house where she is staying with four people. Resty takes care of her mother There is electricity and piped water at her home.
The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Resty sells News Papers and operates public pay phone in Bwaise one of the city suburbs She sells to an average of 50 people a day, and works six days a week. Resty's major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and medication. Resty uses bicycles to and from home to work. She has been in this business for ten years.
Resty's main challenges include rainy season which disturbs her a lot and overcomes it by using umbrellas .Resty  has been with MCDT for over five years and servicing her eighth loan working all this long with the same group mates She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business and acquire more  telephone booth. 
.

loans.use: To deal in various newspapaers and airtime

loans.name: Khekh Niakk1 Group

texts.fr: khekh niakk 1 est un groupe de cinq femmes qui habitent au quartier Diakhao.Elles s'activent dans le commerce de tissus teints depuis longtemps.
texts.en:
Khekh Niakk 1 is a group of five women who live in the Diakhao quarter. They have been active in the commerce of dyed fabrics for a long time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of dyed fabrics

loans.name: Khekh Niakk2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe khekh niakk2 est composé de cinq femmes. elles habitent au quartier Diakhao et s'activent dans la couture depuis dix ans. elles sollicitent ce pret pour renforcer leur activité.
texts.en:
The group Khekh Niakk 2 is composed of five women who live in the Diakhao district. They have been active in sewing clothing for ten years and are requesting this loan to bolster their business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing clothing

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 28 years old. She is married and has three children ages 12, 8 and 4. She runs her own cafe, which she started in January 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fatma now looking for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Mtumwa's Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa is a widow with 5 children, aged between 16 and 5. She has been a clothing seller since January 2008. Every day she works from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mtumwa is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes (bedsheets) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mashavu, who has a business dealing with juice and ice cream sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (bedsheets) for her business

loans.name: Khekh Niakk3 Group

texts.fr: le groupe khekh niakk3 est composé de cinq femmes qui habitent au quartier  Diakhao. elles font de la couture depuis longtemps. elles sollicitent ce pret pour le renforcement de leur capital pour faire face à la demande de la clientèle en vue des fetes de Korité et Tabaski.
texts.en:
The group Khekh Niakk 3 is composed of five women who live in the Diakhao district. They have been sewing clothes for a long time. They are requesting this loan to bolster their capital to address customer demand associated with the Korité and Tabaski holidays.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Couture

loans.name: Maryam 's  Rabi Tupe Kheri Group

texts.en:
Maryam is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 7, 5, and 3 years old and a baby of 8 months. She has been a charcoal and clothes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Maryam is now seeking a loan to buy more charcoal and clothes to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling bites, firewood, coconuts, cassava, fish, and clothes.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes to increase her current stock

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia A. is married and has three children. She has received vocational education. Lydia sells groceries, fabric, and ladies and gents wear at Adisadel near Siwdo. She has had this business since 1999. Her husband is a trader. Lydia uses her income for feeding and taking caring of her children's needs. Lydia will use the loan to purchase more groceries, fabric, shoes, slippers, and children's sandals to sell since demand for these goods has increased. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lydia plans to save towards a building project she is embarking on with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry B. is married and has 3 children. He has received first degree education. Henry sells computers and their accessories at Bakano in Cape Coast, which he has done since 2004. His wife is a businesswoman.

Henry uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and utility bills. Henry will use the loan to purchase more computers and accessories. With the new profits from his expanded business, Henry plans to increase the sale of computers and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more computers and accessories for re-sale

loans.name: Fadhila

texts.en:
Fadhila is 35 years old. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 1 and 14. She has been an oil and groundnuts seller since 2004. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Fadhila now looking for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif N. is a 53-year-old man who lives in a small village in the Imishli region. His main activity is selling fruit and vegetables and he has ten years of experience in this field. He is otherwise unemployed and this is his single source of income.

Yusif is married and has 4 children, two daughters and two sons. It is very hard to keep so large a family under normal conditions. He pays a very high rent on the place he sells out of and his earning per day amount to about 20 USD which is very low. He pays more than 50% of his earnings for rent. He has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase more goods to sell and build his own shop where he can make more income without paying high rent. Yusif is a repeat client for AqroInvest as he successfully repaid his first loan.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim Q. is 35 year old. He is married and has three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuff such as sweets, soft drinks, and juices. Nazim is not alone in his business. His brothers actively help him with sales.  Cureently Nazim requests is a loan of $1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase and diversify the products he sells. He is ready to work even harder to achieve his aim of becoming a successful businessman. His main goal is to create good conditions for his children and give them a proper education, and for this purpose, he is ready to work as hard as possible.

loans.use: To increase the number of products he sells

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami I. is a 53-year-old farmer who sells dairy products in an Internally Displaced People's settlement, Bilasuvar.  He is married and has two sons. From the time he was young  he learned from his parents how to run a livestock business. During this long period, he become one of the major producers of agricultural products in the area where he lives now. 

But life in these regions is getting harder and prices for goods are increasing. The income Nizami had for last year is not enough this year and he's trying to find the best way to increase his income so his family can live in better conditions. For this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1000 USD.  He wants this loan to buy one milch cow for 600 USD and two calves for meat production.

loans.use: to buy one milch cow and two calves

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham A. is a 40-year-old man who lives in an Internally Displaced People settlement, Bilasuvar. He is married and has 2 children; they are studying at school. He learned his profession as a cattle farmer from his father when he was 17. After he got married, he continued working in the same business.

Ilham was quite successful in his business but as prices for everything are increasing and selling calves is still the only financial source in this family, it is very hard to keep his family in normal conditions. The only way to improve his life is to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 1000 USD to purchase an additional cow for dairy sales and two calves. He believe one day he could pass on all his experience and knowledge to his son so he could continue the family business, but Ilham is doing everything possible now to not allow his son to face the difficulties Ilham has now.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow for dairy sales and two calves

loans.name: Qatiba

texts.en: Qatiba J., 47, is married and has two daughters. Her main activity is to sell dairy products as milk and yoghurt. She started her business in 2002, because the income that her husband was earning was not enough to cover their basic family needs. She married when she had just finished high school, and until 2002 Qatiba was a full-time housewife, but in 2002 financial difficulties pushed her to start her own business. Her daughters help her a lot in looking after the cows, but as prices in the country increase, there are no additional financial resources for her family. So Qatiba decided to expand her business and applied for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase two more cows. One of her daughters decided to get university degree and now Qatiba’s wants to help her child achieve what she could not get in her own youth.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida Dizdarević was born in 1967. She is married and has one child. Zahida lives in Gračanica together with her husband who is retired. Zahida works every day in the marketplace. She sells clothes and she does that together with her mother-in-law.

Zahida and her mother-in-law have been doing this job for a long time and it goes pretty well. She has already been a client of WWI for a while; this is her third loan through WWI, this time in the amount of 1000 KM. She will use this loan to buy new clothes for re-sale. Her wish is to stay in this business and maybe one one day have her own real shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en:
Arifa Dizdarević was born in 1951 and she lives in Gračanica. Arifa and her husband are daily busy selling clothing in the city marketplace in Gračanica. They are happy to have their own business and glad that they are busy every day because Arifa's husband is retired. So they are able to earn about 800 KM monthly.

This is Arifa's second loan through WWI in the amount of 1500 KM. Arifa wants to be ready for the new winter season, so she will use this loan to buy new clothes and clothing for re-sale. This is her way to make what progress she can in their lives. Arifa and her husband are satisfied and they hope to have success in the future as they have done in the past.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the new season

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luis Alberto vive en domicilio propio, que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Copacabana que es una zona de las más tradicionales de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos de sanidad. El señor Luis Alberto, se dedica al rubro del transporte publico, tiene un humilde taxi que le proporciona el sustento diario. Esta actividad la realiza en toda la ciudad de La Paz desde hace 15 años. El crédito será destinado para el  mantenimiento de su vehiculo, el cual no lo hacía hace ya varios años, es así que comprará amortiguadores, llantas, hará un cambio de anillas, etc.; trabaja con Emprender desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
Luis Ablerto lives in his own home and it is located in the Villa Copacabana region, one of the most traditional regions of the city of La Paz. This region is equipped with the basic sanitary necessities. Luis Alberto works in public transport, running a small taxi bac that provides him with a daily income. He has been driving his taxi in the city of La Paz for 15 years. The funds from this loan will be destined to the maintenance and upkeep of his car, which has not been serviced for many years. He needs to replace the shocks, tires, and engine work etc. He has been a member of Emprender for 5 years.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Magdalena Marlen

texts.es: El domicilio de la señora Magdalena, se encuentra ubicado en la populosa zona de Alto Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz, vive en un pequeño departamento en alquiler;  se dedica a la administración de un taxi que utiliza para el transporte publico, del cual recibe una renta diaria de 100 Bs. También tiene una segunda actividad que es la costura. Se dedica a la administración de su taxi hace 4 años; es por eso que este crédito será destinado al mantenimiento de su vehiculo ( compra de llantas, accesorios etc.). La sra Magdalena  es madre soltera tiene un niño de 8 años que depende de ella. Es cliente de nuestra institución  hace 3 años y solamente trabaja con nosotros e indica que realmente le gusta trabajar con Emprender por las facilidades de pago, comenta que para ella es muy fácil juntar la cuota ya que sus ingresos son diarios.
texts.en:
Magdalena's home is located in the populous region of Alto Tejar in the city of La Paz. She lives in a small apartment. She manages a taxi that she uses for public transport, from which she earns a daily rate of 100 Bs. She also runs a second business, that of a tailoring shop. She has been managing the taxi service for 4 years and this loan will be used for maintenance of the vehicle (to purchase tires and accessories etc.). Magdalena is a single mother that has an 8 year old boy who counts on her. She has been a member of this institution for 3 years and has been exclusively with us meaning that she truly likes to work with Emprender for the easy pay plans. She has mentioned that it is easy for her to amass the payments given her daily earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander G. is a businessman from Zaporozhye. He works in the local market called "Yubileynyi" selling toys at affordable prices. Alexander has ben in this business for 7 years. Presently, he has about $2400 in inventory. His income amounts roughly to about $1300.

Alexander is seeking a loan of 5500 Grivnas to increase turnover capital. He is hoping to press on with his expansion plans and ultimately earn enough in savings to open a new vending facility in the future. We believe Alexander's enterprising spirit will help him achieve all his goals and see his dreams come true.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Masuba Group

texts.en:
This is Musuba Group, named after their local community. They are all businesswomen in Makeni, the northern provincial headquarters town. They have been together as a group with SMT for the past year. Previously, SMT loaned these women Le 600,000.00 each. This they have repaid successfully and are now requesting a new loan. The previous loan had a lot of impact on their lives but they still need more loans to further empower themselves in their businesses.

Their leader is Fatmata F.. Fatmata was born here in Makeni 25 years ago. She is married with two school-going children. Both she and her husband, who is a teacher, are responsible for their children's schooling and welfare.

Through her cotton trade, Fatmata is able to meet most of her financial needs. She has been in the cotton business for the past two years now. Fatima is doing fine in her business, but still faces a lot of challenges. First, the amount SMT's credit officer has been approving for her and her group members has always been not enough to buy her a bale of cottons, unless she had something to top it up from elsewhere.

Second, sometimes the cottons in a bale do not reach the 50 yards of cotton they are supposed to get in a bale. This means losses for the buyer. However, with this Le 800,000.00 approved for Fatmata, she can, in addition to her previous loan principal, buy a bale of cottons.

loans.use: Buy a bale of cottons

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two kids. She and her family live in town of Ordzhonikidze. Irina sells clothing in the central marketplace. She offers a nice selection of merchandise that is always in high demand among her customers. Irina has been in the trade for 14 years. Currently, she has about $6800 in turnover capital. Her net profit is about $800.

Irina's business produces a positive impact on her community, offering nice, durable clothing to all clients in her neighborhood. She is known as an entrepreneur of integrity. Irina is now seeking a loan to increase sales and her income as a result. Irina is hoping the loan will help keep her business stable and promote its consistent development in the future.    

Note: this is a short-term, seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to imrpove sales

loans.name: Shagen

texts.en:
Shagen sells uniforms for workers in different spheres of life. His business is located in the central marketplace of his home town of Ordzhonikidze. His business has one big advantage: long-term agreements on uniform clothing supply from wholesalers. Shagen has been running this business for 4 years. Presently, his turnover capital is over US$ 8000. His monthly income is about US$ 900.

Shagen is married with two kids. His business is the main source of income for his family of four. Shagen works hard to meet his family needs. He believes financial assistance will support him in his endeavors. Shagen is determined to work on his entrepreneurial dreams; to make them a reality, understanding real success and wealth takes time. He is seeking a 2500 Grivna loan hoping to generate more profit as he increases his sale. Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two grown sons. She owns a business selling women's clothing in the central market of Melitopol. Tatyana has been in this trade for about 15 years. Her business has seen considerable growth since she modernized her vending facility using loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Tatyana has been partnering with our organization for about 7 years. Currently, she has about US$ 1000 in turnover capital. Over US$ 1600 is invested in inventory. Net profit is about US$ 500 a month.

Tatyana is requesting a 2000 Grivna loan to increase her assortment of inventory and boost her sales. She is ready to press on and see her business continue growing and thriving. Her ultimate goal is to provide better livelihood for her family and invest part of the generated profit in basic remodeling of her apartment. This client didn't have any problems with previous loan repayments. So we hope the current loan will also be repaid without any delinquencies and promote further expansion of Tatyana's enterprise.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for the fall season

loans.name: Yoni Group

texts.en:
This loan group is called Yoni, which is also the name of their village. Yoni is about 40 miles from Makeni, capital of the Northern Province. Many people choose to live in or near Makeni because it is the most prosperous town in the north and a good place to do business. The members of the Yoni group are: Mohamed K., Wara K., Kadiatu F. and Namina B.. Each runs a different kind of business. Their leader, Mohamed K., sells biscuits, mints, medicines and other items. He is 55 years old. Mohamed's wife is also a business woman. They have four children, two in secondary schools and two are in primary schools.

Mohamed has been in business for 18 years. But when he started getting loans from SMT two years ago, he experienced a vast improvement in his personal and business life. Today, his primary goal is to complete construction of a house he had started building when rebels from the Revolutionary United Front (RUF) destroyed it. Despite this setback, Mohamed's greatest challenge is lack of capital. He will use his portion of the loan to buy items he currently needs for his shop, such as rice and sugar.

loans.use: Expand on their businesses

loans.name: Joshua Timber Sales Group

texts.en:
This is Martin T. and Mustapha T.. They named their group Joshua. 

Martin T. is the leader of this group. Martin owes a chain saw and trades timber at Pamlap, a village around the outskirt of Makeni. He has been in his current business for 6 years now. Martin was born in Pamlap. He is 40, married with 4 children. Two of his children are in secondary schools and the other two are not attending school. The boy dropped out of school and the girl had a teenage pregnancy. Martin now has the great task of caring for the pregnant girl and encouraging the remaining two to be steadfast in their schooling. 

His previous loans with SMT have helped him a great deal. Out of the proceeds of his business, he could solve his numerous problems. He could send his children to school, attend to them when they are sick, feed and clothe them. Martin faces some few challenges in his business, like the lack of transportation for the timbers to the main roads, and enough capital to employ a larger labor force. Nevertheless, with the numerous loans he got from SMT, Martin has been able to buy himself a plot of land for the future construction of a house.

The other members of this group are now receiving loans from SMT as individual clients, while these two still remain together as a group. They have been with SMT for over 5 years now. These SMT loans are a great help to these entrepreneurs. These people's businesses have been growing as a result of the continuous access to loans they have been getting from SMT. But they still need new loans as it is the continuous access to financial services that can eradicate or reduce poverty.

loans.use: Improve their businesses

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty B. is 46 year old married and a mother of two children who are schooling. She is very hard working and resourceful to her family. She trades in charcoal and sales of dried fish in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Gifty obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Dunkwa, a town where she lives and does her business. With the loan, she wants to buy bulk supply of charcoal and more dried fish to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to pay her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the community group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Gifty does not sell on the day of group meeting. Her photo was taken during her group meeting, wearing white top with white cap, looking into the camera with her friend.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of charcoal and dried fish.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina T. is a busy trader in the local market of Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where she sells smoked fish on top of a table in the market. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of six children who are currently in school. Augustina has been in this business for the past six years, and she has earned enough to enable two of her children to complete junior high school.

However, Augustina does not have sufficient working capital to run and improve her business. With this loan, she wants to purchase additional stock to invigorate her business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance.

Augustina belongs to the community group Isaiah Trust Group. The group members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of smoked fish.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Aunty D., as she is popularly called by her numerous customers, is a 51-year-old local restaurant operator. She is a widow but blessed with six children. With income from her business, she has provided for three of her children to graduate from high school.

In her restaurant, Aunty D. prepares and sells local dishes such as "fufu" and "banku" and "abetie". Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup.

Auntie D. says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Hannah is a member of a group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel O. sells different kinds of drinks at Pedu in Cape Coast. Emmanuel has a senior high education. He is not yet married and has no children. Emmanuel has been selling different kinds of drinks since 2005. He is responsible for paying rent and other utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more drinks for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save for his future and also to take care of his sister's child since he does not have a child of his own.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale.

loans.name: Ludwin Osay

texts.es:
El microempresario Ludwin B. J. tiene 48 años de edad, es de la etnia creole, es casado con 5 hijos quienes estudian en la universidad y nivel secundario, tiene un bus desde hace un poco mas de 4 años con el cual brinda servicios de transporte a estudiantes del nivel primario de la localidad, ofreciéndoles el servicio de ida y regreso al colegio, tiene un total de 60 estudiantes a los cuales por contratos mensuales les facilita el servicio.

Este negocio le permite ingresos para poder aportar a los gastos del hogar, sin embargo por las condiciones de las vías públicas a los vehículos se les debe dar mantenimiento sistemático para que puedan funcionar permanentemente. 

Por tal razón el señor B. necesita financiamiento para comprar: 4 pares de llantas para el microbús las que cuestan US$ 128 cada par, 4 pares de retenedores que cuestan US$ 14 cada par, 1 filtro de aire valorado en US$ 16, 1 juego de fricciones traseras a US$ 48 el juego, 1 banda de agua US$ 70, 2 bombillos de frenos a US$ 15 cada uno y el mantenimiento al motor le cuesta US$ 90.
texts.en:
Ludwin B., a micro-entrepreneur, is 48 years old, is from the creole ethnic group, married with five children who study university and high school, he has had a bus for over four years, with which he provides transporting services to elementary level students of the community, taking them to and from school, he has a total of 60 students with whom he has monthly contracts, which facilitates the service. This business generates income to help with home expenses; however, the road conditions cause the need to maintain the vehicle so that it works properly. This is why Mr. B. needs financing to buy 4 pairs of tires for the microbus at US$128/pair, 4 pairs of retainers at US$14/pair, 1 air filter valued at US$16, 1 set of back frictions at US$48/set, 1 water band at US$70, 2 break lights at US$15 each and motor maintenance at US$90.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment to give maintenance to bus

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris B. is 43 years old. She's a wife and the mother of two children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling foodstuffs such as maize, plantains, beans, cassava and palm kernel oil for the past eight years in the neighborhood to her loyal customers.

Doris says selling these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income to support her family. Doris is a member of the group called Isaiah Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like maize, plantains, cassava, gari (manioc flour) and beans for re-sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica P. is married and has 3 children. She has received a senior high education. Monica sells children's wear at Adisadel near Siwdo, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a trader. Monica uses her income to help her husband take care of the family's financial needs. Monica will use the loan to purchase more children's wear and other clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to reinvest for the further expansion of the business.

loans.use: Monica will use the loan to purchase more children's wear and other clothing for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret T. is 30 years old. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. Margaret has sold frozen foods, dried fish, and smoked fish for the past seven years in the local market but she says her income is very low because she pays high rent on the store she operates from. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her to raise enough income to build a permanent store for herself. She is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fresh fish, dried fish etc

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. is married and has 3 children. She has received vocational schooling. Rebecca sells a variety of items in her store (examples are milk, soap, and lining) at Adisadel near Siwdo, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a fisherman. Rebecca uses her income to pay for utility bills and other family expenses. Rebecca will use the loan to purchase more grocery items that are very often demanded at her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to add to her capital to increase sales.

loans.use: Rebecca will use the loan to purchase more grocery items that are very often demanded at her shop.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort K. is 48 years old. She is a wife and the mother of six children. Currently, four of the children are in school; the other two have completed school. She loves selling and she has a great deal of experience in customer service. She has been selling dried fish for 30 years to support her family. She treks to fishing communities to purchase goods from farmers and sometimes from fish mongers. This process saves her from paying the middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price. She wants to use this loan to buy dried fish in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school. 

Comfort is a member of a group called Isaiah Trust Group'. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy dried fish in bulk

loans.name: Mahama

texts.en: Mahama Z. is married and has three children. He has a senior high education. Since 2000, Mahama has sold groceries such as sugar, biscuits, and other items of high demand in his area at Adisadel near Siwdo. His wife is a trader. Mahama uses his income to pay for rent and utility bills. Mahama will use the loan to purchase more groceries and items which are very often requested at his shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, Mahama plans to start a building on his land.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 43-year-old trader. She is married with three children. She has sold used clothes and charcoal in a local market in Obuasi for fifteen years. With this business, she has been able to support two children to complete senior high school. Her major challenge over the years has been funds to scale up the business. 

Gladys has lots of marketing experience and she is very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and bags of charcoal to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy would be when she is able to provide all her kids with quality education to make them more resourceful in future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers.  Gladys is a member a group called Isaiah. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Gladys doe not sell on the day of group meeting and she was at her group meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and charcoal

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin S. is married and has 2 children. He has received senior high education. Benjamin sells phone credit cards and does 'unit transfer'. He also sells art work such as beads and also owns a grocery store at Pedu in Cape Coast, which he has done since 2005.

Benjamin S.'s wife is a businesswoman. Benjamin uses his income to pay for rent and utility bills and also for his children's school fees. Benjamin will use the loan to add to his capital to increase his stock for re-sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Benjamin plans to reinvest for the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to add to his capital to increase stock for re-sale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina Y., 60, has a food store in the local market of Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a widow and the mother of ten grown children who are all working. She sells tomatoes and other food stuff like beans, groundnut, and maize in the market. She does not have sufficient working capital for her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase increased stock to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance. Amina is a member of a group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil, tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth started her local restaurant four years ago at Obuasi, where she lives. Since then, she has become a popular food vendor in her neighborhood. She is now 46 years old, married with three children who are currently schooling. She serves many kinds of local dishes like fufu, rice balls, banku, and abetie among others.

Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Abetie is prepared from dried milled cassava and it is served with soup.

Elizabeth wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Ama hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loan. Elizabeth is in this photograph taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood for her little restaurant

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Lucia A. P. residente en la Aldea La Ceiba, municipio de 			
Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, departamento de Sololá, actualmente cuenta con 			
26 años de edad, en tiempos anteriores Doña lucia se dedicaba a la agricultura			
en limpia de cultivos que es un trabajo muy arriesgado para ella como mujer,			
pero gracias a sus esfuerzos logro salir de esa actividad e instalo su pequeño 			
negocio en ventas de granizadas, después con su actitud al servicio de las 			
personas logro establecer un negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica cada 			
día su clientela se incrementa y ha logrado mejorar tal vez no un cien por ciento 			
sus condiciones de vida pero siempre tiene un objetivo cada día de ser mejor 			
y responsable con las personas solo así su negocio mejorara  y sus 			
ingresos también, por tal razón doña lucia se vio en la necesidad de acudir en 			
las oficinas de la asociación Asdir, para solicitar un préstamo, para lograr 			
con sus objetivos y dar una mejor condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia A. P. lives in the village of La Ceiba, a municipality of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan in the department of Sololá. She is 26 years old. Doña Lucia used to work in agriculture, preparing fields with slash and burn methods, which was a very risky job for her as a women. Thanks to her efforts she was able to leave that and begin a small business selling snow cones. With her service attitude, later on she was able to set up a business buying and selling traditional regional clothing. Her clientele increases every day and she has made improvements to her standard of living, perhaps not by 100 percent, but every day her goal is to become better and be responsible so that both her business and her income improves. For this reason, Doña Lucia has come to the offices of ASDIR to ask for a loan, to reach her goal and to improve her family´s standard of living.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her business buying and selling traditional regional clothing

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Since 2005, Alex S. has been selling mobile phones and accessories at Adisadel near Siwdo. Alex has a senior high school education. He is married and has one child. He is responsible for paying his child's school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more phones and accessories since demand for his goods is constantly increasing. He hopes to use the profits from his business to start a building on his piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more phones and accessories

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: For the past eight years, Gifty A., 31, has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is married and has two children who are in school. She is a busy petty trader who sells palm kernel oil as her major source of income. She sells from a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality palm kernel stock so that she can process it into palm kernel oil and upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. She is a member of the group called Gospel Light Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the loans for one another.

loans.use: To purchase palm kernel stock.

loans.name: Nils

texts.es:
La señora Nils, socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Es profesora de profesión, complementa su trabajo con la venta de abarrotes, tiene un locutorio y da alojamiento. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en el Jr. San Martín No 307 y los clientes son sus vecinos y transeúntes que visitan su distrito.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000, el cual será cancelado en  6 cuotas, comprará, aceite, conservas de atún, leche en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, galletas de distintas variedades en cajas, chocolates en cajas, chicles en bolsas, chizitos y gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores para que los clientes encuentren lo que requieren.

En estos últimos tiempos las ventas se han incrementado gracias a su carisma y empeño, además tiene variada mercadería donde los clientes quedan satisfechos.

Nils es una mujer emprendedora y decidida, tiene una meta el cual es construir un segundo piso para alquilar y trabajando como hasta ahora está segura que lo va a conseguir. Es perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nils is a member of the community bank "Picota". She lives in the region of San Martin in the province and district of Picota. She is a teacher by profession, but she compliments her work by running a grocery store where she also provides a public telephone service, and she also provides lodging services. Her business is located in her home in Jr. San Martin No. 307. Her clients are mostly her neighbours and out-of-town visitors.

With this loan of S/. 2000, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase cooking oil, canned tuna, cartons of milk, sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of cookies, boxes of chocolates, chilies, chip snacks, and soft drinks of different brands, sizes and flavors. All of this to provide her clientele with what they are looking for.

Lately her sales have been increasing thanks to her great charisma and hard work, but also due to the great variety of products such that all of her clients are satisfied.

Nils is a hardworking woman and very determined. She has a goal to build a second story to her home that she hopes to rent. And working as hard as she has been she will be sure to get what she wants. She is determined and responsible and she has a great want to get ahead.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, canned tuna, milk, rice, sugar, cookies etc..

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las perlitas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la costura y a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, en el Jr. Libertad  Nº 498. Los clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos para remallar, telas de diferentes colores y calidades, también pagará la última letra de su máquina remalladota. Nimia confecciona ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, también quiere invertir en perfumes, y desodorante, los cuales son los productos que más solicitan los clientes y que tienen mayor rotación.

Nimia tiene 51 años de edad y es natural de Tarapoto. Su meta es implementar su taller con una vitrina y más máquinas de coser.
texts.en:
Nimia, member of the group "Las perlitas", lives in the department and province of San Martín, District of Tarapoto. For three years Nimia has worked as a seamstress and in the sales of beauty products. The business is located in her own home. Her customers are neighbors and friends from the same city. With this loan of $350 US, which will be paid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of thread for sewing, fabrics of different colors and types, and she will also pay the rest of her loan on her sewing machine. Nimia makes clothing for women, men, and children, and would also like to invest in perfumes and deodorant, which are the products most requested by her customers and have the greatest rotation. Nimia is 51 years old and is a native of Tarapoto. Her goal is to install a display area in her shop and add more sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of thread, fabric, and to pay for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. started her fish sales nine years ago in Dunkwa, a suburb of Obuasi where she lives. Regina prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of assorted fish so she can increase her income and support her children's education. She belongs to the Gospel Light Trust Group in which members guarantee the repayment of loans for one another.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Noelia Marisol

texts.es:
La señorita Noelia, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a  la venta de productos de belleza, lencería por catálogo y manualidades que ella elabora como los bordados y con ello darle un mejor acabado a las toallas. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Tulumayo Nº 240. Los clientes son sus amigos, familiares y compañeros de clase, también es estudiante de Secretariado ejecutivo. Trabaja en base a pedidos.
 
Con este crédito de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorante, joyas, esmaltes, lociones, etc., también comprará hilos y telas para bordar en las toallas y atender los pedidos que le hacen los clientes.

Noelia tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es poner un locutorio y terminar su carrera para que más adelante desempeñar y estar al servicio de la sociedad.
texts.en:
Noelia is a member of community bank "Mujeres Decididas". She lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She sells beauty products, eyewear through a catalogue and crafts that she herself produces, such as needlepoint, on towels to give them a better finish. Her business is located in her own home at Jr. Tulumayo No. 240. Her clients are friends, family and school classmates. She is also studying to be an Executive secretary. She runs her business by taking orders.

With this loan of S/.800, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase beauty products onsale such as ladies and gentlemen's perfumes, deodorants, fashion jewelery, nail polish, and skin lotions etc.. She will also purchase threads to decorate her towels and to meet the orders that have been placed by her clients.

Noelia is 29 years old and she is single.. She has always been known to be a very determined woman, hard working, and a good business administrator. Her goal is to have her own shop and to finish her schooling so that later on she will be able to work and be in the service of society.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, threads, and textiles.

loans.name: Desmond

texts.en:
Desmond N. E. is married and has 3 children. He has received first degree level education. Desmond sells different kinds of drinks at Adisadel near Siwdo, which he has done since 2005. His wife is a businesswoman.

Desmond uses his income to pay utility bills and other family expenses. Desmond will use this loan to add to his capital to increase his stock for re-sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Desmond plans to reinvest for the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to add to his capital to increase his stock for re-sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a trader in the local market of Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a busy trader who treks to Tarkoradi in the Western Region of Ghana to purchase bulk supplies of fish at the seashore so she can sell the fish to her customers. Esi has been in this business for the past 25 years. Because of this business, she has been able to pay for two of her children to complete senior high school. She needs more working capital to grow her business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality fish directly from the seamen so she can upgrade her inventory. She is grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the group called Gospel Light Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the repayment of loans for one another.

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia pertenece al Banco Comunal“ Los Jardines”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas. Vende en una de las principales calles del mercado No 02 de la ciudad. 

Con este crédito de S/.700, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará  gallinas, pero sus compras lo hace diariamente, eso quiere decir que invierte diariamente, además construirá más jaulas para tener gallinas.

La señora Patricia tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas. Trabajan duro para salir adelante sacrificando otras necesidades, pero poco a poco están viendo los resultados. Más adelante quiere ampliar y arreglar su casa para alquilar cuartos y poner su negocio en su casa, en vista que últimamente sus ventas han disminuido por el alza del precio de las gallinas y la gente ya no compra como antes.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the communal bank “Los Jardines.” She lives in the province and region of San Martin in the Tarapoto district. She dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of chickens. She sells in one of the main streets at the No. 02 market in the city.

With this loan of $250, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy chickens. She has to make her purchases daily which means she will invest daily. She will also buy more cages for the chickens.

Patricia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and her two daughters. They work hard to get ahead so they have to sacrifice other necessities but slowly they are seeing the results. In the future she wants to expand and fix her house so that she can rent rooms and have her business in her home as her sales have diminished because of the increase in the price of chickens and because people are not buying like they used to.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and cages.

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha A., 46, is married and has three children. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, and so forth. She needs the loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, and other items to increase her sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to raise enough income to pay for her kids' education.  She would be thankful for that support. She belongs to the group called Gospel Light Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee to repay the loan for one another.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest A. is married and has three children. He has a senior high school education. Ernest sells mineral water, which he distributes to the retailers. Due to the perception that the water which runs in the taps is impure, people prefer to buy the mineral water which is popularly called 'Pure water' at Adisadel near Siwdo. He has done this since 2002. His wife is a trader. Ernest uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and his utility bills. Ernest will use the loan to purchase more bags of mineral water to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ernest plans to start a building on his piece of land.

loans.use: To buy mineral water

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Jardines”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Su actividad económica lo desarrolla en una de las calles que pasa por el mercado No 02 de la ciudad. Se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas. 

Con el crédito recibido de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  gallinas, porque sus compras lo hace diariamente, eso quiere decir que invierte a diario para atender bien a los clientes que la visitan, y a quienes también entrega, sobre todo a las personas que venden caldo de gallina.
 
La señora Patricia tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo que aún depende de ella. Trabaja duro todos los días porque a veces tiene que salir en busca de sus animales para tener que vender todos los días, Su meta es comprar un terreno para poner un corral de pollos y gallinas.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the communal bank “Los Jardines.” She lives in the region and province of San Martin in the district of Tarapoto. She carries out her economic activity in one of the streets that goes by the No. 02 market of the city. She dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of chickens.

She will use this loan of $275, which she will repay in six months, to purchase chickens. Because she makes her purchases daily, she invests daily so that she can tend to her clients that come to her as well as to those to who she delivers especially those that sell chicken soup.

Patricia is 26 years old and lives with her husband and small child who still depends on her. She works hard every day because she sometimes has to go out in search of animals so that she has something to sell every day. Her goals is to purchase land to have a pen for chicks and chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha Y. is 46 years. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Dunkwa Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She is a trader who sells mattresses, curtains, and bed sheets. She has been in this business for the past 25 years. She requests a loan to augment her working capital so she can buy buy more mattresses, curtains, and bed sheets. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to better support her family. Martha is a member of a group called Gospel Light Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy mattresses, curtains, and bed sheets.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Sarita Colonia”, vive en la  Región San Martín,  Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. se dedica a la venta de comida y su puesto de venta está cerca al paradero de Transporte Huallaga Central. Los clientes en su mayoría son los chóferes y pasajeros que a diario visitan dicho Terminal. 

Con este crédito de S/ 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, condimentos, servilletas, y otros insumos como carnes de pollo, pescado, cerdo, verduras, etc., los cuales necesita para la preparación de sus platos que a diario oferta a sus clientes.

Rosa Maria tiene 22 años, es una mujer decidida y alegre. Vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Tiene como meta mejorar su local y abrir un negocio de repostería.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Maria, member of the community bank "Sarita Colonia," lives in the region San Martín, province of Mariscal Cáceres, district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the sales of food and her sales location is near the bus stop Transporte Huallaga Central. The majority of her clients are drivers and passengers that visit this terminal daily. With this loan for 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy rice, oil, condiments, napkins, and other ingredients like chicken, fish, pork, vegetables, etc., which she needs for the preparation of her plates that she offers daily to her clients. Rosa Maria is 22 years old. She is a purposeful and happy woman. She lives with her husband and little son. Her goal is to improve her store and open a confectionery business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, oil, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Gonzalo Daniel

texts.es: El señor Gonzalo, no cuenta con trabajo formal desde hace varios años, por lo que su único ingreso económico es el que le proporciona su pequeña tienda de barrio, con ese ingreso mantiene a toda su familia. Su esposa, que tampoco cuenta con otro medio de ingreso, le ayuda en la atención de la tienda, tienen dos hijos en edad escolar, a quienes cuidan con mucho cariño. Toda la familia vive en la casa de los padres del señor Gonzalo, ya que la tienda no es propia y tiene tiene que pagar los alquileres mensuales. Este crédito servirá para aumentar el stock de abarrotes y conservas, para la venta.
texts.en:
Mr. Gonzalo hasn't had regular employment for many years; his only form of income stems from his small neighborhood store. This income supports his whole family. His wife, who also doesn't have another source of income, helps him in the store. They have two school-aged children that they take care of with much love. The whole family lives in Mr. Gonzalo's parents' house as they don't own the store and must pay rent for the locale monthly. This loan will be used to increase the grocery and non-perishable stocks for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and non-perishables for sale.

loans.name: Reidelinda

texts.es:
La señora Reidelinda, socia del B.C “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de frutas, desarrolla su actividad en un puesto de venta en el mercado Poma Rosa de la ciudad en donde atiende a sus clientes con la amabilidad que la caracteriza. Decide iniciarse en el negocio para generar ingresos y estar en contacto con sus amigos y la gente. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará frutas como plátanos de seda en racimos, naranjas, mandarinas en sacos, piñas, papayas entre otras frutas. Reidelinda manifiesta que debe surtir sus productos para asegurar las ventas.  

La señora Reidelinda tiene 61 años de edad y es viuda. Sus hijos son quienes la apoyan en sus metas, le gusta el negocio porque se distrae y no se siente sola, está en contacto con sus amigas y clientes. Desea mantener bien surtido su puesto.
texts.en:
Reidelinda, who is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank, lives in the San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres province in the Juanjui district. She works selling fruit in a booth in the Poma Rosa market in the city, where she attends to her clients with the friendliness that characterizes her. She decided to start the business to earn income and to be in contact with her friends and other people.
