With this loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy fruits such as plaintains, oranges, tangerines by the sacful, pineapples, papayas, etc. Reidelinda says that she has to stock her products in order to maintain her sales. Reidelinda is 61 years old and a widower. Her children are the ones that support her in achieving her goals. She likes the business because it entertains her so that she doesn't feel lonely; she is always in contact with her friends and clients. She wishes keep her business well supplied.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits such as plaintains, oranges, tangerines, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Leila

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Leila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, vive en la Región, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas. Desde hace 6 años su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en Jr. Grau s/n. Se inicia en el negocio para generar ingresos y manejar su propio capital.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en de 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas, golosinas como galletas de diferentes marcas y sabores, chupetines y en abarrotes como  arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón entre otros, para que los clientes encuentren lo que buscan.

Rosa es una mujer optimista y luchadora, vive con su esposo y sus hijos que la apoyan en todo momento. Su meta es ampliar el espacio de su local y surtir la mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa Leila, who belongs to the Los Claveles community bank, lives in the Picota region. She works selling sweets and sodas of various brands and flavors. Her business has been in her house in Jr. Grau s/n for 6 years. She started the business to earn income and manage her own capital. With this loan of 1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be invested in the purchase of sodas of different brands and flavors, sweets such as various cookies, lollipops and groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, ham as well as other products, so that her customers can find what they are looking for. Rosa is a hard-working and optimistic woman. She lives with her husband and children that always support her. Her goals are to increase the size of her locale and stock her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, sweets and groceries (sugar, rice, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La señora Valentina, vive con su yerna y sus nietos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Élla cubre con todos los gastos D. la familia, debido a que el hijo tuvo que irse a trabajar al interior del país, buscando mejores condiciones D. vida, por ello, es la unica persona que genera  ingresos para la mantención del hogar. Es una cliente muy responsable y cumplida con sus obligaciones, laborales y familiares. Vive en una zona alejada D. la ciudad D. La Paz.. Actualmente solicita el sexto credito en Emprender, teniendo un historial D. credito impecable.
texts.en:
Valentina lives with her mother-in-law and her grandchildren, all of whom are school aged. She covers all of the family's expenses. Given that her son had to emigrate to work outsiD. the country, looking for better living conditions, she is the only person that generates an income for the maintenance of their household. She is a very warm person, very responsible and true to her obligations, work wise and family. She lives in the Alejada region of the city of La Paz. She is currently requesting her sixth loan from Emprender, having an impeccable credit history with them.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery story products for sales.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana es socia del B.C. “Maria Magdalena”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de carne de pollo asados al carbón, juanes y arroz chaufa. Desarrolla su negocio en la puerta de su casa, situado en el Jr, La Punta Nº 118 del mismo distrito donde vive. Decide iniciar esta actividad porque no le fue bien con la venta de ropa. Los clientes son moradores de la propia localidad y transeúntes de lugares cercanos.

Con este crédito de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, carnes de res, pollo y cerdo también en kilos, cecina, chorizo, los cuales le permitirá variar los platos a ofertar y atender los requerimientos de los clientes.
 
Roxana es una mujer entusiasta de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en las compras diarias y con sus 04 hijos a quienes quiere darle un futuro mejor. Su meta es comprar un refrigerador para ampliar su negocio con la venta de bebidas y salchipapas.
texts.en:
Señora Roxana is a member of the community bank "Maria Magdalena." She lives in the region San Martín, province of Mariscal Cáceres, district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to selling anticuchos (Andean dish) of charcoal-grilled chicken and Chinese fried rice. She developed her business in the gate of her home, located at Jr. La Punta No. 118. She decided to begin this activity because clothing sales did not go well for her. Her clients are neighbors and people commuting from nearby places. With this loan of 500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of the food like rice, sugar, beef, chicken, and pork in large quantities, and also smoked meat and chorizo, which will allow her to vary the plates that she offers and meet the requirements of her clients. Roxana is an enthusiastic woman. She is 38 years old, lives with her husband, who supports her in the daily purchases, and with their four children, who she wants to give a better future. Her goal is to buy a refrigerator to make her business bigger with the sales of beverages and salchipapas (Andean dish).

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for the preparation of food, like rice, sugar, meat, etc.

loans.name: Rusbi

texts.es:
La señora Rusbi, socia del Banco comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, vive en el  Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de la ciudad. Los clientes son las personas que también venden verduras pero en menor cantidad.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  verduras en sacos como papa, cebollas, arvejas, apio, poro, zapallo, lechuga para tener bien surtido su puesto y los clientes encuentren lo que buscan.

Rusbi tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, por quien trabaja para salir adelante. Le gusta el negocio y mantenerse ocupada. Su meta es tener su propio puesto en el mercado, en vista que vende de manera ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Señora Rusbi, member of the community bank "Mujeres de la Colina II," lives in the province of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. She is dedicated to selling vegetables and fruits in a traveling manner at the markets of the city. The clients are people who also sell vegetables but in smaller quantities. With this loan of 800 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy vegetables in sacks like potatoes, onions, peas, celery, gourds, and lettuce to expand her business and so her clients can buy what they are seeking. Rusbi is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and her little son, for whom she is working. She likes the business and it keeps her busy. Her goal is to have her own stand at the market, because right now she sells her goods in a travelling manner.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vegetables in sacks (potatoes, onions, celery, peas, gourds, lettuce, etc.

loans.name: Ndef Leng Group

texts.fr: Le non respect des règles d'hygiène entraine des maladies. Pour lutter contre l'insalubrité, Le groupement Ndef Leng de (http://www.sem-fund.org/mbamfr.php) a eu pour idée de lutter contre les déchets plastiques dans l’écovillage et de créer des emplois de transformation de ces déchets dans le but de bien gérer l’écotourisme. Ayant acquis une formation en tressage pour fabriquer des cordes, en tricotage et crochage pour fabriquer des sous-tasses,  et une formation en tissage pour fabriquer des paillassons, ce prêt nous permettra d’acheter du matériel (bassines, balais, ciseaux aiguilles, sachets, fils coton, savon liquide) que nous utiliserons pour les collecter, les stocker, et les traiter. Tout ceci, pour veiller à la propreté  de notre  environnement et au bien-être de la population.
texts.en:
The lack of respect for the rules of hygiene brings on illness. In the struggle against illhealth, the Ndef Leng group (http://www.sem-fund.org/mbamfr.php) conceived the idea of taking action against plastic waste in the village ecosystem and creating employment by transforming waste with the goal of better managing the impact of the ecology on tourism. We have taken courses in braiding to make rope, knitting and crocheting to make table place mats, and training in weaving to make doormats. This loan would permit us to purchase materials ( basins, brooms, sewing scissor kits, packs, cotton thread, liquid soap) which we would use to collect, store, and treat products. This would be done to take care of both the property in our environment and the well being of the population.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material to manage plastic waste

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 300 bananas, 300 plantains, 60 pounds of tomatoes, 60 pounds of onions, 60 pounds of cabbage and 100 coconuts.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, es socia del Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Triunfo Nº 1112. Se dedica a la fabricación de cajas de madera para el envío de frutas y verduras a otras partes del departamento y del país. 

Con este crédito de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  madera para la fabricación de las cajas, clavos y pegamento, asimismo invertirá en la siembra de cacao, tiene planeado sembrar 8 hectáreas y necesita capital para ello, para pagar sobre todo la mano de obra de los peones. 

La señora Silvia tiene 57 años de edad, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se puede alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa arreglar su casa para poner una tienda de venta de repuestos para motos.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the community banking group called "Hidden Treasure." She lives in the San Martín region of the Mariscal Cáceres province in the Juanjui district. Her business is located in her own home at Jr. Triunfo #1112. She works building wooden boxes to send fruits and vegetables to other parts of the department (state) and country.

With this loan of 3000 soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will buy wood to build the boxes, nails and glue. She will also invest in the sowing of cocoa beans - she has planned to seed 8 hectares, and needs the capital for this, and especially, to pay the day laborers.

Silvia is 57 years old, and works daily showing that she's an ambitious woman and that to acheive her goals, there are no limits and she can reach them with strength and dedication. It's with this attitude that in the future she is thinking about fixing up her house to put in a store that sells spare parts for scooters.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, nails and glue.

loans.name: Virginia Florentina

texts.es: La señora Virginia, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de edad escolar. Se dedica al bordado de fundas para la protección de los elec trodomésticos del hogar. Su esposo le ayuda con los bordados, al igual que sus hijos, como este es el único medio de ingreso en el hogar, ella cubre con todos los gastos de la familia. Viaja continuamente al interior del país para vender sus productos en las ferias y mercados, tambien los vende en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, es una familia muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia lives with her husband and her four school aged children. She is dedicated to embroidering cases to protect household electronics. Her husband helps her with the embroidering as well as her children, because this is the only source of income in the household, she covers all of the family's expenses. She travels the interior of the country continually to sell her products at the fairs and markets, and she also sells them in the fairs in the city of La Paz. This is a very hardwroking family.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, socia del Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido“, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en la Prolongación Loreto No 280. 

Se inicia en el negocio ante la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, aprovecha que su casa está ubicada en un lugar estratégico, y ya tiene buena cantidad de clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, con dicho capital comprará productos como gaseosas de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, frugos (Pulpin, Cifrut), agua mineral, galletas, yogurt de diferentes tamaños sabores y marcas, también quiere surtir su negocio con abarrotes, para ello comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botella de litro, huevos en javas, leche en caja, productos de aseo personal y detergente debido  a que estos artículos  son muy requeridos por los clientes. 

Silvia tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con 2 de sus hijos, motivo de su lucha y dedicación constante a sus actividades diarias. Por su carisma y amabilidad en la atención atrae a los clientes, cree que tener un negocio surtido también garantiza las ventas. Su meta es surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia, member of the community bank "Tesoro Escondido" (Hidden Treasure), lives in the region San Martín, province of Mariscal Cáceres, district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the sales of sweets and beverages. The business is located in her own home at 280 Prolongación Loreto. She began the business when faced with the need to generate income to support her husband in the household costs. She took advantage of her house's good location and already has a good quantity of clients. With this loan of 3,000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy products like sodas of different brands, flavors, and sizes, frugos (Pulpin, Cifrut - beverages), mineral water, cookies, yogurts of different sizes, flavors, and brands. Also, she wants to expand her business with groceries, and for this, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, one-liter bottles of oil, eggs, boxed milk, personal toiletries, and detergent, because these items are requested often by her clients. Silvia is 37 years old, lives with her husband and two of her children; they are her motivation to fight and dedicate herself always to her daily activities. Due to her charisma and friendliness, she attracts a lot of customers. She believes that an expanded business guarantees sales. Her goal is to expand her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products like sodas, mineral water, cookies, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Magdalena”, vive en la  Región San Martín, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de comida y el negocio lo realiza en las cercanías de un paradero de transporte interprovincial. Los clientes son en su mayoría los chóferes y pasajeros que a diario visitan dicho Terminal. 

Con este crédito de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, condimentos, servilletas y otros insumos como carne de pollo, de pescado, de cerdo, verduras, etc., los cuales necesita para la preparación de los platos que a diario oferta a los clientes.

Teresa tiene 58 años de edad, es una mujer decidida, alegre, vive con su hijo, quien la apoya y la acompaña. Tiene como meta comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa belongs to the communal bank called "Maria Magdalena". She lives in the San Martin Region, Province of Mariscal Cáceres, Juanjuí district. She sells food and does business in the vicinity of an interprovincial transport station. The clients are mostly those drivers and passengers who visit the Terminal daily. With this credit of $675, which will be repaid within 6 months, she will buy rice, sugar, oil, condiments, napkins and other ingredients such as chicken, fish, pork, vegetables, etc., which are needed to prepare the dishes that she offers on a daily basis to customers. Teresa is 58 years old. She is a determined and cheerful woman. She lives with her son, who supports her and keeps her company. She has the goal of purchasing land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Ulda

texts.es:
La Señora Ulda, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Piedras”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Tabalosos. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general,  ya tiene bastante tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Tupac Amaru Nº 101 lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual cancelará en 6 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergente, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para surtir bien el negocio y sus clientes encuentren  lo que buscan. 

Ulda tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 4 hijos quienes la apoyan en el negocio en sus momentos libres. Es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en el negocio, porque le gusta lo que hace. Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio y tenerlo bien surtido para la satisfacción de ella y de los clientes.
texts.en:
Ulda is a member of the community banking group called "Las Piedras" ("The Rocks.") She lives in the San Martín region of the Lamas province in the district of Tabalosos. She works selling general store items. She's worked in this business for a long time and it's going well for her. The business is located in her own home at Jr. Tupac Amaru #101 - the place where her clients come daily to buy her products.

With this load of 1500 soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will buy basic products like rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil, canned goods of different sizes, packages of toilet paper, detergent, different sizes and brands of soap, among others, to be able to sufficiently supply the business and so that her clients can find what they are looking for.

Ulda is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children, who help her with the business in their free time. She's a hard-working woman, charismatic and has strong desires to continue growing her business because she likes what she does. Her goal is to continue growing the business and to ensure that there continues to be sufficient supplies to her and her clients' satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Magdalena”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Leticia, en el mercado Poma Rosa de la ciudad. Se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas. 
	
Con este crédito de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará gallinas, ya que las compras lo realiza diariamente, eso quiere decir que invierte a diario, además quiere comprar un motokar para dar servicio de mototaxi así como también facilitar su traslado a comprar y vender las gallinas.

La señora Victoria tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 2  últimos hijos, 03 ya son independientes. Ella es muy trabajadora y su meta es la de comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the Bank Communal "Maria Magdalena". She lives in the San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjuí district. The business is located in the Jr. Leticia, in the Poma Rosa market of the city. Victoria purchases and sells chickens. With this amount of $675, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy chickens. As the purchasing is done daily, she must also make a daily investment. She also wants to purchase a motokar to provide mototaxi service, as well as facilitate her transportation to buy and sell chickens. Victoria is 38 years old, lives with her husband and their last two sons (three are already living independently). She is very hardworking, and her goal is to buy land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La Señora Zoila, socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Magdalena”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros,  y niños, también cose en base a pedidos cuando le llevan la tela y ella sólo pone la mano de obra. Por el buen acabado que le da a su trabajo, ya se hizo muy conocida y no le faltan clientes y trabajos que le piden. Las ventas se incrementan más en la temporada de fiesta de promoción y fin de año y es muy solicitada en dichas fechas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, blondas, telas de diversas variedades, colores y acabados, elásticos, agujas entre otros, y de esa manera poder contar con lo necesario para tener que atener los requerimientos y las exigencias de los clientes. También piensa invertir en un nuevo negocio de venta de ladrillos, actividad  que está iniciando juntamente con su hijo.  

Zoila tiene  43 años de edad,  vive con sus hijos, quienes la motivan en todo lo que ella se propone. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora. Su meta es ampliar y crecer en sus dos actividades, sobre todo en el nuevo proyecto que esta emprendiendo, que es contar con una ladrillera.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the community banking group called "Mary Magdalene." She lives in the San Martín region of the Mariscal Cáceres province in the district of Juanjui. She makes and sells clothes for women, men and children. She also, upon request, sews together items after her clients have brought her the material. Because her finished work is good, she is well known, has a good client following and has many requests for jobs. Sales will increase more during the prom season and the end of the year and she is in much demand during these times.

With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will buy different colored threads, lace and a diverse variety of colors and finishes of material, elastics, needles, among others, so that she will be able to have the materials necessary to meet the requirements and the demands of her clients. She is also thinking of investing in a new business of selling bricks, an activity she is starting together with her son.

Zoila is 43 years old and lives with her children, who motivate her in everything that she intends to do. She's an ambitious and positive woman. Her goal is to increase and grow her two careers, especially the new project that she is beginning, which is have a brick mold to make bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase threads, lace, material, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Martha Esther

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.

Martha es separada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Martha es docente y trabaja en una escuela primaria de Asentamiento Humano Los Artesanos ubicado en la periferia de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Martha vende productos de belleza por catalogo de las líneas Esika, Avon que ofrece a amigos, familiares, amigos, en sus tiempos libres y también vende productos naturales llamados Biolife. En algunas oportunidades Martha vende ropa a pedido, que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Martha necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jabones, cremas, champú y colonias. Los sueños de Martha son ampliar la construcción de su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales y ahorrar más.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of Sun Communal Bank.

Martha is 42 years old, separated, and has two children. She works as a teacher at a the Asentamiento Humano Los Artesanos primary school located on the periphery of the city of Ayacucho. Martha sells beauty products by catalog from the Esika and Avon lines. She offers the products to friends and acquaintances in her free time, and she also sells natural products called Biolife. Sometimes she sells clothing by order, which she buys in Lima.

Martha needs a loan of 1,000 soles ($350) which will be invested in the purchase of soaps, creams, shampoos and colognes. Martha’s dreams are to expand her home, that her children will be professionals, and to save more money.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soaps, creams, shampoos and colognes

loans.name: Wilfredo René

texts.es: EL SEÑOR WILFREDO, ES UN SEÑOR MUY RESPONSABLE, TRABAJA CON LA INSTITUCION HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO Y RECIENTEMENTE CUMPLIÓ CON SU SUEÑO DE COMPRAR UN PEQUEÑO TERRENO PARA ASI CONSTRUIR SU HOGAR Y ADEMÁS, PODER DEJAR ALGÚN PATRIMONIO A SU FAMILIA, PARA QUE SUS HIJOS, NO SUFRAN LOS INCONVENIENTES QUE ÉL TUBO QUE PASAR, Y ADEMÁS MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA, CON ESTE PRÉSTAMO PIENSA COMENZAR LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU CASITA, PARA QUE ASÍ, SUS TRES PEQUEÑOS HIJITOS TENGAN UN HOGAR PROPIO DONDE VIVIR.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a very responsible man, working with this institution for a good stretch of time. He recently realized his dream of purchasing a small plot of land for where to build a home and this way leave his family with a legacy. He doesn't want his children to suffer the inconveniences that he had to go through and he wants to give them a better quality of life. With this loan he wants to start building his house, so that his three little ones can have a proper place to live.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil Aliyeva is a 42-year-old married woman with 3 sons and 1 daughter. She keeps sheep for meat production and poultry. But her main activity is livestock-raising.

Sevil started her business in 1997 and since that time she has learned a lot and has become a skilled entrepreneur. Sevil and her husband are otherwise unemployed. Sevil`s sons help her a lot and she believes one day they will continue the family business. She has applied for a loan in the amount of 800 USD to purchase one milch cow and continue to struggle to help her beloved family get ahead and improve their economic situation. Let's be a helping hand to make this wish come true!

loans.use: Going to purchase one milch cow

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad M. is a self-sacrificing, loving father, 60 years old with 3 children. In spite of his age, he continues to struggle to move his beloved family ahead and improve their economic situation. His main activity is dairy and meat sales and he started this business in 1983.

Mahammad is on a pension now, but it is too small a sum and his primary financial source comes from livestock. His 2 sons actively help him. The desire that Mahammad harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. By selling calves and dairy products, he can create more income for his family. He requests a loan in the amount of 1000 USD. Let's get together behind this man to help him bring well-being and security to the members of his family.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali M. is a 25-year-old father of one daughter. He has been raising sheep for meat production since 2006. He lives in an Internally Displaced People settlement in the Bilasuvar region.

Even since he was very little, Ali has been around people raising animals, and thanks to his knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling sheep. Now his skills and experience bring stability to his very young family. He has one wish: to see at least one of his children continuing the family business, and now he is trying to make his business profitable for the future. Right now he has applied for 1200 USD to purchase 20 sheep for 60 USD each. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help Ali!

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban K. is 56 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He is a very active man. Almost twenty years ago, he started his business of raising sheep. His family has a small herd of sheep and one cow. He usually sells sheep to local restaurants. This is his primary and stable activity. Also during harvest season, Qurban earns additional income as a tractor driver.

Despite these two jobs, since his business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Qurban would like to request a loan to expand his business and increase family income. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. With this purpose in mind, he is asking for a loan of 1000 USD in order to buy more lambs to sell when they are fully grown. The well-being of his family and his business are in your hands. Qurban and his children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA TOMASA, ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA DE LA INSTITUCION, VIVE EN UNA CASA FAMILIAR, DEBIDO A QUE NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS NECESARIOS PARA TENER SU PROPIA CASITA, TIENE UN NIÑO PEQUEÑO, EN EDAD ESCOLAR QUIEN SE LEVANTA A MUY TEMPRANAS HORAS DE LA MAÑANA, PARA AYUDAR A SU MAMÁ, A ORDEÑAR LAS VACAS Y ASÍ PODER DISTRIBUIR LA LECHE POR LAS DISTINTAS ZONAS DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ. EL CRÉDITO LE SERVIRA PARA COMPRAR EL FORRAJE NECESARIO PARA ALIMENTAR BIEN A SU PEQUEÑO GANADO, PARA ASÍ TENER UNA BUENA PRODUCCIÓN DE LECHE LOS PRÓXIMOS MESES.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a long time client of this institution. She lives in a group home given the fact that she doesn't have the financial resources to have her own home. She has a little boy, school aged, who gets up very early in the mornings to helps her milk the cows and distribute milk in different areas of the city of La Paz. This loan will go towards feed that is necessary to nourish her livestock. With this she will be able to have a good quantity of milk produced in the months to come.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Rza

texts.en:
Rza A. is a 48-year-old man who breeds calves and sells dairy products to the local people and dairy factories. He is married and has 3 children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life made him recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 8 years he has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, fattening and then selling them.

Raising livestock is the main financial income source in his family, beside this Rza works as a school teacher in a local school. But his salary as a teacher is quite small and he has focused more on improving and expanding his livestock activity.

Rza wakes up early every morning to feed his calves and cow with the goal of selling them at the best price in the local market when they will be grown enough.

Rza `s main goal is to provide education for his children, and with this purpose in mind, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to buy calves in order to expand his business. Let's support this hard-working man and hold our hands out to help him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil R. is a 49-year-old farmer who breeds sheep. He is married and has five children. He is a purposeful person. He likes animals and enjoys looking after them. Being in this business for 7 years, he knows very well how to choose animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up very early in the morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them.

As this is the only source of funding in Fazik`s family, it is very hard to cover his family's basic needs. He needs to purchase 20 sheep to achieve a stable financial situation in his family and be able to expand his business. For this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. He believes that a KIVA loan will help him and for today it is his only hope for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan A. is a 23-year-old and very passionate man who raises calves for meat production. He lives with his parents who are retired now. He thanks his parents who taught him from a very young age how to look after, raise, and sell calves. He finished high school and decided to engage in livestock activity and follow his father.

As calf-breeding is the only source of income in his family, he tries very hard to keep his economic situation stable, but every day it is getting harder and harder as prices for fodder increase. He needs additional animals to stabilize the situation and provide normal conditions for his elderly parents.

Ruslan`s dream is to marry and have two children who will enter university. But now he has to look after his parents and work hard for the future.

To help him to approach his dream, he needs first to expand his business and for this purpose he has applied for 1000 USD. We hope that your support will help him approach his dream much faster!

loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: La Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
María M. madre D. tres hijos ha sido compradora D. pacas desD. hace un tiempo y ha trabajado una parte D. su vida en la venta D. ropas nuevas y usadas. María tomó la decisión D. solicitar un préstamo a través D. un BD. al cual se le llama actualmente Prosperidad donD. está operando nuestra oficina en Samaná. María decidió invertir su dinero en su negocio, esperando sea prosperado por medio D. este, esta es una Sra. La cual como toda dominicana le encanta la carne y su pasatiempo favorito es leer libros y le piD. a Dios por un futuro mejor para su familia el cual sabemos el nuestro Señor se lo concederá.

Maria is part of a larger group of 35 men and women.  Only 20 are taking out new loans right now, her loan represents the other 19 individuals in her Bank of Hope.  Her group members have businesses in everything ranging from small grocery stores, to fried fish stands, to clothing and  shoe sales.

On behalf of Maria, her group, and everyone here at Esperanza International-- we thank you for your support!
texts.en:
María M. is a mother of three children. She has been a buyer of bulk clothing for some time and has worked part of her life in the selling of new and used clothing. María maD. the decision to ask for a loan through a BD. called “Prosperidad”\ in Samana, where our office is operating. María decided to invest her money in her business, hoping that it is successful. As all Dominican women, she enjoys meat and her favorite hobby is reading books and asking God for a better future for her family which we know our Lord with grant her. Maria is part of a larger group of 35 men and women. Only 20 are taking out new loans right now, her loan represents the other 19 individuals in her Bank of Hope. Her group members have businesses in everything ranging from small grocery stores, to fried fish stands, to clothing and shoe sales. On behalf of Maria, her group, and everyone here at Esperanza International-- we thank you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to re-sell to her community members.

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan M. is a 37-year-old man who raises cows and sells dairy products to the local people and factories. He is married and has 2 sons. As he grew up in a farmers' family from the beginning of his life, he has learned how to raise, breed, and sell dairy cows and other livestock.

Aslan would like to expand his business and purchase an additional cow for US$ 600, one calf for US$ 300, and fodder. The purpose is to expand his business and improve the life of his family. He is working for this aim very hard and hopes that his loan will help him and make his financial income more stable.

loans.use: to purchase one cow, one calf, and fodder

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Primer prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=31732

Epifania es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria. Epifania es separada, tiene 40 años y 6 hijos, Epifania viaja a la ferias de la región como Putaja, Rancha, Niñobamba, de donde compra animales como carnero, gallina, cuy, los cuales son beneficiados en su casa y lo vende en la selva ayacuchana a donde viaja los días viernes y regresa los días domingos, de la selva compra frutas que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en algunas oportunidades también lleva sus productos a la ciudad de Lima. Además Epifania tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ubicado en su casa.

Epifania necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado caprino, porcino y gallina. Los sueños de Epifania son educar a sus hijos, tener una tienda estable en la selva ayacuchana y construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=31732 Epifania is a member of the Community Bank Virgen Maria (‘The Virgin Mary’). Epifania is separated from her husband, she is 40 years old, and she has 6 children. Epifania travels to the markets in regions like Putaja, Rancha, Niñobamba, where she buys animals like rams, chickens, and guinea pigs, which are beneficial to her house and which she sells in the Ayacuchana jungle, where she travels on Fridays and returns from on Sundays. In the jungle she buys fruits that she sells in the food markets in the city of Ayacucho. Occasionally she also takes her products to the city of Lima. Also, Epifania has a small store of snacks located in her home. Epifania needs a loan of 1200 soles, money which she would invest in the purchase of livestock including goats, pigs, and chickens. Epifania’s dreams are to educate her children, to have an established store in the Ayacuchana jungle, and to build her house of sound material.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Epifania needs a loan of 1200 soles, money which she would invest in the purchase of livestock including goats, pigs, and chickens.

loans.name: Sonia Graciela

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.

Sonia es soltera y tiene 47 años, Sonia vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Rancha que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Sonia viaja a las ferias de la región de donde compra cereales, papa que posteriormente vende en el mercado de Abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Sonia junto a su cuñada viajan a los pueblos a comprar ganado que posteriormente vende en la feria de San Juan, también se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno en sus tierras de Rancha. También siembra tubérculos, cereales que luego son comercializados en el mercado de Abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno. Los sueños de Sonia son ampliar sus negocios, tener capital propio y ampliar su negocio de engorde de animales.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank Virgen Maria. Sonia is single and is 47 years old. Sonia lives with her parents in the community of Rancho which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Sonia travels to fairs in the region where she purchases grain and potatoes, which she later sells in the market of Abastos in the city of Ayacucho. Sonia travels with her sister-in-law to villages to buy cattle, which she later sells in the San Juan fair. She also fattens cattle on their land in Rancho. She also plants tubers, cereals, which she later sells in the market of Abastos in the city of Ayacucho. Sonia needs a loan of $550, money which will be invested in the purchase of cattle. Sonia's dreams are to have her own capital and expand her business of fattening of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cattle

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.

Lidia es casada, tiene 35 años y 5 hijos, Lidia vive en la comunidad de Rancha que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Lidia viaja a la feria de Putaja de donde compra cereales y luego de acopiar lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Lidia prepara bocaditos de kiwicha y harina de 7 cereales llamada Ulpada que vende en las fiestas patronales de la región y también en mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. También Lidia se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno y luego lo vende en la feria de San Juan.

Lidia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno. Los sueños de Lidia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y engordar mas ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria.” Lidia is married, 35 years old, and has 5 children. Lidia lives in the Rancha community, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Lidia travels to the Putaja market where she buys grains and after stocking up she sells in the Ayacucho supply market. In addition Lidia prepares snacks of molasses and 7 grain flour called “Ulpada,” which she sells during the regional holiday celebrations and also in the Ayacucho city markets. Lidia also raises beef cattle and then sells them in the San Juan market. Lidia needs a loan of 1600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of beef cattle. Lidia dreams of providing a good education to her children and fattening more beef.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beef cattle

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Julia es casada, tiene 60 años y 7 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Julia vive en la ciudad D. Lima donD. tiene un Kiosco ubicado cerca D. un grifo en donD. venD. quesos, panes, molidos D. cereales, que adquiere en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Julia viaja constantemente a la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. venD. ropa a pedido a amigos, conocidos en los diferentes distritos D. la región, sus ventas son al crédito y regresa cada fin D. mes a realizar sus cobranzas.

Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. panes variados, carne y queso. Los sueños D. Julia son que su hija ingrese a la universidad, ampliar su negocio y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank "Legión".

Julia is married; she is 60 years old and has 7 children of which 4 live with her. She lives in the city of Lima where she has a kiosk located near a gas station where she sells cheese, bread, and cereals that she acquires at the city of Ayacucho. Julia travels constantly to the city of Ayacucho where she sells clothing by order to friends and acquaintances in the different districts of the region. She takes credit with her sales so she returns every weekend to collect money owed to her.

Julia needs a loan of $725 USD which will be used to purchase various breads, meat and cheese. Julia hopes that her daughter enrolls in a university; she also hopes her business will grow, and would like to have her own money.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various breads, meat and cheese

loans.name: Nancy Felicia

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene su casa en el barrio de Santa Elena, Nanci junto a su esposo venden artículos diversos, dependiendo de la demanda como guantes, sombreros, frutas, lentes, pescado y entre otros productos novedosos, actividad que realizan caminando en toda la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual cuentan con un triciclo y en algunas oportunidades viajan a los distintos pueblos de la región.

Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sombreros y lentes. Nancy sueña con comprar un terreno en el centro de la ciudad para construir un local y abrir una tienda estable y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Bank Communal Legión. Nancy is a partner, is 31 years old, and has 3 children, Nancy has a house in the neighborhood of Santa Elena. Nancy and her husband sell various items, depending on demand, such as gloves, hats, fruit, glasses, and fish among other original products. They walk across the city of Ayacucho and occasionally use their tricycle to travel to various cities in the region Nancy needs a loan of $525, which she will invest in the purchase of hats and glasses. Nancy dreams of purchasing land in the center of the city to build and open a stable shop and also that her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of hats and glasses

loans.name: Ulloa Group

texts.es:
Damaris Santana es asesora de crédito el BDE Ulloa el cual está compuesto por 5 personas dentro de las cuales está Jesemene  Z. una mujer cuyo desafío es salir hacia delante con su negocio y hacerse una casa de block, Jesemene compra mercancía para venderla en su comunidad y en zonas aledañas tiene un colmadito y usualmente vende también dulces no obstante a esto también se a dedicado a la venta de gasolina y a procurado que su negocio crezca de manera saludable y tenga mayor rendimiento con el préstamo que invirtió en el. 

Jesumene is part of a larger group of 4 other women and me; her loan represents the other individuals in her Bank of Hope.  Her group members have businesses in everything ranging from small grocery stores, to clothing and  shoe sales.

On behalf of Jesumene, her group, and everyone here at Esperanza International-- we thank you for your support!
texts.en:
Damaris Santana is the credit assistant of BDE Ulloa which is composed of 5 people, including Jesemene Z., a woman whose goal is to advance her business and build a concrete house. Jesemene buys merchandise to sell it in her community and in rural areas. She has a small grocery store and usually sells sweets also. She has also worked selling gasoline and wants her business to grow in a healthy way and have better output with the loan that she invested in it. Jesumene is part of a larger group of 4 other women and me; her loan represents the other individuals in her Bank of Hope. Her group members have businesses in everything ranging from small grocery stores, to clothing and shoe sales. On behalf of Jesumene, her group, and everyone here at Esperanza International-- we thank you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of new merchandise (such as hair accessories, small clothing accessories and other items) for sale in her small store.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.

Teodora es viuda, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Teodora viaja a las ferias de la región como Putaja, Cangallo y los días domingos en la feria de las Américas, en donde vende ropa variada que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada fin de mes y aprovecha cada viaje para llevar cereales y tubérculos que vende en los mercados de Lima. Además Teodora tiene una mototaxi que alquila y diariamente cobra.

Teodora necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, papa. Los sueños de Teodora son ahorrar para construir su casa, que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Magnolia Communal Bank. She is a widow, 50 years old and has 6 children. Toedora travels to the regional fairs like Putaja and Cangallo and on Sundays she goes to the fair of the Americas where she sells a variety of clothes that she adquires in Lima. Teodora travels to Lima at the end of the month and takes advantage of the trip by bringing cereals and tubers that she sells at the marekets in Lima. She also has a mototaxi that she rents and charges a daily fee.

Teodora needs a 1400 soles (Peruvian currency) loan. She will invest the money on buying corn and potatoes. Her dreams are to be able to save enough money to build a house and that her business keeps growing.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Teodora needs a 1400 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, money that she will invest in buying corn and potatoes.

loans.name: Patricia Amelia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.

Patricia es soltera y tiene 38 años, Patricia es docente y trabaja en una institución educativa que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Patricia en sus ratos libres vende calzados, ropa, carteras y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes que son amigos, familiares y colegas de su trabajo, sus ventas son al crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja y también su hermana que vive en Lima le envía sus pedidos.

Patricia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados en diferentes modelos. Patricia sueña con tener un local estable donde venda sus productos, tener una familia y seguir especializándose en su carrera.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank 'Primavera' (Spring).

Patricia is single and is 38 years old, she is a teacher and works in an educational institution 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. In her free time Patricia sells footwear, clothes, wallets and anything that her clients, who are friends, family members and work colleagues, ask for. Her sales are on credit, and she gets her products by traveling to the city of Lima, or being sent them by her sister, who lives in Lima.

Patricia needs a loan of 2000 soles; money that will be invested in buying different types of shoes. Patrica's dream is to have a stable store from where she can sell her products, to have a family and to carry on specializing in her career.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Patricia needs a loan of 2000 soles; money that will be invested in buying different types of footwear/Patricia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados en diferentes modelos.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.

Rosa es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Rosa viaja 2 veces por semana a la feria del distrito de Chiara en donde vende abarrotes, además Rosa vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja 2 veces por mes, sus ventas son al crédito y cobra semanalmente. También Rosa vende cosméticos por catalogo.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa para niños, polos. Los sueños de Rosa son tener un local propio donde venda sus productos, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank 'Primavera' (Spring).

Rosa lives with her partner, she's 27 years old and has 3 kids. Rosa travels to the market in the district of Chiara twice a week, where she sells groceries. Rosa also sells clothes according to demands from her friends and family members, and she gets her products in the city of Lima which she travels to twice a month. Her sales are on credit and she charges weekly. Rosa also sells cosmetics from catalogs.

Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles; money that will be invested in buying kid's clothing and polo shirts. Rosa's dream is to have her own store where she can sell her products, to build a house, and give her kids a good education.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles; money that she will invest in buying kid's clothing and polo shirts/Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa para niños, polos.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que significa “Sol” en quechua.

Victoria es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos que están estudiando en colegio y en la universidad, Victoria vive en un barrio artesanal llamado Santa Ana, Victoria tiene una tienda en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, bebidas, carnes y también tiene un teléfono publico, el local es alquilado, Victoria tiene un terreno en donD. tiene proyectado construir su casa y local para su negocio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos en sus horarios libres.

Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, verduras. Victoria sueña son incrementar su negocio, tener casa propia y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank 'Inti' which means 'sun' in Quechua.

Victoria is married and is 56 years old. She has 6 kids who are studying at college and university. Victoria lives in an artisan neighborhood called Santa Ana. She has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, drinks, meat and that also has a public telephone. She rents the store. She has some land where she plans to build her house and a store for her business, which her kids help her out with in their free time.

Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles; money that she will invest in buying sugar, rice and vegetables. Victoria dreams of her business growing, having her own house and her kids finishing their studies.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be invested in buying sugar, rice and vegetables/Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, verduras.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.

Carmen es viuda, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Carmen vende alcohol y caña (aguardiente elaborado de la caña de azúcar que es producida en el departamento de Cajamarca), su local es alquilado y esta ubicado en el paradero a diferentes provincial de la selva ayacuchana, sus productos los adquiere a través de pedidos que realiza a los proveedores que le envían previo deposito en el Banco, actividad que realiza hace 4 años.

Carmen necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que fue invertido en la compra de caña. Los sueños de Carmen son educar a sus hijos para que sean mejores que ella, ampliar su negocio y crezca.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Banco Comunal Virgen Maria community bank.

Carmen is a widower, she is 40 years old and has 5 children. Carmen sells alcohol and sugar cane liquor (a liquor produced from sugar canes produced in the Cajamarca region). Her store is a rented space and it is located in the central provincial port in the Selva Ayacuchana. Her products are acquired through orders she places with her providers who send their deposit through the community bank. She has been running her business for 4 years.

Carmen requires a loan in the amount of 3000 soles, funds that will be used to purchase more sugar cane.

Carmen's dreams are to provide an education to her children so that they may be better than her, and she wishes to expand and grow her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carmen requires a loan in the amount of 3000 soles, funds that will be used to purchase sugar cane.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Beatriz es casada, tiene 68 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Beatriz venD. carne en un puesto del mercado F. Vivanco que se encuentra en el centro D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza desD. las 6 D. mañana hasta las 6 D. la noche, Beatriz o su esposo viajan a las ferias D. la región D. donD. compra los animales que luego los transportan a Ayacucho y lo benefician en el camal D. la ciudad. Además Beatriz se dedica al engorD. D. animales en el distrito D. Chiara, con el apoyo D. campesinos que realizan el pastoreo y reciben un pago por su trabajo.

Beatriz necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. vaca y cerdo. Beatriz sueña con incrementar su negocio, engordar más animales y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Banco Comunal Legion community bank.

Beatriz is married, is 69 years old and has 9 children, four of whom still live with her. Beatriz sells meats in a stand in the F. Vivanco market located in the heart of the city of Ayacucho. She runs her business from 6a.m. to 6p.m. every day. Beatriz or her husband travel to the fairs in the region where they purchase their livestock and transport them back to Ayacucho where they are processed.

Furthermore, Beatriz also raises livestock in the district of Chiara with the help and support of local farmers who shepherd the livestock and receive pay for their services.

Beatriz requires a loan in the amount of 2100 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of a cow and a pig.

Beatriz dreams of expanding her business, to raise more livestock, and she dreams of seeing her kids as young professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beatriz needs a loan in the amount of 2100 soles, funds that will be used to purchase a cow and a pig.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Julia es separada, tiene 53 años y 2 hijos, Julia vende ropa, calzados, artefactos y todo cuanto le piden sus clientes, Julia reparte sus productos en diferentes instituciones, amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito y cobra mensual o cada quincena dependiendo, sus productos los adquiere en las ciudades de Lima, Tacna y Trujillo. Además Julia brinda servicios de preparación de comida para diferentes eventos, compromisos familiares. También viaja a Lima a apoyar en el negocio que tiene su hijo de venta de accesorios de juegos de video y lentes.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 2550 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa y calzados variados. Los sueños de Julia son que sus hijos se titulen, el negocio de su hijo prospere y su negocio sea estable.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Legión Community Bank.

Julia is separated, is 53 years old, and has two children. Julia sells clothes, footwear, devices, and everything her clients ask for. Julia delivers her products to different institutions, friends, and relatives. Her sales are by credit and she gets paid monthly or every fortnight. Her products are purchased in the cities of Lima, Tacna, and Trujillo.

Also, Julia offers catering services for different events and family commitments. She also travels to Lima to help with her son’s business, which sells video game accessories and glasses.

Julia needs a loan of 2550 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of clothes and varied footwear.

Julia dreams that her children are titled, that her son’s business prospers, and that her business will be stable.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 2550 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of clothes and varied footwear

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.

Sonia es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Sonia junto a su esposo tienen una panadería ubicada en el Jr. Arequipa en el centro de la ciudad, el horno es artesanal y es alquilado. El esposo de Sonia es el maestro que se encarga de panificar las diferentes variedades de panes entre ellos panes típicos, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo horno y también reparte a las tiendas de acuerdo a los pedidos, actividad que realizan con la ayuda de dos empleados.

Sonia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina por sacos. Sonia sueña con tener un horno propio, construir su casa y brindar la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Magnolia Community Bank.

Sonia is married, is 34 years old, and has 2 children. Sonia and her husband have a bakery located in the Jr. Arequipa in the center of the city. The oven is traditional and is rented. Sonia’s husband is the master, who is in charge of making different varieties of bread, as well as typical breads. They make their bread in the oven, and they also deliver to stores in accordance with the orders. This is an activity that they pursue with the help of two employees.

Sonia needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sacks of flour. Sonia dreams of having her own oven, building her house, and offering the best education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sonia needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sacks of flour

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro.

Rosa es viuda, tiene 65 años y 6 hijos de los cuales 1 hijo que ya tiene familia vive con ella, Rosa vende comida en un puesto del mercado Magdalena, en donde vende carne variada, el cual es adquirido en el camal de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades compra los animales en la feria de San Juan y luego lo beneficia en el camal, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno y caprino. Los sueños de Rosa son mejorar su negocio, su hijo culmine sus estudios y sea un profesional de éxito.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank 'Futuro' (Future).

Rosa is a widow, she is 65 years old and has 6 kids of whom one who has a family lives with her. Rosa sells food in a stall in the Magdalena market. She sells various meats which she buys in the slaughterhouse in Ayacucho, and at some opportunities she buys animals in the San Juan market before taking them to the slaughterhouse. She does this every week day from 7am - 1pm.

Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles; money that she will invest in buying cattle and goats. Rosa's dream is to improve her business, for her son to finish his studies and be a successful professional.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1500; money that will be invested in buying cattle and goats/Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno y caprino.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro hace 2 años y lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que recibe.

Margot es casada, tiene 27 años, 1 hijo y esta en espera de su segundo hijo, Margot tiene una tienda en una galería cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, el local es alquilado, Margot vende calzados variados para damas y caballeros, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo hace 3 años, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja mensualmente dependiendo de la demanda de sus productos.

Margot necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados de varones. Margot sueña con mejorar su casa, ampliar y hacer crecer su negocio y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Margot has been a member of the Futuro Communiry Bank for two years and what she likes about the Community Bank is the training that she receives.

Margot is married, is 27 years old, has one child, and is expected her second child. Margot has a store in a gallery close to the central market in the city of Ayacucho. Her premises are rented. Margot sells varied footwear for women and men. She has pursued this activity with her husband for 3 years. She buys the products in the city of Lima, where she travels monthly depending on the demand for her products.

Margot needs a loan of 3000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of footwear for men. Margot dreams of improving her home, of expanding and growing her business, and of her son becoming a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Margot needs a loan of 3000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of shoes for men.

loans.name: Martha Marina

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.

Martha es viuda, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Martha viaja a las ferias de la región dos veces a la semana de donde compra cereales variados, papa y todo lo que pueda comercializar, luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho para comercializarlo a los comerciantes del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija. Además Martha tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, la administración de este negocio lo realiza su hija.

Martha necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, arveja y haba. Los sueños de Martha son construir el segundo piso de su casa, ampliar su negocio y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Dignity Communal Bank.

Martha is 43 years old, a widow, and has 4 children. Martha travels to the markets in the region twice a week where she buys various grains, potatoes, and anything else that she can sell. She then transports them to the city of Ayacucho to sell them to the merchants in the supply market in Ayacucho, an activity that her daughter helps her with. In addition, Martha has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, meat, and her daughter manages this business.

Martha needs a loan of 1,000 soles ($350), which will be used to buy corn, peas, and hava beans. Martha’s dreams are to build a second floor for her home, expand her business, and that her children one day become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, peas, and hava beans

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.

Fany es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Fany junto a su esposo viajan a la ciudad de Andahuaylas que se ubica a 8 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde compran ganado vacuno y porcino de la feria de ese distrito, luego lo transportan a la feria de Matara para comercializarlo y también a las ferias de Ccejelambras y San Juan. Además Fany tiene un carro que alquila a su sobrino para que realice taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Fany necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno. Fany sueña con tener capital propio, ampliar su negocios, construir su casa y sacar a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Fany is a member of the Dignidad (Dignity) microfinance institute.

Fany is a 36-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 4 children. Fany and her husband travel to the city of Andahuaylas, located 8 hours from the city of Ayacucho, where they purchase cows and pigs at the district market. They then take their cattle to the markets of Matara, Cejelambras and San Juan in order to sell them. Additionally, Fany has a car that she rents out to her nephew so that he can provide taxi services in the city of Ayacucho.

Fany needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of cattle. Fany dreams of having capital, expanding her businesses, building her own house, and helping her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.

Berta es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Bertrha tiene una tienda en su casa que se ubica en la ultima cuadra del Jr. San Martín, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, bebidas, regalos y productos novedosos que compra en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada 6 meses, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo. Además Berta tiene una mototaxi que alquila y cobra diariamente.

Berta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar. Los sueños de Berta son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una tienda mayorista en el centro de la ciudad y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Community Bank Dignidad (‘Dignity’). Bertha lives with her common-law partner, is 30 years old, and has 2 children. Bertha has a store in her home that is located in the last block of Jr. San Martín, where she sells snacks, vegetables, meat, drinks, gifts, and novelty items that she buys in the city of Lima where she travels each 6 months. She manages this with the help of her son. Also, Bertha has a mototaxi (a motorcycle with sidecar) that she rents dialy to earn money. Bertha needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she would invest to buy rice, oil, and sugar. Bertha’s dreams are for her children to become professionals, to have a better store in the center of the city, and to construct the second floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bertha needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she would invest to buy rice, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
La señora María Z. D. Gutiérrez  tiene 59 años vive en la Avenida Primavera sin número del distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco,  departamento D. la Libertad  Perú.
Cursó hasta el tercer año D. Primaria y no continuo estudiando porque no contaba con el apoyo económico D. sus padres, tuvo que trabajar desD. muy pequeña y no podía ir a la escuela.
Se casó D. dieciséis años con el señor Víctor Gutiérrez y tuvieron dos hijas mujeres y un hijo varón, una D. sus hijas falleció a causa D. neumonía.  Su hijo varón y su hija mujer ahora viven cerca D. ella pero ya no dependen económicamente, son casados.
Tiene un negocio que consiste en comprar animales, engordarlos y venderlos en carne, lo realiza en su propia casa.
Manifiesta que gracias a Manuela Ramos obtuvo un préstamo D. 300 con lo que compró dos cerdos y algunos cuyes los que volvió a vender en muy buen precio, devolvió su préstamo en cuatro meses. D. esto ya hace mucho tiempo  manifiesta.
Con este préstamo D. 600 soles y comprará cerdos y gallinas, que los venderá en carne porque así obtendrá mejores ganancias. Su préstamo lo devolverá en cuatro meses.
María pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Trabajo, es una socia que está muy contenta con su Banco.
Su gran sueño es reunir a toda su familia y celebrar una gran fiesta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Z. D. G. is 59 years old and lives on Primavera Avenue in Mache, Otuzco in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through the 3rd year of elementary school but could not continue studying since her parents could not support her. She had to work since she was very young and could not attend school. She got married when she was 16 to Victor G. and they have two daughters and one son. One of their daughters died of pneumonia. Her son and daughter now live close to her but are now independent and are married with their own families. She runs a business purchasing animals, feeding them (fattening them up) and selling them; she runs it out of her own home. Thanks to the Manuela Ramos organization, she received a $100 loan which she used to purchase 2 pigs and some guinea pigs which she sold for a good price. She paid back her loan in 4 months. With this loan of $225 she will purchase pigs and chickens which she will sell and hopefully earn more income. She will repay her loan in 4 months. Maria belongs to the Working Women village bank and is very glad to be a member of the bank. She would love to gather who whole family in order to have a great celebration.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock in order to sell at retail prices

loans.name: Mirtha Luzveni

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha Luzveni C. C.  tiene veintiséis años  y vive en la Avenida Primavera sin número en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios porque se casó, con Javier Graus  y tienen dos hijos que son estudiantes.
Su actual negocio consiste en la compra venta de quesillo y carne al menudeo, ella comenta que tiene que trabajar desde muy temprano para poder colocar a buen precio sus productos.
El primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles que le sirvieron muchísimo para poder ampliar su negocio. Su préstamo es devuelto en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de 300 soles nuevamente y le servirán para comprar quesillo y poder hacer queso, para incrementar el costo. Lo devolverá en cuatro meses.
Ella es nueva en el Banco Comunal pero se siente muy contenta debido a que gracias a el a aprendido a organizarse.
Mirtha sueña con hacer un viaje al extranjero .
Actualmente Mirtha piensa que es mejor cuando las mujeres están organizadas por eso pertenece también al Comedor Popular de la Primavera y al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirtha Luzveni C. C. is 26 years old and lives on Primavera Avenue in the Macha district, located in the province of Otuzco in the state of La Libertad. She studied until the third year of secondary school and then couldn't continue with her studies because she married Javier Graus. They have two children who are students. Her current business consists of buying and selling quesillo and meat to retail customers. She says that she has to start work very early in the morning in order to get a good price for her products. The first loan obtained from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles and that greatly helped her increase the size of the business. Her loan was repaid in four months. With this loan of 300 soles, again it will allow her to buy quesillo and to be able to make cheese in order to increase the cost. It will be repaid in four months. She is new in the communal bank but feels very happy because thanks to the bank she has learned to organize herself. Mirtha dreams of taking a trip to a foreign country. Right now Mirtha thinks that it's better when women are organized and for that reason she belongs to the "Comedor Popular de la Primavera" organization and to the "Mujeres de Trabajo" Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quesillo

loans.name: Modesta Clemencia

texts.es:
La señora Modesta Clemencia tiene 54 años  y vive en el jirón las Fábricas Manzana  R lote 8B  Semirustica El Bosque Trujillo La Libertad Perú.
La señora Modesta era educada por su madrina Maruja Bonillas pero falleció cuando terminaba su educación primaria entonces retornó a la casa paterna donD. por razones económicas no pudo seguir estudiando.
Modesta se casó a los 15 años D. edad, con Manuel S.  y tuvo siete hijos, pero él era muy irresponsable, manifiesta ella, por lo que se separaron  y tuvo que empezar a trabajar sola y poder mantener a sus hijos. Alquiló la mitad D. su casa a una fábrica y ese dinero le sirvió para capitalizar un pequeño negocio D. almuerzo, que vendía a los obreros D. la fábrica.
Luego la invitaron a participar en el Banco Comunal Trabajo y Amor que pertenece a Credimujer y obtuvo un préstamo D. 300 soles con lo que compró artículos D. primera necesidad. 
Actualmente alquila un local granD. que ella administra y se llama “Mi querida Selva”, allí se venD. comida a la carta original D. la selva, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre.
Con este préstamo D. 900 soles, que pagará en 4 meses,  mandará traer D. la selva; pescado, cecina, chorizo.
Modesta sueña con tener algún día una chatarrería, porque dice que la chatarra no se malogra nunca. 
Ella dice el Banco es muy importante, disciplina nuestra vida.
texts.en:
Señora Modesta Clemencia is 54 years old, and she lives in the area of Fábricas Manzana R lote 8B Semirustica, El Bosque, Trujillo La Libertad, Perú. Señora Modesta was educated by her godmother Marjua Bonillas, but Marjua died as she was finishing her primary education. She returned to her father’s home where for economic reasons she couldn’t continue studying. Señora Modesta was married when she was 15 years old to Manuel S.. She has seven children, but she tells us he was very irresponsible and because of this they separated and she had to begin working along to be able to support her children. She rented out half her house to a factory, and this money served as capitol for a small luncheon business, where she sells picnic lunches to the factory. Later, she was invited to participate in the Community Bank “Trabajo y Amor”, (Or, “Work and Love”), that belongs to Credimujer and she got a loan for 300 soles with which she bought articles of basic necessity. At the moment she rents a big store that she runs and calls “Mi quierida Selva” (or, “My Dear Jungle”). Here she sells food sent straight from the jungle. She is a very hardworking and happy woman. With this loan of 900 soles, which she would repay in 4 months, she would order things from the jungle: fish, dried meat, chorizo. Modesta dreams of some day having a scrap yard, because it is said that scrap doesn’t ever go bad. She says that the bank is very important, and gives discipline to her life. .

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Nelva Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Nelva Jesús V. D. Luján tiene 58 años y vive en la avenida Campo Bello 216 en el distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Ella estudio hasta el cuarto año D. educación primaria, no pudo continuar sus estudios porque en el tiempo en el que estudiaba la escuela tenia solamente hasta ese grado y su madre no la podía enviar a otro lugar para que continúe sus estudios.
Se casó muy joven con Alipio Luján y tuvo un hijo, enviudó y tuvo un segundo compromiso del cual tiene seis hijos, actualmente dependen D. ella dos un varón y una mujer.
Nelva Jesús se dedica a vender víveres y comida, recuerda que empezó con muy poco capital, pero ahora su negocio ha crecido y es en su propia casa.
Recuerda que su primer préstamo con Manuela Ramos fue D. 300 soles para ser devueltos en 4 meses, los invirtió en carne víveres y cerveza, tiene cerca D. nueve años en el banco comunal.
Con este préstamo D. S/ 300 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará víveres para surtir su negocio. 
Su gran sueño es tener una linda casa en Trujillo y vivir allí con sus hijos.
Actualmente solamente pertenece a su Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Mache.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelva Jesus V. D. L. is 58 years old and lives on Campo Bello avenue in Mache, Otuzco in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through the 4th year of elementary school, but could not continue studying because in that time, her school only taught through the 4th graD. and her mother couldn't afford to send her elsewhere to continue her studies.
