She has a good salary from her work in the ambulance and her work at home. She has an accounting service but she is not satisfied with her equipment for that service. That is is the reason why she wants to take a loan through WWI in the amount of 700 KM. In this way she will be able to offer better service and get more clients. She hopes that she will make give good service and that her daughter will maybe work together with her.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her accounting service

loans.name: Mrs. Tol Lorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank in Traeuy Troeng Village in Kandal Province has 15 members. They hope to use the loan in different ways. Mrs. Tol L. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who cultivates her crops twice a year. In the rainy season, she cultivates rice and also grows vegetables in the dry season.

Her husband, Mr. Chorn Horn, is a candy and ice-cream seller. Since his business is going well, he wishes to sell it door-to-door. Unfortunately, he does not have a mode of transportation to carry this out. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Tol L., has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy a motorbike for her husband's business.

Mrs. Tol L. is a 32-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one, aged five years old, is too young to work or study. Mrs. Chhuon S. could not provide a photo of herself so her husband is shown in the picture instead.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband's candy and ice-cream business.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Nantri

texts.id: Ni Ketut Nantri sudah menjadi peternak babi sejak ia menikah sekitar 30 tahun yang lalu, usaha ini dilakukannya untuk membantu suaminya membiayai kehidupan keluarganya termasuk menyekolahkan anak-anaknya. Saat ini Ni Ketut Nantri tinggal berdua dengan suaminya karena anak-anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal dengan keluarganya masing-masing. Ni Ketut Nantri selama ini sangat berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya, namun ia mengaku sering mengalami kesulitan karena modal usaha yang sedikit. Melalui program DINARI Ni Ketut Nantri mendapat pinjaman modal sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan setelah akhir periode. Ni Ketut Nantri mempergunakan modal tersebut  untuk membeli 3 ekor bibit babi penggemukan. Dalam satu periode pemeliharaan selama 5 bulan Ni Ketut Nantri bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 250.000,- s/d Rp. 300.000,- per ekornya. Ibu  Ketut Nantri saat ini sangat bersemangat dalam mengembangkan usahanya dan berharap usahanya bisa lebih berkembang sehingga dapat meningkatkan pendapatan keluarganya .
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Nantri is already a pig farmer, since she married 30 years ago, she is in this business to help her husband pay for family expenses, including children's schooling. Today Ni Ketut Nantri lives only with her husband, since their children are married, and live with their own families. Ni Ketut Nantri likes to expand her businses, since she admits that she often faces difficulties, due to limited little. Through DINARI program Ni Ketut Nantri obtain a 6 month loan for Rp. 5,000,000,- with end of period payment (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-10,000.00). Ni Ketut Nantri used that capital to buy 3 fattening piglets. In a 5 month period Ni Ketut Nantri could obtain profit of Rp. 250,000 - Rp. 300,000/piglet. Mrs Ketut Nantri is enthusiastic now to expand her business, and hopes it could flourish and increase family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy piglets (Membeli anak babi)

loans.name: Mrs. Savoeurn Saroeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank is located in Traeuy Troeng Village in the Kandal Province and consists of 18 members. Mrs. Savoeurn S. is the village bank president. She is a laborer who works in the for-profit field. She is a 36-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a vegetable farmer while the youngest one is attending the local school.

Although Mrs. Savoeurn S.'s family members have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Savoeurn S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a new breeding pig business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Hourn S. was not able to provide a photo of herself so her husband is pictured instead.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a new breeding pig business.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna P., 45, has been selling a variety of groceries in the in Tlock Dangkor Market since 2003. She typically earns around US$5 per day. She lives in Ptas Rong Commune, Pursat Province with her husband and their eight children, one of whom is married and all of whom are students. Her husband, Mr. Thy Rin, 46, is a farmer who grows rice for a living. 

To increase family's income, Vanna want to improve her business, but she lacks capital. Hence, she would like to request a loan of $1,100 USD. With the loan, she will increase her grocery inventory, buy piglets to raise, buy pig food, and buy fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase groceries, piglets, pig food, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Šemsa

texts.en: ŠEmsa Mehanović, 54, lives alone in the village of Stjepan Polje near Gračanica. Since retiring, she has operated a business raising both chickens and cows. She wants to improve her business and so is requesting a loan of $550 to buy a milk machine. Her work around cows will be much easier with this machine, and she will have more time for other labours involving her animals.  Emsa’s hope is to buy more cows and have her own little farm.

loans.use: To buy a milk machine

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Mrs. Saom N. is 37 years old and is the mother of three children, aged 18, 15, 13, who are enrolled in school. She and her husband work as rice farmers and typically make about $3 to $4 per day from selling her crops in the market. 

Mrs. Saom N. and her husband would like to purchase cows to assist with plowing. During a plowing period, this couple has to hire oxen from a neighbor by exchanging rice or paying money, so to reduce this expense, Mrs. Saom N. would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase cows of her own to accelerate her plowing work.

loans.use: To purchase cows to help plow her rice fields

loans.name: Salohat

texts.ru:
Назарова Хайринисо 12 лет как занимается предпринимательской деятельности. Родилась она в 1964 году, замужем и имеет 5 детей. Она торгует исключительно женскими одеждами. Ее ассортимент состоит из женских национальных штанов из атласа и адраса с вышивкою и с тесьмой ручной работы. Это очень модно носить невестам. Она сама привозит свой товар с Коканда. Место ее деятельности оптовый рынок «Корвон» города Душанбе, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. 
Хайринисо хочет получить займ 2000 сомони и закупить новый товар.
texts.en:
A woman with a great deal of experience in entrepreneurial activities, Salohat was born in 1960. She is married and has four children. For eight years Salohat has sold wedding apparel. She carries unusually beautiful scarves and crystal and stone-encrusted stoles, as well as a variety of fabrics for traditional Muslim wedding dresses. She sells her wares in the Korvon wholesale marketplace, and purchases her goods in Tashkent and Samarkand. Salohat wishes to take out a loan in the amount of $600 (approximately 2000 Tajikistan somoni) for the purchase of fabric.


Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Азимуродов Рустам родился 24 сентября 1963 года, женат. Он торговец обуви уже много лет и в его ассортименте можно найти все разновидности обуви, начиная от самых современных для деловых встреч и заканчивая для самых маленьких джентльменов.  А торгует он на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат и помогает ему в этом жена. Азимуродов закупает товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон».  У Рустама в рынке есть лавка и у него есть мечта, как у любого начинающего предпринимателя, он хочет купить себе магазин. В связи с этим и с целью расширения наименование товаров ему бы хотелось получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони.
texts.en:
Rustam A. was born on September 24, 1963, he is married. He has been selling shoes for many years and all kinds of shoes could be found in his assortment starting from very modern business shoes to shoes for little gentlemen. He sells on the Hayre market in the town of Vahdat and his wife is also helping him. Rustam buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Kovron. Rustam has a vendor space on the market and like any beginning entrepreneur he has a dream to have his own store. To make this possible and to expand the variety of offered merchandise, he wants to get a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni ($1,175USD).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal shoes

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn P. is 27 years old and married with two little children. She works as a rice farmer, making only a meager sum to cover her daily expenses. Her husband is employed by a company as a taxi driver and can generally make $5.00 a day.

Every working day, her husband gets to his workplace by a motor-taxi, spending about $1.50. So Mrs.P. would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase a motorbike for her husband to reduce this expense.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to reduce transportation costs.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng C., 28, is a rice farmer who lives with one little child in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1990, she has been growing rice to earn a living and makes less than one dollar per day. Normally, her farm is just enough for the family, and she usually sells it out for extra profit as annual output is low. Farmers almost totally depend on the weather to farm, as in most of the provinces there is no irrigation system yet. Currently, the weather conditions are going better, but still some places there is little rain. 

Her husband, Mao Hun, 25, has a business catching fish from the lake in the village and sells them to the market to earn an approximately $1.50 in profits per day. To catch more fish, Leng has requested a loan of $500 to purchase more fishing tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Sedija

texts.en:
Sedija Tufekčić was born in 1966. She lives together with her two daughters in Gnojnica near Gračanica. She is married and her husband works in Slovenija. Her younger daughter, Berina, is in primary school and the older, Belma, helps Sedija in her work.

Sedija works as a hairdresser at home. She is also busy with poultry every few months. This is her first loan with WWI in the amount of 1000 KM. She will use this loan to buy some equipment for her work and buy some poultry. Her wish is to open her own hairdressing salon where she will work together with her daughter Belma.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her home beauty salon

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn S., 52, sells rice noodles in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Rice noodles are served with blue or red soup. The blue soup is only cooked with fish and the red can be cooked with chicken or pork. There are many kinds of vegetables that they have to eat with the rice noodles, such as banana blossom, long bean, and many kinds of mints. 

Mrs. S.'s husband, Va Thoeun, 53, drives a motor-taxi around the market in the village. The couple has five children, one of whom is a student. The others are employed as garment factory workers. 

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of US$1100 to build a bigger stand to sell groceries so they can earn extra profits.

loans.use: To build a stand and sell groceries.

loans.name: Reum

texts.en:
Mrs. Reum H., 23, is farmer who earns 10,000 Riel ($2.50 USD) per day. She and her husband, Mr. Mao Pho, 27, live with their two young children in the family's home in Pteah Rong Commune, Pursat Province. 

The traditional farming season is starting in Cambodia. Mrs. Reum prepared farming tools such as a plough, oxen, and cart for her farming business. Now her business is going well and she needs fertilizer for her rice crop, but she is lacking money. Hence, she would like to request a loan of 300,000 Riel ($75.00 USD) to purchase fertilizer to use on her rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on her rice crop

loans.name: Salohat

texts.ru:
Женщина с большим опытом предпринимательской деятельности Салохат  родилась 1960 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Салохат 8 лет занимается продажей свадебных нарядов. У нее необыкновенно красивые шарфы и накидки с различными  стразами и камнями, разнообразные ткани для национальных платьев (наших мусульманских обрядов) свадебных мероприятий. Местом ее деятельности является оптовый рынок "Корвон". Закупает она товар в Ташкенте и Самарканде.
Салохат для закупа тканей хочет получить займ 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Salohat was born in 1960 an she is a woman with extensive experience in entrepreneurship. She is married and has four children. Salohat has been selling wedding gowns for eight years. She sells incredibly beautiful scarves and headpieces with gemstones and rhinestones, different kinds of fabrics for Tajik national dresses for weddings (particularly for Muslim ceremonies). Her business is located on the wholesale market Kovron. She buys the merchandise in Tashkent and Samarkand. Salohat wants to get a loan for 2,000 somoni ($600USD) to buy fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru:
Сафаровой Гулизор 30 лет и она замужем. После окончания Вуза она захотела открыть свое дело, в котором помогли родители. Она 4 года как занимается торговлей женскими одеждами. Данный момент она арендует лавку на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. У нее самые востребованные товары производства Турции.  В ее ассортименте товара можно увидеть махровые и велюровые халаты, хлопчатобумажные и шелковые пижамы и пеньюары, также очень красивые постельные белье и полотенца хорошего качества. Закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая . Для Гулизор качество товара очень важно, может поэтому у нее много постоянных клиентов.  
Гулизор хочет увеличить наименование товара и соответственно увеличить свой товарооборот. С помощью программы Кива она хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони.
texts.en:
Gulizor S. is 30 years old and married. After graduating from university she decided to start her own business in which she got help from her parents. She has been selling women's clothing for four years now. At this time she is renting a space on the Kovron market in the city of Dushanbe. She sells merchandise from Turkey which are in very high demand. Some of the items in her stock include terry and velour robes, cotton and silk pajamas and peignoirs (undergarments), and also very beautiful bedding sets and high quality towels. She buys the items from manufacturers in China. The quality of her merchandise is very important to Gulizor and this is probably why she has so many regular customers.

Gulizor wants to increase the variety of her merchandise and accordingly increase sales and circulation of her inventory. With the help of Kiva she wants to get a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni ($900USD).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy robes

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назире 27 лет и у нее 2 детей. После развода с мужем ей пришлось тяжело, она решила открыть свой бизнес. Начала предпринимательскую деятельность с продажи женской одежды. Сейчас она торгует женской и детской одеждой на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте товара можно увидеть махровые и велюровые халаты для женщин и девочек. Закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая. У нее много клиентов из пригородов столицы.  
С наступления осени Назира хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони для закупа халатов чтоб увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Nazira is 27 years old and has two children. After divorcing her husband the times got tough and she decided to start her own business. She began her entrepreneurship career with sales of women's clothing. Right now she is selling women's and children's clothing on the wholesale market of Korvon in Dushanbe. Some of the items that could be found in her stock are terry and velour robes for women and girls. She buys her stock from the suppliers in China. She has many customers from the capital's suburbs.

With the arrival of autumn, Nazira wants to get a loan for 2,000 somoni ($600USD) to buy robes and increase circulation of merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy robes

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Худойдодова Шарофат родилась 1967 года, разведенная. С 1996 года она  занимается предпринимательской деятельности. В оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе торгует  женскими одеждами. Ее ассортимент состоит из женских национальных штанов с различными вышивками и тесьмою ручной работы, которые она сама шьет дома. А также отрезы с готовой набивкой для национальных платьев со штанами производства Коканд.  Закупает она товар у оптовых поставщиков в том же рынке.  
С помощью программы Кива Шарофат хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для увеличения ассортиментов.
texts.en:
Sharofat H. was born in 1967, she is divorced. Since 1996 she has been running her own business. She is selling women's clothing on the wholesale market Kovron in Dushanbe. Her assortment consists of women's national pants with different types of hand-made embroidery and stitching, which she makes herself. She also sells ready-made fabric cuts for national dresses and pants made by Kockand. She buys the merchandise from wholesalers on the same market. With the help of Kiva, Sharofat wants to get a loan for 4,000 somoni ($1,175USD) to increase the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy national clothing (pants)

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru:
Молодой предприниматель с высшим образованием 5 лет занимается торговлей. Чориев Асрор родился 1980 года, женат и имеет 2 детей. Он в оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе торгует женскими платками. В его ассортименте разнообразные  короткие и длинные платки для разного мероприятия из натурального шелка и шифона. Платки с вышивкой, со стразами, камнями, тюлями и платки с необыкновенными узорами.  Закупает он товар у оптовых поставщиков из Турции.  
Асрор хочет получить займ 4000 сомони для увеличения ассортимента и тем самым увеличить свой товарооборот.
texts.en:
Asror C. is a young entrepreneur with university education and has been in the retail business for five years. He was born in 1980, is married and has two children. He sells women's scarves on the wholesale market Korvon in the city of Dushanbe. His stock includes different kinds of short and long scarves for various occasions made from natural silk and chiffon. There are scarves with embroidery, gemstones, rhinestones, tulles and scarves with extraordinary design patterns. He buys the stock from wholesale suppliers from Turkey.

Asror wants to get a loan for 4,000 somoni ($1,175USD) to increase assortment and by that increase the circulation of his inventory stock.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of scarves

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham T. is a fisherman, who sells his catch to the fishmongers to preserve and send to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina. Abraham has completed Senior High school, and he is married with 3 children. His wife is a trader. Abraham has been catching and selling fish to the fishmongers since 1999. He is responsible for paying his children's school fees and other utility bills. His loan will be used to add to his capital to buy nets, an outboard motor, and other fishing materials which he needs to make his work more efficient. He hopes to use the new profits to reinvest into the business, which will increase sales and eventually increase his income.

loans.use: To buy nets, an outboard motor and other fishing materials

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac G. is married and has 2 children. He has received no formal education. Isaac sells firewood, which is the major source of fuel to the fishmongers at Ayiso, which he has done since 1999. His wife is a trader. Isaac uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and other utility bills. Isaac will use the loan to purchase more firewood for sale to meet the increase in demand of his costumers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to increase sales to enable him get enough money to offer his children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to meet the increase in demand of his costumers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells used clothing at Bantama in Elmina. Veronica has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a security guard. Veronica has been selling used clothing since 2003. She is responsible for feeding the family and utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Esiawonam

texts.en: Esiawonam S. sells fish that she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina. Esiawonam has received no formal education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a sugar cane syrup distiller. Esiawonam has been selling fish since 2006. She is responsible for paying for the feeding of the family and the utility bills. Her loan will be used to to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest into the business to increase her sales which will eventually increase his income.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice A. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Rejoice sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a fisherman. Rejoice uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Rejoice will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever increasing customers' demands. With the new profits, Rejoice plans to reinvest in the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: Rejoice will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever increasing customers' demands.

loans.name: Wanu

texts.en:
Wanu is married with 3 children. She has been a chicken, ice cream, and juice seller since 1998. Every day she works from 7:30 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

Wanu is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding items to her current stock

loans.name: Pili's Tufahamiane Group

texts.en:
Pili is 45 years old. She is married with 10 children, aged between 26 and 7. She has run her own shop since 2004. Every day she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Pili is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Subeha.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Mme S. est commercante tres experimentee evoluant dans la vente de chaussures . Ces chaussures sont tres demandees dans la periode des fetes regiligieuses a la fin de ce mois.
Par consequent , elle sollicite le renforcement de son stock pour satisfaire sa demande
texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a very experienced businesswoman in the field of shoe sals. The shoes she sells are very much in demand at the period of religious holidays at the end of this month. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to reinforce her inventory so as to satisfy demand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her working capital
